She then pulled out a ring and showed it to me. I tried it on and it was really pretty so I took a picture and said I wanted to show my fiance and discuss with him before making the purchase. However I then looked at the price tag and the ring was $1695! Wayyyyyy out of my budget. : ( Plus the ring looked very similar to the one I had found at Jared , but was nearly 3X the cost! I was polite and just told her I think I would just return my other ring today and think about the other ring purchase after discussing with my fiance. She then seemed irritated and lead me to the back to get my refund. Before she left me she said "sorry about that !" And then walked off. When I left the store after my return she did not acknowledge me at all... I was very shocked and displeased with both of my experiences ... Especially after hearing all of the commercials that boast about the excellent customer service and great prices from "cutting out the middle man". I will be returning to have my engagement ring checked regularly so I don't void my warranty but I don't think I would want to go through the process of looking for jewelry there in the future...

I've been here twice, and they are KILLING it. Just damn near smashing it. Everything I put in my face at El Pavo is perfect.

Note: I am hella drunk right now from my latest lunch at El Pavo. I dragged another Yelper here after we were disappointed at the corkage fee at another neighborhood spot. 

El Pavo puts out these beautiful tacos and desserts that I cannot fault. I have ordered the ceviche twice, and I have fallen in love twice. Must love octopus. But the tacos? And the chilaquiles? And the flan? Holy Jesus. Just go hungry. Eat your face off. Get the rum cake. Get the flan. Get the anything; it is all perfect. 

This visit, I had the fried fish tacos, and my friend had the hanger steak tacos. Both of us were happily satisfied. The last time I went, my buddy got the chicken tacos, and they were happily delighted. 

El Pavo has the right mix of comfortable neighborhood spot and really stellar food. I feel like this is the kind of place I would find in Mexico or southern Texas that is comfortable, warm, tasty. My server was present and kind without being cloying. It was winning all around. I cannot wait to return, and I love sending friends here. This place is the real deal. 

I love everything about this place, and I want them to be around for a long, long time. Bravo, El Pavo!

Accessibility notes: door opens out. Space between tables for mobility devices. Bathrooms are singles. No Braille menu or signage.

How many times are you writing a Yelp review and trying to decide three stars or four, one star or two?   Bistro 1111 SCREAMS 3-stars.    Yes  * * *  no more, no less!   It is mediocre in the most grandiose way!   The epitome of average.    Non-offensive yet bland.  It is to bars what the Holiday Inn is to Hotels.   It is to restaurants what Keanu Reeves is to acting.   If you had your senior prom in an Elks Lodge you know what I am talking about. 

We went there for happy hour yesterday.   They should rename it because happy is too big an emotion for  Bistro 1111.   Are you happy when you are drifting in and out of sleep? Maybe, a little bit... it is kind of like that.  

I had some amazingly middle of the road sliders and my wife had a plate of mussels, the plates weren't too big yet they weren't too small either they were...well...you get the picture.  We found the drinks to be perfectly adequate and the service was sufficient.   

If you follow my Yelp reviews you know that I am a cheapskate.   Bistro 1111 caters to cheapskates so you would think that I might have loved it a little more.    The drinks are $5 the food is $5.    When you are dividing the bill for a table of twelve it really is quite easy.   

The next time I am seeking an unobjectionable dining experience Bistro 1111 is exactly where I will be!

A wonderful little Italian restaurant with plenty of options! I always order pizza when I come here! The pizzas are always a delicious crispy thin crust. I definitely recommend adding on as many toppings as you can! I always add on mushrooms, green peppers, jalapeños and feta cheese! I usually get a meat pizza however I ordered the Quattro pizza with added vegetables last time I went. I enjoyed the pizza but was a like thrown off with a pizza containing cheddar cheese. It was still tasty but I don't know if I would order it again. I prefer pizza with Italian cheeses instead of cheddar. I still absolutely love this restaurant though!

Loved it! The mission is a great pit stop on your day trip to Santa Barbara. They have a self guided tour (only $4), and the picture spots are amazing. It's a nice glimpse into California's history and a good throwback to those 5th grade mission projects :)

Holy crap. Total splurge, but I loved every dollar and minute of it. I love trying new things, so tapas is always a good bet. We got:

- Chorizo Pamplona. Mmm...I didn't care for the three little side things that came with it; give me straight chorizo (and okay, the bread too) and I'm good!

- Aged manchego cheese with truffled lavender honey-- my husband actually ordered this, and I ended up LOVING it more than he did. I wanted to order another one but I figured I needed to try more on the menu. However, I didn't want it to end and was quite sad when it did.

- Oysters with cava gratina and grapefruit espuma-- I'm not a fan of grapefruit at all, but this was amazing. Perfectly balanced shot of oyster on a spoon (comes with three).

- Almejas con chorizo (clams and chorizo)-- can't get enough of chorizo, and add clams to it, and I'm in heaven! The broth was so good; I was sad the bread was gone, and I thought briefly of drinking it, but alas, more dishes were waiting...

- Piquillos rellenos (crab-stuffed peppers)-- #^%#$%#^& two of my favorite things, rolled together, on a hot sizzling plate with some kind of sauce. I almost swooned; it was SO good.

- Revuelto (shrimp & wild mushroom shirred eggs)-- this came with truffle toast, whose smell catapulted me right back to Yard House, which threw me back home in California. It was like my kind of comfort food with a twist. Awesome, awesome dish.

- Amada's Empanada (spinach, manchego cheese, and artichoke)-- kind of like the one at Alma de Cuba, meaning it was freakin' good and I loved it.

We ended the savory portion of our meal with the "Entrecute a la Catalana" (prime sirloin with catalan spinach, membrillo, and goat cheese). It was good, but was less shiny compared to the other dishes. If we had this earlier in our meal (say, one of the first dishes), it definitely would have stood out more. But because this was the last thing, my taste buds were on overload and the only thing that stood out was the goat cheese (which I don't particularly care for, btw). 

Dessert was the leche frita (fried vanilla cream, chocolate hazelnut sauce, and hazelnut ice cream). Perfect pairing; it wasn't too sweet. There was this fried thing that went on as garnish, and I really appreciated it, as it provided a bit of salt to balance the sweetness of the rest of the dish.

Obviously, this is a crapload of food for only two people, but what can I say...my husband and I love good food and we were starving. ;) Next time, I'd like to try the chef's tasting menu. Aaaaand I'm so taking all my visiting friends to Amada!

P.S. MAJOR bonus points for the bag hooks they have at the bar tables. It's little things like that make me happy.

This is not an easy place to get a table for dinner, but I think after you wait it out you'll see why it's so popular.  We lucked out and nabbed a bar table that had just opened up as we walked in the door.  Bar seating is first come/first served and they have some comfy booths with table service in there.  There was also a piano player providing live music.

Best thing about this place though is definitely the menu.  Every entree is under 475 calories!  I love that you can order anything you want without inducing too much guilt.  We started out with a cherry tomato flatbread appetizer, which was tasty and a good size for a table of four to share.  I had the scallops for my main course and was pleasantly surprised by how large the portions were (all under 475 calories?!).  I didn't feel bad at all about polishing off the whole thing.  Happily, low calorie doesn't equate with low flavor - my dining companions had two specials, the Pacific halibut and buffalo steak, both of which they also polished off.  

Dessert was also a nice not-too-decadent treat.  They have a brilliant system for selling desserts:  instead of bringing you a dessert tray where you pick something and they bring it out a few minutes later, they actually bring fresh desserts to your table and immediately serve you whichever one you pick.  All the desserts are made in small glasses so that you get just enough for one person, but not so much that you feel guilty about finishing off every last crumb.  Perfect portion size.  I LOVED my chocolate cake with chocolate mousse - so delicious and rich, but just right for one person!

The prices are very reasonable for the quality of the food, and they have a decent wine/cocktail menu as well.  Service was excellent.  We left feeling full, happy, and wondering if maybe we'd found a new favorite restaurant.

Super happy with Dr. Alex (pediatric) and Linda (Pediatric office Manager).
Also I go to RTD for adult dental cleanings downstairs.  Dr. Liberman (sp??) is great, too.

Our only complaint?  very limited (sometime none) Satruday or evening hours.  Kids need appointments after 3 PM and after 6 PM many days.

It is very hard to get my kid the coveted 5 PM cleaning and I book it months in advance.  (And then, life happens.)

Wish they had more weekend and evening hours.  (Maybe open at noon one day a week and work until 8 PM?) Yes, staff hates that - but patients love it!

I had this place come up as a recommendation for Mexican food. They were packed for dinner on a Saturday and for good reason. The food is delicious. I got a mojado burrito which came with rice, sour cream and pico de gallo. Orders come with free chips and you get access to a self serve salsa bar. I loved the black one and the light green salsa. Service was very fast and friendly. Despite the massive number of orders coming through in person, over the phone etc they seem to have a great method set up to get orders out. They do have alcohol here and plenty of seating both indoors and outside. Would definitely come back to try something else.

Panera is perfect for what it is.  A good and easy spot for a quick lunch or early dinner.  It's easy and the food is pretty good.  I'm personally in love with their Power Salad.  it's delicious!  It's a spinach salad with eggs, bacon, onion rings pieces and almonds.  So good! AND actually ok for you too.  If you're watching calories, you can't go wrong here.  Plus, the ingredients will make sure you stay full for a good bit of time.

I love that they've chosen to add calories to their menus.  i actually think it makes them feel more transparent.  Plus, it helps me to decide what fits into my plan for the day.  Let's face it, I love to eat but I certainly can't afford to eat with abandon and not be aware of calories.  I SO WISH I COULD!  

Anyways, Panera Bread is a good choice for an easy, quick and delicious meal.  They have something for everyone!

Delicious donuts - I got the half dozen classics donuts to share with no high expectations thinking it was just donuts but wow... not sure how they can make plain chocolate donut and cake donuts so addicting? Told myself I was only going to eat 1 but ended up eating 2 donuts. (this is coming from someone who doesn't even like donuts that much). As I'm writing this review I'm thinking about eating another one... 

If you're a donut lover you'll love this place!! Must try :)
Lovely indoor farmer's market in ardmore. It's a classy affair and prices are higher than the Trader Joe's next door. But they have every possible food stand in there: from Di Brunos to cupcakes.

If I could stand on top of the roof of this diner with an over sized banner that made people on Pyramid Highway turn up the road and come eat here I totally would.  

This location has been the home of many failed eateries in the past.  I really hope that this one sticks because they are truly an asset to the community as far as great food and great service goes.

The place looks a tad confusing from the outside, red and blue sticky lights boarder the door not signifying the american diner food they serve but rather it seems to pay homage to the Mexican place that was there before them.  It throws you off a little bit and I think they could re-brand that portion of the decor but once you walk inside everything goes back to what you might expect.  The walls are a bright yellow, which I loved but my husband had mixed feelings about.  The place is open and airy and really does remind you of a regular plain old diner.  Nothing super special about it but still nice and clean.

The food offerings are 100% american diner.  Burgers, sandwiches, soup, salad and super amazing great all day breakfast.  The staff was very pleasant and I get the feeling that everyone who works there is family.  Prices are low and the food portions are huge so it's a great value for your buck.  The food is great and my husbands eggs Benedict had the thickest ham slices this side of the east coast that you will ever see on an eggs Benedict order.  

We left super happy and excited to go back.  Go check it out and tell your friends.  Lets work as a community to give this place the support it needs to stay alive and successful for years to come!

Pretty freakin' tasty for Thai in Columbia, IL.

The bf and I ventured over the river because this place came highly recommended to us by a nice lady and her husband. Well, we were not disappointed.

We did not order an appetizer but everything sounded tasty.

For our main courses we had:
Red Curry - fresh red chili, bamboo shoot, coconut milk, green pepper and basil with chicken. $9.95
&
Vegetarian Green Curry - fresh green chili, bamboo shoot, coconut, milk, green pepper, mushroom, eggplant, broccoli, peas, baby corn and basil with tofu. $9.95

Both curries were flavorful and smelled amazing. The veggies were fresh and the food came out uber fast.

The server was friendly and helpful. The ambiance was kind of whatever but it was clean. The spice level was LOW. I love spicy food and I ordered the highest level on the menu. Don't get me wrong, the food was good but it was not spicy. the bf doesn't like his food as spicy as I do and he said he could have handled the level of heat my curry was at. I chatted with the server a bit and next time we visit I will be ordering a level 10. 

I'm looking forward to our next trip out there.

I will admit it...I am a total tea snob! I can't drink coffee so tea is 'my thing.'  And while, I bought my first Snake River Tea because I like to shop local, I continue to buy it because it is AMAZING! 

My favorite is the Coconut Chai Black Tea...YUM!

I have only been in the shop once. The service was excellent. Very cute decor. And great snacks to be had. Love that they have board games available as well. 

Mainly I order online or at a shop closer to home.

Savory & Sweet crepes were amazing! Cafe con Leche was great, too. Cute place that a local took us to on our trip to Tampa, and we enjoyed it very much. 

I loved my Bon Curry Chicken savory crepe- very filling and interesting! The teens devoured their sweet crepes in 60 seconds or less. Nice atmosphere for smaller groups or for couples.

I am second generation Tampa Native and I have been going to O'Briens pub since i was legally able to drink. My friends and I spent many a St Paddy's day getting smashed and fighting in the parking lot at the old location. 
I love this pub, and it has a ton of regulars that show up every single weekend and weekday to drink, eat, socialize, and have a good time.
There is inside and patio seating (dog friendly& smoking allowed) a stage, and an area to chuck some darts. The patio has huge A/C units for summer and heaters for winter.  There is live music on weekends and trivia on Wednesdays, and other things going on during the week. 
The bar is fully stocked with whatever you need to get your Guinness fix or hard liquor buzz. They have a great happy hour and I have enjoyed it many times. 
The food is typical Irish Pub food and I really enjoy the Shepards pie, bangers and mash, and their burgers. It's a big menu with many different choices for the whole family. 
The St Patricks day celebration is a huge event with all kinds of locals and regulars coming out of the woodwork to Party like the Irish. 
Do yourself a favor and give them a try, maybe you'll become a regular too.

I love me some Papa Roux! I make sure to stop by for lunch every time I travel up to Indy. 

Papa Roux is definitely a hole in the wall type of joint. The place is small and the walls are full of notes hand written by the staff and customers. 

They have a variety of po boy sandwiches and rice plate with your choice of gator, chicken, pork, catfish, shrimp and many others. I'm partial to the pork po boy, their pork is very tasty!

They don't have brand sodas, which was interesting. Aside from the Stevia soda (which I had never seen outside of vegan/vegetarian/ health food stores and I really like) you can order from a selection of sodas that are simply referenced by their flavor, as well as iced tea and lemonade. 

After you place your order you look for a place to sit, which can be a challenge during their peak times (make sure to avoid the lunch rush for a more pleasant experience). Once seated you'll have a card with a list of sides, and once you've picked two you can put the card up in the center piece and a server will come to take your side order. Sides are "free" and you can order as many as you like, but only two at a time. I was pleasantly surprised by this, as it allows you to try a little bit of everything, portions of sides are small, but again, you can have as many as you like. I am partial to the etouffe, it's a little spicy, but really good. 

I feel that they falter a little with the sides, for my taste I find that the cornbread is too sweet, and the garlic stew is too spicy. They experiment with the bread pudding and the two time I've tried it I was disappointed, once it had bacon and was really watery, more recently they had a boo berry variation for Halloween. Other items like French bread and apple sauce are basic enough to be consistently OK. 

The servers are always very friendly, and it's a very high energy environment, they are usually yelling for orders, sides and stuff like napkins and silver ware.

All in all it's definitely worth checking out, if only for their great po boys.

You ever look at an old-timey photo and said, "Wow, I'd love to visit that time?" Me neither, but if I did, the Libertine would be the closest I ever need to come to those days of gin flips and old-fashioneds. This is a grown-up bar- and they serve real drinks. I had a Pisco Sour when I went, and their drinks pull no punches. The decor is very warm feeling- exposed woods and a shelving system that made me shivery in a good way. I managed to sample a variety of things before I realized I'd been steadily drinking for 2 hours- and I'd just have to come back again. Oh, poor me.

Something for everyone here.  We've been a few times and the good thing is this is the place usually everyone can agree on when you can't agree on a place to go.

The menu has lots of options and the portion sizes are hefty.  Considering I usually get two meals out of any entree because the portions are generous, I'd say the prices are awfully fair too.  

I like their beers that I've tried, I don't LOVE any of them but they are good.  Recently tried he Oktoberfest and it was a nice seasonal brew.  The ribs were surprisingly good (it's not a know rib place) as well as the parmesan crusted chicken.

I love Farmer's Market. It reminds me of my summers in Houston. As a child, my grandmother would take us to the market every Saturday to get fresh fruit and veggies.

This market was a flee and farmers market mix because they had clothes, shoes, custom made items, fresh meat, fruit and vegetables. They even had eateries and a pet store in the market. 

We purchased some Milk Chocolate covered Bacon which has been on my bucket list to try. Also, we brought freshly made donuts and caramel  covered apples.  

I truly enjoyed visiting this market and look forward to coming again.

Loved this place! Was lucky enough to go with a group of friends to a "Clue" party here.  I couldn't think of a more perfect place to have a Clue party since the Stotesbury Mansion looks like exactly what you would imagine the Clue Mansion to look like...complete with a Library, a Study and a Billiards room.  This is a beautiful space to hold an event and we greatly enjoyed the Clue party as well as all of the classic cocktails that were served. One miss of the evening though was that there were no non-alcoholic options. This is a big miss for people who may be non-drinkers or designated drivers. With that would love to go to another event here.

Had an enjoyable lunch here. There was really no one eating lunch here on a Monday- so our large group got right in.  Everyone seemed to like the shareable appetizers- most notably the chorizo fries (they were gobbled up fast!).  My Mediterranean salad with chicken was quite nice. A little more like a dip sampler than a salad- but I was happy because I love Mediterranean dips.

Seems like this would be a neat place to hang out in the evening with all the fun games and cocktails.

Oh thank the lord for Han Dynasty.  Now THIS is Chinese food, the kind of place where they have an Americanized menu for the lovers of "fried rice" and an Authentic menu for us ex-pats who crave mama's home cooking.

This place is located in a scrummy strip mall, but don't let that bug you too much.  Surprisingly this is one of the few non-chain restaurants that are open on a Saturday at 2:30, which is when we showed up ravenously hungry.  So you can imagine that our waiter was a bit flustered at the amount of food we ordered.  Or maybe not, but he was friendly enough not to say anything.

When it comes to my scallion pancakes, I'm pretty demanding; they have to be crisp and fluffy and thin -- which, thankfully, Han Dynasty did perfectly, accompanied with a soy dipping sauce that complimented the oniony of it all.  The dandan noodles were full of the kind of hot and spicy that made you want to chug gallons of water while stuffing your face at the same time -- simply put, flavourful and yum.  Pork belly and preserved vegetables were perfect compliments of fatty rich and salty, plus reminded me of home... not a bad thing, mind you!  Chicken with hot dry peppers were surprisingly addictive and delicious.

Interior is pleasantly decorated and amazingly clean -- I'd suggest getting a table, since the booths tend to wiggle and wobble depending on the antics of your neighbours.

I used to love Tiffin, and then my husband and I ate in and were served frozen samosa appetizers, when we questioned it we were met with almost no remorse and just general bad service, so we stopped eating there. Fast forward to the new menu offerings... 

It was like deja vu. The new Indo-Chinese menu was perfection the first time I ordered. Or, well so I thought. Turns out they messed up the order and gave us the manchurian sauce with the paneer and the garlic sauce with the cauliflower. So the next time we ordered the garlic sauce/paneer combo we were not happy to see the oily weird sauce that had been with our cauliflower. MInd you this sauce is marked as "hot" on the menu. Nothing remotely hot about it. 

I was also super bummed to see that the green curry was WHITE, unlike the last time I ordered it when it was actually green and lit my mouth up in the most delicious way. This order was just bland and practically curry free.There was also something off about the Malai Kofta. 

The food was so awful that I actually took it back to the restaurant (we'd picked it up) and asked for my money back. After standing there for fifteen minutes they finally acknowledged me. When I explained that the curry was non-existant, the garlic sauce  mishap and the eh Malai Kofta they focused on the Malai Kofta and asked their chef to taste it, then told me it was fine. Ok, great what about the white curry sauce? No acknowledgement, the mixup on the sauces the first time that led us to believe we were ordering one thing and not the other. Whatever. We placed an order at Ekta while waiting for the refund. Too bad, because when Tiffin is good they are amazing, but when they are bad they are beyond terrible. I won't be back, not worth the risk.

The Stillery is amazing. If I would have found this place my first day, I might have eaten here five days in a row. I'm a huge fan of smoky cocktails, and the Smokin' Mule did not disappoint. Plus who doesn't like drinking out of a mason jar? The salads are huge and reasonably priced, if you fancy yourself a break from BBQ and tacos. But if you want artery clogging goodness, the hot chicken Mac and cheese is probably the best thing I ate during my five days in Nashville, and we had a lot of great meals. The chicken was perfectly spicy, crispy on the outside and super tender and moist (I really freaking hate that word, that's how good this chicken is) on the inside. The cheese sauce on the Mac is creamy and amazing, plus bonus points for using cavatappi noodles! The bartender Michael is super sweet - gotta love that southern hospitality!

FOOTWEAR DEPARTMENT:

Customer service is exceptional. Big shout out to Myron - footwear specialist, who helped me find a perfect fitting work shoes. I bought a pair I loved but somehow wasn't the right size. So I came in to do an exchange. He was able to find me the same pair in wide width which I needed. He also suggested another pair of Brooks that I might come back for on my next visit. The customer service staff and cashier were also very friendly and welcoming. Thanks for a great shopping experience!

I've been here twice now and loved it both times! Had the Halibut the first time, the Mackerel this time, both were great. The atmospheres a throw back that just feels nice to be in. The service is friendly and accommodating with a great explanation of the different fish that are available. This is a must have when you're in the area and want to experience a great smoked fish meal. The fish spread is a really nice lighter meal that is a lot like a tuna salad but made with smoked fish, it's delicious! 
The potato salad is different but amazing, you gotta try it. 
This is going to be a regular stop for me from now on, it is just so good.

I love the fact that there's a Vegan sweet go to so close to me.  It's like an oasis in crazy milk and butter desert world.  I usually just stick with the old school.  There's no fruit or crazy concoction but if you wanted one of those you can pick from what's in their fridge or create your own. 

The old school is a simple cinnamon roll with frosting. A lot of frosting. I'll say it again, a lot of frosting. 

There's a strawberry shortcake and you can create a bout a thousand different versions with all sorts of toppings. 

My only complain is that customer service can vary. Sometimes it's great and sometimes me and my group feel like we're hassle to the cashier.  The makers typically don't interact with the customers unless they are handing off an order but at least they do it in a personable way.  

I have a sense that the workers are not vegan which is ok but at least have a sense of why we are vegan.

Loved the cortadito!! Great Cubano coffee drink with 1/2 milk, 1/2 expresso for $2.75. Since there's a $5 minimum I also got a coconut flan. Both were delicious. Seriously, I am in love with the cortadito. It was very sweet. And although served in a small cup there was a lot of caffeine. I look forward to coming back for a pastelito and sandwich.

Edited 6/28 to add: OMG I had the lechon sandwich and it was AMAZING!!!! It was huge. I could only eat half of it - and for $9.95 that's a good deal! I made it a meal for an extra $3 or so / got the DELICIOUS sweet plantains and a coke. I also tried. Pastelito carne (beef and pork) and it was tremendous!

We came, we swooned, we wanted it all.
OK, I live in the Bay Area. I go to North Beach so I have seen some Italian bakeries but  this one truly had one of the most diverse and unusual selections I have seen.
The cannoli were awesome and beautifully presented. It took us forever to decide what to have as there were choices I had not seen before, like the lemon ricotta(?) pie my daughter selected, light and tangy and different. My other daughter choose a berry and cantaloupe sorbet which was also wonderful. I didn't try the clove cookies shaped like  bones or the spumoni cake but seriously wanted to. We bought some anise cookies to go and they were melt in your mouth wonderful later when we ate them. 
It is probably good I don't live near here but I would recommend this place to anyone who likes pasties, cookies or ice cream and perhaps wants to try something they have never had before.

UPDATE: Review #2

I can now leg press 500lbs. 

My 12 weeks with Natali have ended. I am going to try things on my own for the next 12 weeks, and then hopefully start again (I am more than willing but she is becoming even busier with clients!)

I have lost some pounds and definitely some inches. I have had some physical and emotional setbacks, so I may have been able to do better, but Natali never once even hinted that she was unhappy with me. She understands that her clients are doing the best they can for that given moment. She is ONLY full on encouragement, positivity and she is darn funny. 

I also improved beyond the numbers:

1. I am a lot stronger physically. 

2. I am no longer even remotely intimidated by the gym. I'm right next to all the other serious lifters and they are awesome, inclusive people. No one cares about my work out if I am doing my own thing and not impeding someone else. I have the right to be in the gym just like everyone else.

3. I WANT to go to the gym. I WANT to lift heavy (and I mean heavy). I have always loved it but Natali helped me cultivate it more by challenging me. 

4. Meal planning gets the job done.

5. I am a beast in the gym. Natali knew it when she met me and she kept challenging me until I figured it out myself. And when I did it changed me.

6. YOU are the deciding factor. Do the work and get the results. Figure out who you are. Natali has your back.

I can now leg press 500lbs. With ease. I know I said it before but I went from lifting 175 to 500 in 12 weeks. 

I cannot wait to try it alone for 12 weeks and go back to the teacher after doing my homework.

I love Kumi!!

Having been around for almost a year now, Kumi has made quite the name for itself.  Their gel nails are amazing and very comparable in pricing.  All of their nail techs now are very professional and extremely talented.  I saw Chantelle and she gave me my best set of nails I've ever had.  She took her time to make sure all of them were even and perfect.  

Kumi also has guarantee that if your nails for any reason get messed up within a week, they will fix it for no charge.  (I'm pretty sure they still have this policy as far as I know) 

My biggest problems when coming to Kumi is deciding on what colour or design I want  another thing is that because they are so wonderful, they do book up quite fast.  I would call as soon as you know your schedule and book in to make sure you can get the time you want.  It takes about 2 hrs give or take, so clear your schedule for it :) it's definitely worth it!

I love that they have free parking, if they didn't I probably would not come here since it's right downtown.  Their space is modern and elegant and I love the art on the wall.  It keeps getting updated every time I go! 

If you're looking for a great set of nails, try to get in with Kumi! You will not regret it!! And your nails will thank you!!

I love this zoo. It does get pretty busy though. I would highly recommend that you go during the week or in the late afternoon as everyone else is leaving. Everyone always thinks that the best time to go is in the morning. Don't go in the morning, everyone arrives in the morning. 

I highly recommend buying the membership. Parking ($16) is free and you pretty much pay for the membership if you go at least twice in a year. I like the idea of the membership because I don't feel like I'm wasting money by just going to the zoo for a couple hours vs the entire day. Most visits we only see about half or less of the animals and get outta there. We see the other half during the next visit. 

PACK YOUR OWN FOOD AND DRINKS!!!

You're allowed to bring food into the zoo. Don't be that person who spends $12 on a meal (I'm guilty of this every single time I visit the zoo). You can save so much money by bringing your own food. Pick up a small carry cooler from target and a couple of ice packs, you're good to go.

Been wanting to try this place since we moved to Westchase. Conveniently located next to Publix its a very quaint place. We decided to stop in before going to Publix. (Grocery shopping while starving is not good within our family)

Inside the decor is very laid back. I felt as if I was in Southern Cali on the beach for a moment. 

The Chips and Salsa were delicious and we got the Volcano Shrimp to split. Let me preface by saying I LOVE Bang Bang Shrimp from Bonefish, but these top those. Less breading than Bonefish it had a light crunch with a topped with "goodness ". I found out they can be placed on tacos which they have Taco Night on Thursdays. $2.50 Shrimp tacos? OMG....dine in or take out. What?

SOLD! I'm already making my list for this upcoming Thursday! Yes, please!!!

My favorite local gem! So many great plants (indoor and outdoor) and decor! Beautifully curated place and the owner is very helpful.

There's a lot of Knick knacks, vases, and decor ideas here!! Love this place

Woohoo! Finally a great restaurant a few mins from where I live.

Seeing that this place is new and there's been lots of great reviews already my sister and I decided to check it out. And I am so glad we did.

We came in for Lunch on a week day and it was busy. The hostess asked if we had made reservations, we had not but they had one table left (wow thank goodness).

First impression of the building was it reminded me of a greenhouse/ mod workshop (hence the name). It was clean and bright with all the Windows. I immediately fell in love with the place.

Our Server was extremely knowledgeable with the wine menu and made the decision on what wine we should drink. I can't remember the exact wine I had but needless to say it was delicious and went well with our lunch. Which we ordered for starters the beet salad. The salad looked beautiful like art on a plate, which also tasted amazing. For mains I had the Salmon which was cooked to perfection and my sister had the perogies (which she raved about). All the elements on our dishes were fresh, light, and vibrant.

The desserts were nice and compact in a mason jar type. Both were tasty and I would definitely have again.

This place is going to be on number one on my lists, I can't wait to try the brunch!

Came here for my Mom's birthday and was floored.  The place is small, gorgeous and family-run, with Chef John in the back and his lovely wife Liz treating us like we were dining in their home.  And the food was spectacular.

The following is what we had (descriptions are from their menu, because there's no way I'd remember everything).

Appetizers:

- Santa Rosa Island Crab Salad with Papaya & Fresh Ginger-Lime Dressing
- Lobster & Angelhair Salad with Asparagus, Sundried Tomatoes, Olives & Basil
- Artichoke Heart Salad with Fresh Herb Vinaigrette

My favorite appetizer was probably the lobster and angel hair salad.  But the flavors in every appetizer were so distinct and deliberate and never overpowering.  Chef John is just an incredible talent.

Entrees:

- Colorado Lamb Loin with Roasted Garlic, Tom Shepherd's Green Beans & Rosemary
- Grilled Duck with Fresh Peach Chutney, Exotic Grains & Ginger Sauce

Liz informed us these are the two dishes the restaurant is known for, and it's easy to see why.  I liked the lamb slightly more, but you can't go wrong with either.

The one hiccup of the night came when we were informed that they only had one more serving of the lamb and it was slightly overcooked.  We tried it and sadly had to send it back.  But to make up for it, Chef John had about 2/3 of an order of the duck (it didn't have the leg) and sent it out on the house.  Extremely gracious.

Desserts:

I wish I could remember what all the desserts were, but the unanimous favorite for us was the homemade peach ice cream with almond cookies.  It was stunningly good.

If you have a special night coming up and want to make a first class go of it, look no further.  This was flat-out one of the best meals I've had so far this year, if not the best.

This place has it all - excellent food, excellent service, and great ambiance.  I love the laid back feel.  And great location, especially if you're staying at the Moonrise like we were.

We actually ate here twice in several days!  The first night was terrific.  We got the Brussels Sprouts appetizer, which is outstanding.  Piping hot, served in a skillet with sizzling onions, garlic, pancetta pieces and a few slices of cheese, this was a great appetizer.  And the pasta bolognese was one of the best bolognese dishes we've had at any Italian restaurant, not just in St. Louis.  Pasta was just the right texture, sauce was tasty, meaty, just a hint of sweetness, and nice and thick.  Just delicious.  Salad (Caesar) was also very good.

And just outstanding service.  Our server, Lauren, said it was her first night.  You'd NEVER have known that.  She was just excellent, checking on us at the right times, refilling dishes, etc.   Even the young man hosting who seated us was great, a really personable guy who made us feel welcome the minute we entered the restaurant.  And it didn't end there, either.  Every single staff member acknowledged us, engaged us, and made us feel truly welcomed.

The second night we returned, the food wasn't quite as good as the first night but still more than solid, we just got different dishes is all.  Still got the great Brussels Sprouts appetizer, but this time got spaghetti and meatballs and chicken scalloping.  Both were very good but just not great like the bolognese was.  But we ate at the bar and Reagan, our bartender and server, did a wonderful job.  She even made us a drink she hadn't made before (French 75) and absolutely nailed it based on the recipe we found.  She was really personable, we had a great time talking to her and interacting with not only her but again other staff/managers.  They were all truly kind and generous and welcoming.  

This was one of very few Italian restaurants that satisfied on multiple levels. This was a fun restaurant to eat at and we will definitely return when in St. Louis.

Absolutely phenomenal. The interior with the red leather booths and red grain wood makes for a sensory overload of gorgeousness. We started with the trio guacamole which included a seared tuna which was great. We then moved to the fried chicken which were boneless and served with an incredible dipping sauce. We were greeted by Cincinnati's very own Cain Turner who exudes total professionalism with a hint of neighborly love. Every single taco is worth the order. This restaurant is Indianapolis next "go to" spot!!

We love this Vet! 

Setting up an appointment is always easy and never a pain. The staff are very welcoming and helpful when it comes to booking an appointment. They do a great job of finding the appointment time that works for you. 

Our cat Grady has gone in twice for general check up and shots. The Doctors are very friendly and good with him. They are very careful to keep him calm and treat him with love. The doctors have helped us in understanding our cat's behavior and needs. I have been to vet's in the past where they tried to make you feel guilty about how you take care of your pet (Your CAT HAS LOST 10 pounds what the heck are you doing to him!) and this vet didn't do that at all! They were very good at making sure we knew we were doing a good job and they offered suggestions on how we can continue to keep our cat in good health. 

I love the fact that they will call you back after the appointment or surgery to see how everything is going. After we had our cat "Fixed" the called and I told the Doctor about how my cat loves to eat the household plants and we caught him with leaves in his cone. She laughed at how cute he was and was glad to hear Grady was doing well. 

Grady has received shots, boosters, exams, micro-chipped, and has been "Fixed" at this clinic and we have had zero complications. 

They have been really good to us and our cat. I will continue to use this clinic while I live in the Edmonton area. (Also if it's a stressful event for a patient's owner the Keg and Cork liquor store is in the same plaza)

A good friend of mine introduced me to this place and while I usually don't care for delis, I think I'm in love with Purebread. The vizsla sandwich is bomb. I found myself craving one really badly one day and had to have it for lunch. Wow, it instantly hit the spot, and put me in a food coma within an hour, but it was so worth it.

There is a lot of potential at Pearl Diver. The interior is gorgeous and well-themed and the outdoor space makes you feel that you are transported to an island. Plus I love the cabanas and the overall vibe is really cool and interesting. 
However, there were some pretty significant issues. First, you have to order at the bar or window connected to the outdoor space. I definitely had more luck at the bar, but just come here planning to wait to order. That alone isn't a dealbreaker though. I'm fine to wait if I'm getting some interesting drinks and delicious food. Unfortunately Pearl Diver didn't deliver there either. While the port to port cocktail was delicious, it only tasted like fruit juice and was very weak. If I'm paying $12 I want it to taste like an adult beverage. I tried the Paloma later and it was better but also very weak and mostly ice. I was excited about the food but bummed when the mushroom and shishito peppers came out with a laughable amount. There were seriously 5 of them on a skewer and the mushrooms were a huge let down and not worth $9 for these items. Luckily the dumplings and dipping sauce were good so it wasn't a total waste. 
At the end of our night we enjoyed talking to the bartender and sampled a shot of the daiquiri which was delicious and what I should have ordered instead of the other fruit heavy beverages I sampled. The bottom line is that I paid $50 leaving hungry and completely sober which makes me grumpy. Luckily I was hanging out with an awesome group of ladies so it wasn't a total loss but I'm not rushing back, especially since it's the new place to be and super popular. Maybe they know something I don't?

Awesome place and everyone is friendly the workers are so delightful and helpful.Its a great night out and the hospitality is awesome.I love going here and will be back.Fyi Wednesday is best priced games and free dinner they have awesome hot dogs!!!

This year, I have become obsessed with ice cream.  Like the way a three year old does.  Like I want it EVERY NIGHT FOR ALWAYS AND FOREVER.

Regardless, by the time I'm done with dinner, I want to get out and move about, which means finding ice cream places farther and farther from the domicile to explore.

Now there are some lovely local chain-type places you can go, and there are also national chains to visit, but Ice Cream 504?  This one is unique.  This is the one to visit when you're feeling adventurous and really want to go out on your comfort game.

1. The owner is amazing.  He's so much fun to chat with, brainstorm with, and find out about the different flavors from.  He's a great guy, and worth the stop just for his charm and wit.

2. The flavors!  Go there and try something you wouldn't expect, like jalapeno ice cream!  We had a sampling of the unique flavors before settling on our palates with our favorites.  I won't even go into it, because they rotate and change, like any great local shop should.  What's in season?  Who knows -- go try it!

If you're looking for fun, either by the scoop, malt, shake, or sundae, head over here to try them out.  You'll be amazed at what you try and what you'll really like, for reals.

I used to love this place. This market is very large with a healthy produce department and non-perishables from around the world. They carry every type of noodle and spice you can think of. If you are an avid foodie, this place stocks a nice selection of odd but tasty delights. I knocked off a couple stars because their stock never changes. They used to have a better fish selection and foreign imports displayed as soon as you walk in, but not anymore. There is a music shop attached to the market that a couple of my previous music groups used to perform at. They carry some great local and some international albums and instruments. I hope this place can pick up the pace a bit and get it's glory back. It's no longer a priority to visit when I'm in Tucson.

So me and the BF wanted to try a different sushi place than our normal pics, so tried this place. I must have visited on a one if their good serving days because we loved our food. It was very good and we even ordered another role. The drinks were good too. We ate inside, although it was an okay day outdoors. I would return!
Have eaten here many times and has been dependable.  This rime the shrimp poboy and bimbo were good but nothing special. It is a lovely, energetic place that definitely has the Nola feel

Delicious Vietnamese restaurant on Magazine street! I came in with a friend on a Thursday night around 7:45. We started with shrimp spring rolls that were very yummy, I especially loved the peanut sauce that came with them! We also both ordered pho. The pho was delicious! I really like that they have small and large sizes of pho and that there are a variety of flavors to choose from! I had the shrimp pho with chicken broth instead of beef broth. The broth was very flavorful and the small was still a huge bowl! While I found myself comparing it to Lilly's spicy shrimp pho (my absolute favorite), I was able to add in the right amount of hoisin and sriracha to make my own version.

The prices were very reasonable (less than $10 for a bowl of pho) and the waitresses were friendly and quick to refill our drinks. Keep in mind that they close at 8:30 so don't try to come in and eat too late! They were nice to let us finish up even after their 8:30 closing time. I will definitely return for more pho!

Food -- 4.5 stars
Price -- 4.5 stars
Service -- 4 stars
Atmosphere -- 4 stars

It's hard to love a sports bar when your quarterback is getting sacked by Clay Matthews on every play. 

I went to the Post last Thursday to watch the Bears-Packers game.The place was full of mostly fellow Bears fans, and we were playing horr.ib.ly., so the vibe was pretty subdued. This place must be awesome when the crowd is revved up, but it's a depressing place when everyone is crying in their beer. 

Even when your team is sucking it up, the Post will give you what you are looking for - tons of screens, attentive service (almost to the point of being aggressive, our waitress seemed to never leave our table), pretty good bar food, and a packed house on big game nights. I didn't see anything crazy special about it, but again, maybe that's because I could take my eyes off the disaster that was happening on screen.

Order: Burger, french onion soup, Caesar salad


Pros: the food was AMAZING for the most part. Loved the ambiance of the cafe and the waiter was amazing & patient (there was 7 of us). Listen the beignet's was off the chain (ha ha ha)! I had like 4 of them suckas with the homey butter. That burger was amazing damn! It needed nothing added to it! 

Cons: french onion soup was ok and not what I was accustomed to. I like croutons and provolone on top of my soup. The flavor and base of the French onion tasted like wine or something. I ate it but wasnt a huge huge fan.

been here twice now. both times after I feel like I need a seriously strong seriously hot shower. the place is so filthy. the ball pit and the foam pit look like they have never been cleaned. the tunnels and slides and all that look so filthy. the mini golf section is black light and picks up on all the dirt on there and it's just retched. gives me the shivers just thinking about it.

that being said, the kids love it. everyone is always having fun in there and jumping and laughing and screaming. my son is nothing but smiles from the minute we walk in. he loses his mind. 

they need to figure out how to clean the place better. I have no idea how considering the place is filled with dirty little kids every day.

I'm going to be fully honest that my drinks tend to taste different each time and they only take the red peppers off my sandwich about 3/4 of the time (and I ask every time), but the people are so nice, there's free wi-fi, it's not a chain, and I just love it. The food is good quality as well. 

It's within walking distance of my house and it's a great place to go during the day or at night. It DOES tend to get crowded on the nights they have musicians (which is often), but that's part of the fun. They also showcase local artists each month. 

Oh and for those that are noise-adverse I know they opened a back building just for that purpose.

THIS is a really cool place! A "Revived historic inn with antique-industrial decor & American tavern."
It was cold and crappy-rainy when we were up there a few days ago and found this really nice comfortable, cozy, eclectic fun place. I had a Gran Marnier, to warm my bones, the "Chipotle Shrimp Tacos". Chipotle Marinated Shrimp, Black Bean Puree, Pickled Asian Slaw, Tropical Fruit Salsa, Avocado-YUM!! Not sure why I got the shrimp tacos because, gee! I can get those anytime I want here in West Palm Beach, lol! But they sounded good and were really were. I have to say that when I have gotten them here in Florida there's not much shrimp, but these?? There were a lot of shrimp and they were really good! My boyfriend had the "Sout Side Beef Sangwitch". A Sliced Steak, Giardiniera Relish, Gruyère, Au Jus Grilled Long Roll with fries. I would go back if I do go back into that area. But there are so many great places up there that I may never make it.
The waitress was very friendly and accommodating. I just loved the town and the whole ambiance of this place.
Hopefully this makes someone's choice of where to go to easier to choose.

Here  is a fantastic place for you to try. We went last night with our neighbors. I got the shrimp Mediterranean salad and my boyfriend got the salmon dinner. Both delicious and highly recommend. Our neighbors got the Gyros and they also said they loved it. We will definitely be back. Everything is made up fresh so you can customize your order. Very clean which is always one of my pet peeves. Manny the manager, was so friendly and knowledgeable. He answered all our questions. We even sat outside cuz it was a nice evening. They also have beer and wine.

I go to Hope's pretty often, usually after gorging on pizza at Peace A Pizza. My favorite, and probably EVERYONE's FAVORITE are the chocolate chip cookies. I also love the white chocolate and double chocolate, and in the fall, Pumpkin Cookies. MMM-mmmmmm!!! At Christmas time, it's the sugar cookies. You can't go go wrong at Hope's.

Well, I noticed a fellow yelper that I definitely have had conversations about the local Korean food around here. I saw that they had kim-bab which is a classic Korean style sushi roll. We had to come. 

I mean yeah ok, I've made my own bibimbap before so when I saw that we were getting a new restaurant, I had to try it out and see if it really tasted like how it was when I was a kid. 

Well the kim-bab, uh-mazing! I love kim-bab. I hope they open up more ideas on what they put inside. My aunt would make me a spicy dried squid kim-bab that I love eating. I know a lot of people would like it. I wonder if I could give them that idea. Hmmmm 

Well, we got the spicy pork fresh bowl, the spicy pork Bowl, the marinated beef bowl, spicy wings, and the shrimp fried rice. The kids ate it all up. The miso soup that came with it complimented each bite of the spicy pork fresh bowl.

It reminded me of when I would eat at my aunts house and she would make a soybean soup, aka Korean miso style soup with the kimbab or bibimbap. It's really nice to see a lot of different Korean culture growing here in the reno sparks area. It reminds me of when I was growing up. 

We couldn't get enough so we ordered more Togo. Spicy pork Bowl and the soft tofu vegetable rice, oh and the japchae. I tried the soft tofu soup bowl when I got home. Oh my wowza, ok ok if you know me my favorite Korean food is the soft tofu soup. I love that all day everyday. So when I tasted the bowl it tasted exactly like the soup, but just without it coming out piping hot and the broth. Oh my wow. I wish I would've gotten that in the beginning. I can't wait to eat it tomorrow.

Oh polyesters, you are so cookey and I love it!!! 

If you are searching for anything burning man, hoop dancing, or unique, this is your place!! The staff is very friendly, and quick to help you find what you are looking for!

This is one of my favorite little gems of midtown! It's right next door to sup,(an amazing sandwich and soup shop) so every time I go to sup, I have to stop in yo polyesters on my way in and see what fun new items they have!!! 

Stop in, you will be so happy you did!

It's soon to open back up I love it new bartender's same love and feel games are up and running!!  Can't wait until it's ready but it's looking great !!! Soft open now bring ya ppl to get back into the groove!!!

This is my absolute favorite Thai restaurant along the central coast. I love that the food tastes authentic and the flavors are bold. The pad see ew was perfectly savory and was bursting with umami! The crab appetizers were PHENOMENAL. The crab felt like it was melting in your mouth in every bite, along with the creamy cheese. The mint leaf chicken was also incredibly savory and tangy too. I'm usually really picky about any kind of Asian food, especially since I'm originally from the Mecca of Asian cuisines. But this restaurant gives me a taste of home :)

i have sorta mixed feelings about penang. the service weirded me out a bit. we must've had 4 different waiters stop by our table in the first 5 minutes after sitting down to try to get our orders. hold your horses, people! and one of the waiters just came up to our table and stared at us for a while before speaking. ummm.. creepy.

but anyways, penang definitely has a flair for southeast asian cuisine. i came with my friend for an early dinner one weekend and we decided to split two dishes: the green curry chicken in a clay pot (casserole) and the shrimp with string beans malaysian style. with two bowls of rice, of course.

the string beans dish was awesome. i love when dishes are spiced just perfectly, and this one in particular reminded me of home and all the good restaurants in socal.

i was less impressed with the green curry chicken casserole. it was a bit watered down for my taste and as a result, not as spicy. i've definitely had better before. but overall, not a bad experience. 3.5 stars, rounding up.

In on a Five Star Spree I must say. Everywhere I have been for lunch has been so fun and fulfilling. Cafe Reconcile has been part of it. Today for lunch I have got a good hearty meal. I have had the Salmon with macaroni and greens with pork plus turkey necks that was delicious for 27 bucks!! I heard of their brunch options so I may re edit this review to include that lol!! I love the fact that this spot deals with youth and help them on being waitors and waittresses. You can definitely see the kids getting on site job training. They help with running food and I do believe some helps out in the kitchen. So I really feel like you're dining in with a good cause. The menu tend to vary a lot but I highly suggest this place for lunch if you can make it.

It took a long time to get a reservation here, and it was worth the wait! Super cool ambiance and decor. Love the little marketplace up front! The drink menu is so creative and the presentation is gorgeous. We got the chef's tasting menu and enjoyed hummus, baba ganoush, labne, tabouli - all done so well and very fresh. The pita was so puffy and light, we couldn't get enough! The guys had the ribeye steak and the girls went for the swordfish kebabs. Everything was so flavorful it was ridiculous. Can't wait to go back again!

Traveling off the other parts of Nola and found this beautiful music village! It's something straight out of HOoks movie and I just love the fact that it's tucked away but still obvious that it's a site to enter. they have so many contraption and cool inventions around the whole place that it took me a couple of hours to enjoy every little piece!

Ahhh, I love Global Foods in Kirkwood! They have just about anything you could want... Minus the strong smell of fish at the international market on Olive. 

I don't get the chance to shop here often, but whenever I do, it's a huge treat. I love to parouse the aisles and find new specialty items. Their produce prices are also surprisingly reasonable! 

The flags above food sections make shopping easy. 

Bottom line: clean, lots of selection, friendly staff, good prices.

Never had a better banh-mi or "shredded chicken hoagie." Always fresh. Always amazing. Love that I can also grab a Ritter Sport bar and a drink while I wait. I would gladly eat a fu-wah hoagie a couple times a week if I could.

4 stars for the for the food! 

This place is overly casual for the quality of food. At first site it's layout & ambiance is of a slightly upscale fast-food restaurant, like a Long John Silver's or something.  
Our server seemed tired- I'm not sure he really enjoys his job there at Fresh Off The Hook. 
With just 2 severs & less than 5 tables in/out the entire time we were there this place feels slow but seems great for older couples/groups.  

We went for restaurant week & Fresh Off The Hook didn't disappoint in the area of food!
*Clam chowder- flavorful but could of been heartier (would have loved to see malt vinegar on the table but that might not be a Boise thing). 
*Cod Creole with prawns, veggies,  & wild rice- incredible flavor & perfect spice happening
*Steak with bereniase sauce,  Scallops, & mashers-as expected...my boyfriend enjoyed it. 
*Halibut with pesto sauce, veggies, & wild rice- pesto sauce was done well & could of even had more in the dish. 
Portions were great all around. 
*Dessert: cheesecake was super basic but the toffee bread pudding was really good- however it was super rich & filling. 

Decent wine selection but I asked for hot tea & would have liked to get some honey & lemon with it- didn't want to bother the server more, no biggie. 

Regular menu pricing isn't too bad at all for a seafood restaurant. 

Will we be back? I'm not sure...maybe. I could see taking my parents here, they would enjoy- no doubt.

How have I not written a review yet?
On a general Vietnamese level, Lilly's gets a 4 star review. But since I really am okay with it just being my go-to Pho joint, it gets 5 stars.

Lilly herself gets 10 stars. Seriously, I feel like I've walked into my grandmother's with the warm welcome I get there. It's incredible. And it's what keeps me going back.

Well, that and her rolls. I've NEVER had rolls better than the Lilly's Spring Rolls and the something Spicy Roll are incredible. I particularly love the Spicy one. It's just perfect!!

The pho is really good too. I really like the spicy shrimp pho a lot.

My friends have all also liked what they have gotten. I just miss some of dishes from my favorite Vietnamese place back in Houston.

Also they have like 40 different drink options, including guava juice!! Speaking, she remembers that I don't like coconut and gives me a guava candy with my ticket every time.

Tavern is so consistently good that I have to bump them up to 5 stars. My latest visit was for their brunch since their 2-for-1 drink options are too enticing. There is a reason why Tavern is listed among the best brunch places in Nashville. Their food is tasty and not the run of the mill brunch options. Tavern is definitely my favorite of the M street concepts (Virago, Whiskey Kitchen, etc.)

I got their red sangria for both of my brunch drinks and my friend got the peach bellini both times as well. I got the Benedict Uno which has short rib and poached eggs on an English muffin with a Tabasco hollandaise. I wasn't sure if I would like the hollandaise so I ordered it on the side. I actually really loved the sauce but it was so rice that I am glad it was on the side. The short rib was tasty albeit just a tad dry but the hollandaise fixed that. My friend got the Benedict Dos. This has smoked salmon and poached eggs on an English muffin with a caper hollandaise. This was so yummy. I had a bite of hers and then I wanted more. 

I got to give a shoutout to our server, Tim. He was so nice and friendly and provided us with exceptional service. Two other staff members came around to check on us too, so I was just really impressed with the service all around. 

A great casual brunch spot with something for everyone. They also have some great healthier options for those that aren't wanting to indulge.

Such a good pizza and salad spot! Highly recommend when you are in Reno. The many different options they have here is what keeps me coming back. They have traditional pizzas with meat and pepperoni such as the Z carnivore pizza etc but they also have veggie pizza options and vegan pizza options which really impressed me being vegetarian.

I personally love their Tuscan mushroom pizza and pear/Gorgonzola salad! The Tuscan mushroom pizza consists of house made roasted garlic sauce, mozzarella cremini, shittake, and button mushrooms with Carmelized onions feta and truffle oil!!! Such a flavorful combination and what's better it is vegetarian. Their crust is super fresh, and the right amount of crispy, all the ingredients and sauces mix well together...everything is standard perfection when it comes to the combo! The pear and Gorgonzola salad consists of mixed greens, pear slices, walnuts and their balsamic vinaigrette. Both the pizza and salad together is bomb. Another option you can do is also make any salad into a pizza so that's pretty cool.

I haven't tried the other pizzas but my family has tried them and also recommends the Napoli and ZBQ. To be honest all of them sound good! They also serve chicken wings! 

Shout out to the workers who helped us-Robert, Carlo, Chris and of course the owners Maria and Noel who introduced themselves to us as well. All are so helpful, professional, friendly, very efficient and overall just good people. It always helps when the workers are so kind and welcoming to their loyal customers. Definitely recommend this pizza place for sure!

Reasons to love JBs:
1. one of the only bars that still charges $3 for Kenzinger
2. the burger. BEST burger in Philly. OMG, that burger
3. great venue on the 2nd floor for live music

I live really close so I come here pretty frequently. Great food, great beer... they also got paper menus pretty recently so you no longer have to strain your eyes looking at the chalkboard to see the menu. Really nothing to complain about.

This is our favorite Indian buffet.  Like all buffets, go early while it's fresh.  With Indian buffets, if you're there right before close, the meat and tofu are gone and it's all sauce.  We've been there 6 or 8 times when my husband has business close by and it's excellent. 
You are greeted when you enter, it's very clean, and white table cloths but casual.  The servers are very attentive.  -for me that means water refills without asking and being available for naan refills if needed.  When you're finished, you get up and go to the cashier who has your bill, so there's no waiting for the check.  (good system especially for the biz crowd)  The buffet has more selections than any other that I know.  The Naan comes out fresh and hot, and if you ask for a refill just wait a little because it's made fresh to order.  Everything on the buffet is very good.  I have prepared alot of Indian food at home and I like it a little spicier, but it still is very flavorful here.  I love the lamb (they don't always have it so sometimes I call ahead).  This is where I first tried goat.  (yeah goat)  It wasn't gamey or strong.  We raised goats for milk on the farm in the 60's (I've since learned more) & some meat (if goat is too old) & cheeses (if aged too long) taste like a goat smells.  (go figure,Yuk)
 
Disclaimer **Take heed**  Don't come right before the lunch time closing.  They seem rude (western standards), and tell you to hurry & get your food because they are going to remove all food shortly.  -and they do remove it the minute they close.  They make their point and since that happened to us once, we make sure to go early.  I've watched it happen to others that came late when we were finishing.  They left, and I'm sure many do not come back.  (it's not our way to be rushed at a meal if we don't want to)
Go early and enjoy!

Met Anish Z. (who is an pretty cool guy) here for the Yelp Tampa UYE today after our initial plans were shifted. We talked about some future ideas for meetups and about the Yelp scene in Miami-a cool thing to learn about.

West Tampa Sandwich Shop is pretty awesome. The aroma when you come in is heavenly. I ordered a steak sandwich, which was nice and juicy. The vegetables on it were fresh and the bread was pressed just right. The french fries were golden and cooked enough to be crispy, but still soft. I also tried their plantain chips, which were decent. I ordered a Mango shake, and although the waitress initially gave me the wrong order, she was really quick and kind about changing it back to the right one. The food wasn't too heavy, but still filling.

I love the atmosphere in the restaurant though. It's like you're dining at home (the place looks like a house after all both on the inside and outside). It's a true Spanish diner in every sense of the name. You can tell who is a local, a regular, and just visiting...and that's part of the cool factor here.

Zahav is a great experience to share with friends. Delicious food and great service. But bring your fat pants. You'll need them.

We enjoyed the tay'im tasting menu. You start with salatim and hummus and let me explain that salatim involves eight (yes I said eight!) different salads. And you will want to try them all. With the fresh hot bread. Let the gluttony begin.

Then get ready for two mezze, one skewer and dessert. And that's per person. Holy cow, you're gonna need some time to digest that. Woof.

But I don't want to mislead you by giving you the impression that this restaurant is all about the quantity...oh no. In fact I typically avoid any place that has reviews that say "the servings were gigantic and we had enough for three days." No, this is not that kind of place.

Complex flavors, tasty new things to try, lovely service. What are you waiting for?

I'm lucky! I have a beautiful woman in my life and we are both foodies. We find the best places to eat! 
I get to eat great treats in the presence of magnificence! 

We stopped in to Kally K's for lunch, not sure what to expect. But, we left highly satisfied and will definitely be going back. 

Antonio, or Tony, took excellent care of us from the moment we entered. He was very polite and made us feel welcome. He immediately took our drink orders, and briefed us on the menu and the Salad Bar. 
He REALLY got my attention when he said there were 2 soups on the bar and one was Clam Chowder! I couldn't wait to pick something off the menu and then get a cup of Chowdah! 

The Clam Chowder was really, really good. Nice chunks of clam and potatoes in a creamy smooth base with lots of taste. Just like it should be!
Funny thing! Up until recently, and I'm talking within the last year or so, I didn't even eat Clam Chowder. My beautiful Fab One convinced me to try some one night, and ever since then I've been on a Chowder Bender! 
I love that Mollusky Medley!

Along with the soup from the Salad Bar, I made myself a nice salad, and other goodies typical for a well stocked bar. Everything was fresh, flavorful and delicious. 

To go with my soup & salad, I ordered the Gyro Sandwich, with fries. What I got was a huge handful of pita packed Wow! The meat was juicy and succulent with that peppery good lamb flavor note. 
And I raved about the Tzatziki sauce that was drizzled over my Gyro!!!! This white bite of dill-liciousness swept me off of my Happy Feet.....I asked, or insisted that Tony congratulate the person responsible for this Heavenly Greek gravy! He did, he did..

Fab one simply ordered the Salad Bar, and started out with a cup of Chowder as well. She smiled the entire time, and I KNOW the look of contentment on that loving face....

Give Kally K's a try, and tell them John & Beth sent ya!

The barbecue is pretty good at this restaurant. Just like most barbecue restaurants they do run out of food the later the day gets. We got a family pack to go. The brisket and the pork are always the best selection to get their. The one thing that is pretty awesome is you can get an ice cream cone for free. The kids and myself love it.

I love Nothing Bundt Cakes!  I actually live near the location on Oracle, but I was driving home today and saw that this second Tucson location has opened.  It's nice to have this second location open up on the other side of town.  I stopped by and got 2 dozen Bunditinis for a work potluck. The store is very nicely decorated and welcoming.  The cashier was very friendly.  The bundt cakes are very cute and tasty.   There are the usual flavors - red velvet is my favorite for sure!

One star off just because I wish it wouldn't close at 6 PM!

I was looking forward to trying the Welcome Diner. We had breakfast there 01/08/17, a Sunday. Our group of four arrived at 10 am and there was a 30 minute wait. 

I love the fact that Welcome Diner has stepped up and saved this mid-century diner. I'll be honest, I always admired the building but never ate in the previous businesses that occupied it. 

After the 30 minute wait, and it was a true 30 minute wait, our group was sat at a booth.

Our waitress let us know they were out of two breakfast items, the Birria y tamal (goat) and the Housemade brioche. Because it was before 11am, only the breakfast menu was available. This left just 11 options to choose from, it seamed like a small list. These are not traditional breakfast items, I would recommend looking at a menu before you go. I asked the server about daily specials and there weren't any. I know our group would have been interested in the brioche and the goat but it wasn't meant to be. 

I ordered the simple omelette, $8, and our friend ordered the same. The guys order a breakfast sandwich (el birote) $9, and a bowl of "pork posole rojo" with eggs, $15. 

Our simple order took over 30 minutes to get to us. The server did bring us a bowl of granola to snack on because the food was taking so long. We never asked about the food, so this was a nice gesture on her part. The granola turned out to be my favorite part of the meal. 

My omelet didn't come with a side, just toast, and no choice on the toast. The waitress said it also came with fruit but it turned out to be a fruit garnish not a side of fruit. My iced tea and the refill were so weak, maybe the weakest iced tea I have ever had. 

The general food review was, everything was ok but not that great. Next time our group gets together we will choose a different breakfast spot.

I've been to Zeppelin a few times and each time have loved the food, wine & cocktails! It's a phenomenal atmosphere, just what South Reno needed! I recommend it to everyone, plates can be shared or not! Desserts were excellent! Great place for lunch, dinner or just drinks!

The service? Well, I do have to say this... there could be a little bit of improvement. On a couple of visits, our waiter/waitress-1. forgot our drink order, 2. didn't know what were in the cocktails, the last visit we were still eating and the waiter interrupted us twice, to ask if he could box up our food or take our plate - while we had food on it still. Another visit, our waitress sat down at our table, gave us our bill and complained about this being her 2nd job... a reason it being no big deal that she didn't ask if we wanted dessert. 

But overall, the food and atmosphere are excellent!

I love the concept of bite size desserts and a shot of coffee-- I'd rather try a bite of a few flavors than have one giant slice. I just wasn't wowed by anything I tried though (coconut, peanut butter cup).

I loved trying out TeeJay's Ice cream. I apparently picked the wrong time to go- Saturday at 3:30pm was when everyone decided to go! I was behind about 4 cars when I first pulled in and the entire experience was about an hour of waiting. They were incredibly nice but this definitely isn't the most efficient drive thru process.

Other than that, the shake was delicious. It tasted like eggnog and the shake was perfectly thick to where I could drink it and felt like I was eating ice cream.

Thanks so much for this event!

I love the scent in this hotel as soon as you enter.  It's a beautiful hotel and fairly new.  The rooms are extravagant and very cozy.  They have a gym and indoor pool and a spa right across from the gym.  I love the view from the gym (3rd floor) and they also have a pool and bar n grill on the roof top.  The only thing that's kind of a bummer is that they don't have a garage for self parking; only valet and I think it was $40 per day.  But it's pretty much nearby all the museums and close by Broadway that either you Uber it or you can walk it.   It's walking distance to all the infamous music center, hall of fames, and the Broadway strip of country music bars.

I've had this place on my "must try" list for awhile. We finally stopped by to give it a whirl. We showed up on a Saturday shortly after opening, 11:30ish. We were the only patrons.

I love the casual feel of the place, but was a little turned off but the "order at the counter and take a number" process. Mainly because it forces guests to excuse themselves from their tables and conversations to order another drink or more food, etc. I would imagine this greatly impacts their profitability as we didn't even bother with getting up to order a second drink and go through the payment/ordering process. But it's a strange model to have when there's a bar in the back corner which would suggest its easy to have a waiter/waitress model, especially judging by the number of employees that were present. It's not a deal breaker, just more of an inconvenience. But......be aware that the pours of wine are VERY stringy, less than a typical glass of wine for an above average price. 

Onto the food....
We started with the guac and Chips which was very bland and very disappointing. We both ordered 3 tacos each to explore the menu, a combination of: Chicken Tinga, the blackened Fish taco, bahn mi pork belly and Braised Short rib. Unfortunately the only tacos we really enjoyed were the Short rib and pork belly. The other tacos seemed very under seasoned. The chicken oddly tasted reheated/leftover taste and the fish taco was overtaken by a very floral/perfume tasting red hot sauce drizzled on top. BUT, I have the distinct feeling we caught them on an off day or were just the first guests to roll through on this particular Saturday- so will try again. Hopefully it's better on round 2.

Quaint little place built in an old house in the heart of palm harbor. The noise level is somewhat high, but it's more like a gathering spot for the locals. Pizza was very good with just the right amount of crispiness. Service was fantastic and I really loved my salad.
    Next time, will probably sit outside if it's not too hot. This time we sat in a little alcove that appears to have been a former kitchen. 
   This place is on my list of places that we will come back to visit.

even on a Monday night, this place was packed. We got there 7:00 and the wait for two was about a little less than an hour. it's a cold wait on the pier because of the wind so don't forget to bring a jacket!! 

after a long wait, we got seated right at the railing next to the water. what a beautiful view especially as the sun was setting over the water. the lights were reflected and it was truly a beautiful sight

I ordered the cioppino and my friend ordered the abalone. It came out promptly - nice and hot. I've never had abalone but when I tried it I really enjoyed it. The cioppino comes in a bread bowl which got a bit soggy. I wish they would've used something that didn't get as soft or even toasted it a bit. It comes with crab, clams, mussels, shrimp, and scallop. As a seafood lover, I really appreciated this. The broth was nice and flavorful but there just wasn't enough of it (or perhaps the bread soaked it up...) Honestly I just don't think a bread bowl is the best vessel for cioppino... Large portion though - I couldn't finish and took it togo

BTW they use paper straws here and I personally hate them - would rather just have no straw honestly. Good service and nice ambiance. Perhaps a bit pricy though. They have a takeout window which is much faster and they even have some picnic tables you can sit at right by the water

Annnnnnnd, 3rd time was last night and I think I've given it plenty of chances. I literally didn't touch my food, still paid for it, and decided I would never come here again. My 16 year old (who is like Pac man and loves food) didn't touch her favorite food (tacos) either after the 1st bite. That's when I knew. The meat was dry, the tacos were hard as a rock, and the rice tasted boxed *think Chef Boyardee*. The queso started out sooooo good but we threw half of it away when we got to the entire bottom that was burnt onto the pan. Waitress was nice but when you see no one ate their meals...that should cue you, right? It's too bad bc this place has such potential!

In town for a weekend getaway and having no knowledge of the local food scene, I came across Mood Cafe while searching. Good reviews, excellent photos and decent prices brought me in, and I couldn't have been happier with my choice. Thank you again, Yelp, for steering me to such a great find in the city of brotherly love.

Mood Café had some seriously high reviews.. a solid 5 star rating with close to 250 reviews, so they've got to be doing something right. They serve a dish called Chaat here.. something I've never heard of and something that I figured I might as well try.
