This place is much smaller than I expected. No real sitting area, but they have a couple of makeshift tables and plastic stools for people who want to eat there. Plastic forks, knives and napkins sit by the door as a "grab your own" kind of thing. You place your order at the counter and they prepare it in plastic to go containers.

Having no clue what I wanted, I told the guy behind the counter that I was in town for the night, saw they had some great reviews on Yelp, and I wanted to see what it was all about. He explained one of the menus was yogurt based smoothies and the other was the chaat. He also helped steer me by asking if I wanted vegetarian or the type of protein I wanted. 

I think I should point out that I had no clue what chaat was and really still don't. I know it has a lot of tasty sauces.. some crunchy bits and fresh mango in it. Mine had the Chicken Tikka in it too, because that's what I ordered. There were some items in my dish that were cold and some that were hot. Some bits were crunchy and some bits were not. While I cannot tell you exactly what it was (or if it was authentic like some reviews claim it is not) I can tell you it was delicious and I ate every bite of it.

I also ordered the blueberry lassi and was really happy with it. A friend ordered the mango and we were each given a full glass of what we ordered and a smaller cup with the other one so we could taste it. I thought this was a really nice gesture and was very appreciative of it.

I'd love to tell all of my friends about Mood Café and haul them all to Philly to give it a try, but there wouldn't be enough room in the place for everyone. Instead, I can only share my experience and hope it steers you inside on some cold and rainy night as it did me.

I haven't visited Food Liaison yet, but they deliver lunches to my office every Thursday. The plates are lovely presentations and many ingredients are organic.

I've eaten the TFL Muffuletta two weeks in a row and it's well liked. It's three slices of fresh baked grilled bread with Dijon aioli spread, topped with genoa salami, mortadella, and chopped green olives. It's beautifully decorated with fresh balls of mozzarella rolled in prosciutto and a pretty curled leaf on each one. See my photo.

I've heard the chicken shawarma isn't that good nor much food, but it's very pleasing to my eyes!

For my 100th Review on Yelp, I waited for someplace that was really special. It was a serious tie between Welcome Diner and Cafe Poca Cosa, but I decided to make the later review #101.

This was my second time at Welcome Diner and I loved it just as much as the first visit. Actually, the first time I went here, my car had been broken into at the Gem Show that day. My friends and I were exhausted and traumatized and the Welcome Diner experience took the edge off the whole stressful day.

On my first visit, I had the jackfruit fries...much better than I expected. I'm actually not very adventurous with food and not a big fan of meat substitutes​, but the jackfruit was very good. 

This visit I had the No Way Jose Burger, which was delicious. It was a cross between a good fast food burger (like In and Out, not Burger King) and a gourmet burger. Sometimes the gourmet burgers (like ZinBurger) are so rich, they're like eating dessert. The No Way Jose Burger had good balance. The greens in the side salad we nice and fresh, no icky, over-ripe leaves which can be a problem. 

My friend got the Eggs Benedict which she said was really good. I should have tried the hollandaise sauce but didn't think of it. 

For dessert, we had a Lemon Lavender cookie and a chocolate chip cookie. Both were tasty, not bakery quality but good. The coffee was good. I'm a coffee snob so I was pleased I didn't have the immediate "yuck" response to a generic-tasting coffee.

The building is classic Mid-Century Modern and there was a sign outside that said Pie with an arrow pointing to the door. To me, anytime you can go to a restaurant and it's an experience, even if it's not perfect, that's something.

Both times I was here the service was good. I read some other reviews that said the service was spotty. The thing is, this is the antithesis of a corporate restaurant experience so of course, there's going to be some​ inconsistencies. That's the reason why you'd go here, because it's real and authentic. 

My friend that went with me has lived in Tucson for several years and didn't know about it. I'd highly recommend the Welcome Diner because it has that kind of cool factor that makes it memorable. 

And who doesn't love comfort food?

This place was just absolutely stellar on every level.  My husband and I stopped in for lunch last Friday after hearing quite the buzz.  The buzz is well deserved.  

Grafitti/collage combined with dry ramen noodles being used as a wall decoration was just too flippin' adorable.

Pork was the dumpling special of the day and chicken was the Bahn Mi of the day.  So we ordered both of those and the ramen.

THESE ARE THE BEST DUMPLINGS I HAVE EVER HAD.  And I have eaten a lot of incarnations of dumplings at a lot of different places.  The texture was superb and it absolutely melted in my mouth.  So flavorful.  We asked for chili oil on the side (I was worried about Han Dynasty level heat) but it's relatively mild.

The ramen was brilliant as well.  It had such an interesting taste; it is a miso based broth but it had this flavor that was just so unique and worked so well.  Cheu poaches the egg instead of soft boiling and that was also a great touch and lets the egg mix infuse with the broth.

The Bahn Mi was also delicious and loved the spicy mayo as a condiment.  Unfortunately I have an aversion to cilantro and that ended up overpowering the dish.  If you love cilantro then you would probably love this.

Service was nice and attentive, the noodle bar overlooks the kitchen so you can see them preparing your dishes.  

Seriously just a fab addition to Philly's noodle scene. A great, small casual dining spot.  Cannot wait to go back!

Yum!

I love the concept and the product. The portion looks small when it's being made - or maybe my eyes are just bigger than my stomach - but once you start digging in, it's the perfect amount of food. I love the selection of ingredients and the fact that you can get endless toppings.

I have to give 4 stars just off the strength that I LOVE their French toast. My most recent experience not so much though. I had a craving for chocolate chip pancakes and tussled with the idea of just going home and making them or purchasing. You know what I did. I paid 10 bucks for overly greasy tasteless pancakes. And greasy sausage. It wasn't good. I've been here multiple times and well this has been my worst experience. 
I like the food for the most part and the bars aren't bad. I'm going to keep coming here. I just wouldn't advise those pancakes.

Beautiful family friendly beach with so much to do! Soft wam sand very clear beaches with the famous clear water of the Gulf. Pleasant Gulf breezes to take edge of any heat. Multiple affordable high quality restaurants from Thai/sushi to Mexican to Italian to high end seafood and low end fried fish and clam serving bars. Great large Publix grocery store right on beach next to Rite Aid- no jacked prices either! Large well stocked liquor store too- and lots of tiny ones. Walk in clinic for beach boo boos too- never have to hit mainland!! But if you do-- like ten minutes away! Lots of suburban shopping, my wife loves the Ross/Marshalls there as it so much cheaper than where we live.  And short drives from downtown Tampa and St. Pete- so much urban fun too!! And easy drive up and down Intercoastal for all the other beaches in the area, plus great nature parks.  Little nook areas with cool fancy art and clothing stores abound too, like Pass-a-Grille. Glad they survived the storm- it's a great place full of great people!!

I've been looking forward to trying Saki as I've heard good things from Rachel M. and Melinda M. And unlimited sushi?! Yes please!! I also had a coupon and thought now is a good time as any,and we'll save a few bucks!

We came early, as it was a Friday night, and I'm sure it can get packed. We got seated immediately. We wanted to order a drink, so we asked our waitress what beer did they have on tap. She wasn't sure, so she went to check and came back with the answer. Then we asked if they served sake, she wasn't sure, so she went to check and came back. I wish there was a list available so then she wouldn't have to go and check and then come back with the answer.

I love the concept of ordering a la carte for a buffet. You know it's freshly made, and it hasn't been sitting under a heat lamp for who knows how long. I immediately order our limited 8 pieces of sashimi per person. Too bad sashimi wasn't' truly AYCE, I would've then given this place 5 stars! I ordered some of the hot food items as well as nigiri until I was stuffed.

For a Buffet it's good. Is it the best Sushi I've ever had? No. But again, let me iterate, it's a buffet, buffets aren't Michelin rated restaurants. I do love the concept of ordering a la carte but when it's busy it's a little bit slow getting to your table. Get there early and you can avoid that and make it to a movie afterwards!

Excellent new addition to mass ave! I prefer it to Bakersfield! I love the house margs and the option to get a pitcher. I tend to stay away from building my own tacos since the combinations they've put together are so excellent! I love a juicy Lucy. Warning though: two tacos is all you need. Made the "mistake" of ordering three once and was full for 24 hours after!

East Beach Grill is a pleasant place to get breakfast by the beach. I came with Matt B. and his dad for some pancakes on a chilly Sunday morning, and it was pretty nice despite the brisk breeze. We had our dog with us on the patio, and he spent most of our meal getting petted by the most adorable nine-year-old twin boys. They vowed to distract him from our food, and they did an excellent job.

The place was busy but not quite full, and we had no problem seating ourselves. We ordered at the counter and the food was brought to our tables. Very easy.

We all ordered pancakes, which is apparently the thing to get at East Beach Grill. I got the banana wheat germ pancakes with sides of bacon and eggs. The pancakes were delicious, fluffy yet substantial, studded through with sweet morsels of banana. I got my eggs over easy and these were fine, nothing special, and the bacon was not as satisfying as bacon should be. Really, the pancakes are the main attraction.

All of us, dog included, enjoyed our visit to East Beach Grill. It's a great spot for a lovely scenic breakfast, and I'd recommend it if you want some oceanside pancakes.

Color me surprised, another new QT has opened up in the city. Quick Trip is becoming like Walgreens and Starbucks. It almost seems that there is one on every corner. Or at least every other block. This QT is a prime location - it has easy access on and off of 44 and is just a hop, skip and a jump from 64/40. 

I'm driving to work earlier then most people get up for work and a convenience market is important to me. It may be a gas station, but their selection and variety of coffee satisfies my need for caffeine. This new location is one that has the kitchen in the center, I can't wait to try it. However, for now I can tell you, if you need a quick breakfast their 99¢ Sausage Biscuit will hit the spot and fill the void. 

The staff seems to be friendly and professional and if they can do that in the wee hours of the morning - they've got a good team. 

Will I return? Yes - I've fallen out of love with my current gas station and convenience store. 

When: March 25, 2017
Why: It's new and I needed coffee.

I love wine, and I love cheese.  Therefore, I love Tria.  

The bf and I go here pretty regularly and each time we find new things we like.  The only downside for me, and the reason they don't get that 5th star, it's the crazy mark ups on the prices.  After finding a new red wine I really loved, I came home and looked it up on the PLCB website to see if I could buy a bottle nearby.  To my surprise, a bottle was priced at $13, and I had just paid $11 for a 5oz pour.  Boo.  

But, I'll support the local economy and keep on going.. it's a great way to try new things, and overall it's a nice chill spot to have in the neighborhood.

...omg I can't believe I forgot to mention the mead.  Yes, days of yore, mead!!!!  It's sooo good and I've never seen that on a menu anywhere else.

I drive by this restaurant every day on my way to work and I always think to myself I would love to stop in there... tonight my friend and I finally went in for dinner! It was exactly as I had imagined.

The food was wonderful and they allowed us to bring our own wine (even though they do also serve cocktails). The service was wonderful - We sat at a little outside table. We shared the meatball appetizer (highly recommend!!) and a few of the pasta dishes (spicy crab shells and bolognese).  

We are definitely going back and this will certainly be in our regular mix of restaurants.

New place in the Parish. I'm excited for the change.  Clean, updated spa chairs.  They even offer OPI gel nails which I'm so excited to try the next time I'm there.

They accept credit cards which is great!  Loved my spa pedicure.  i usually judge the place on how much work they actually do for a basic spa pedicure.  Many places don't actually massage my calves and feet, which I'm big on since I'm on my feet all day.  She did great!!  Will definitely be back for my manicure soon.

What a beautiful, magical place.  I've been here at least 1/2 a dozen times over the last 10 years and I look forward to going back at some point. 

I recommend going any time of the year!  I actually love visiting during the holidays; their winter displays are breathtakingly beautiful and it's a nice treat when the days are shorter and we all long for a taste of spring/summer.  Between the indoor displays of flowers and plants from around the world.... the heavenly aromas....and the meticulously maintained grounds... my friends, you will not be disappointed!

This place is on the pricey side but it's so worth it!  It's about a 2.5 hour drive from the DC area (approx) so it's perfect for a day trip :-)  

This really is a wonderful place to come and take memorable photographs with your loved ones/friends.  I'd recommend this for couples interested in a romantic date idea or families/friends looking to get away for the day.

I could not find a dang negative thing to say about this place if I tried! 

Came in on a Tuesday evening at about 7:30 pm to a packed house- luckily we were able to be seated at the last remaining table. The space is small, dark, and intimate- perfect for a date night, not so great for a group dinner.

Our waitress was so sweet and accommodating, & happily gave us extra chips and salsa and tortillas when we ran out. She also expertly mixed the tequila we brought with their homemade margarita mix.

Two of us shared chorizo queso fundido, nachitos and steak fajitas. Loved it all. The queso fundido was SO good- just make sure to eat it all before it cools down. Love that the fajitas come with rice and beans, also. 

We were able to use a Groupon and get out of there for under 20 bucks, including tip. Would highly recommend and will definitely return, with or without a Groupon!

I definitely enjoy eating here and appreciate the service I've gotten. I haven't tried too common items off their menu--my boyfriend and I love fish dishes and salt baked squid, so we usually only order that here. Their salt baked squid is definitely one of the best I've had in Chinatown. We also order the Sea Bass Filet with black bean and hot peppers. This dish is quite delicious--the fish is tasty and the peppers are crispy! We always ask for "spicy" and they definitely listen to us. 

I also want to rave about their service, specifically one younger male server. One Friday evening on our way out of town, we got a flat tire and had to call AAA. We decided to have dinner here while we waited assuming AAA would take forever. However, they showed up as soon as the food arrived, so my boyfriend left to attend to that. Our server was very thoughtful. He put our food back in the kitchen in warmers so it wouldn't get cold (I was obviously waiting for my boyfriend to come back before eating). He gave us fresh rice as soon as my boyfriend got back. We really appreciated his thoughtfulness! All other times, the service has been decent. It's a small place, so it can get filled up quickly. When it's really busy, we may have to wait some time to get our water glasses refilled, but they definitely do their best to keep up. I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area.

I've gone here on many occasions. The bus boys are very good at what they do, and they also have time to bring by drinks!

This place has GELATO for dessert, delicious! That's definitely one of the reasons I favor this buffet over others.

If you go to a show, you can also eat at the buffet before hand for $10, just make sure to pay for it when you get your show.

The staff is usually friendly. Food is delicious. Even if it's not seafood night, they have shrimp at the salad bar. They also brought out clams in a buttery sauce one night on a non-seafood night. I LOVE.

3 stars because it's a buffet, there are lines to wait in, and the service isn't SUPER genuine. Depending on what you get, some of the food does look mass produced.

I have been coming to this place ever since it was legal for me to drink. And then I moved...away...several times...and now there's Yelp to finally be able to write a decent review about this place. I love coming here on Saturday nights to listen to some great local bands, eat great pizza (dark side of the moon is the best if you like black beans, onions and lots of banana peppers) and drink some great off the wall beers. 
The atmosphere at this place is so laid back and relaxed. Everyone gets along with each other even though you might not know them. The bar tenders are super friendly and fast at getting you what you want. On Wednesday's they do a BBQ that starts at 5:00, for really GOOD down home smoking of the meats. 
New World is a great place to hang out with your friends and maybe even walk away with new ones.

we met our in laws to celebrate our fil's birthday.  it's a super cozy restaurant with multiple fireplaces.  
1)house bread: fresh and good
2)greek salad: very good.  i have not been in mood for feta cheese these days but the feta cheese tasted really different but really good
4)gyros platter:  i read in the reviews people really enjoyed this platter, hence i ordered it.  the gyros meat tasted of better quality than ur fast food joints but i still wasn't big fan... but i think it's just me, nothing wrong w/ it.  the rice pilaf, tomatoes, tzazitki sauce tasted great.  the pita was toasted hard at the end but soft in the middle
5)filet w/ cheese/sauce:  not sure what it was called but my hubby said he loved his dish.  he likes his steaks drenched in sauces? it was accompanied by grilled veggies and potato  
6)our waitress was nowhere to be found after she took our order and when she was giving us our bill.  we had asked for water for a toddler and my relative wanted another drink but she never came by.  another waiter was nearby so we asked him instead

I enjoyed our dinner on Saturday night although the wait was over an hour and half for 6 people. The seafood pasta was definitely my favorite. All the specials came with either french fries/salad/clam chowder. Our table decided to share and we ordered the hot sampler and the crab cakes and the calamari as well. The calamari was nice and fresh. The tartar sauce goes very well with the calamari. The hot sampler was okay. There was oysters and had cheese on top. I didn't enjoy that much since the cheese seem to cover most of the oyster to be honest. I enjoyed the garlic clams/mussels though. The clams were super big and delicious. The crab cakes were also another one that was good. 

Overall, we had a good time even though the wait was long. But while you wait, you can always chill at the bar downstairs till your buzzer goes off. Definitely would love to try other things next time!

I haven't had to shop for a suit in many years.  But I've got a couple of big events coming up, so I decided I really needed to dress like a grown-up.  

I was amazed at the level of service I received from the minute I walked through the door.  I wasn't sure exactly what I wanted, so I gave them a broad idea of what I was looking for.  Within a minute they had found what I thought to be the perfect suit for me.  They also came up with a great looking shirt, tie, and other accessories.  

I wasn't in any kind of a rush, but I was pleased that the tailoring was completed earlier than promised.  I don't know if I'll ever need another suit, but if I do, I want to come back to this Men's Warehouse.  George was right, I do love the way I look, and so does my wife.

Excellent.

I came here recently and on the suggestion of my dining partner, we sat outside.  I normally don't sit outside but this evening it seemed like I could break that rule.

First off, I loved the bread with tahini.  It was so good, we actually got a second plate of it.  Downright delicious.

Our appetizer was the flatbread and it was a revelation.  It had all of those wonderful greek flavors and when you're able to eat that with a nice bottle of wine while sitting outside, life is good.

My entree was the stuffed calimari.  It was light and delicious.  It was served over a bed of sauteed veggies in white wine.  At the very least, pepper and olives.  The squid itself was stuffed with rice, pine nuts, feta and some other goodies.  It was cooked perfectly and cut like butter.

Our waiter was very friendly and did a great job answering our questions.  I'm definitely coming back here.

I LOVE love LOVE going to No Anchovies when I'm in Tucson.  It's on a buzzing college town street: University, right next to the UofA, and I always feel like I'm going to run into someone I know (even though I don't know all too many people in Tucson)--and (surprisingly) often do.

The style of the restaurants on the south side of University is great--mostly old houses which have converted their porches and front yards into great outdoor seating areas.

No anchovies is a great place to grab a beer-or a few shots (they have a full bar inside)-and some slices of yummy pizza.

The outdoor seating is plentiful and tree-canopied and there is some indoor seating too.

You order your pizza slices and any sodas at a counter on the east side of No Anchovies, the west half of the restaurant is the bar.  It is never a wait, even when it's crowded.

The pizza is very very good--always with a lot of vegetarian options and veggie/pesto/fresh mozzarella/artichoke hearts loaded pizza-yum!.  They heat up whatever slices you want in the pizza oven (which at other places can make the crust too tough and the toppings too sloppy, but here it doesn't at all!)

It's always a good time; with affable staff, good food, and an enjoyable crowd.

PS
It's all ages until 10pm (at which point it becomes 21+)

What's not to love about !!! Definitely a unique place to visit for any reason, breakfast, lunch, snack or just a Bacon shots and a bacon Bloody Mary. Give this place an A for the boldness to have a Bacon themed place. Great bacon burger that the patty is primarily bacon, shrimp, bacon and grits. Biscuit on the side was dry as a popcorn fart. Probably not baked fresh and pretty good bacon, blackberry jam. I'd come back again to try the other menu items

We were at the beach and decided to check out this bar i had bookmarked a few weeks back. First thing i noticed coming in were pool tables to my right, and ahead to my left i saw a girl upside down. What the heck is she doing?....She was drinking a shot upside down! (If you are game, you can also climb up and drink a complimentary shot upside down). The bar top was a really unexpected touch... where there is water running through it with rubber duckies floating around. Also unexpected were the good drink and beer prices. $3 Coronas...i'm in ! I was also game for playing some pool (which was a blast...i had to show off my skills...or lack thereof) and then came back to the bar to socialize with fellow patrons and chat up with the friendly bikini clad bartender. I love the fact that it is right next to the beach, it has a great view, good music, and lively atmosphere. I loved this place and can't wait to return.

My homies and I did God's work ate four versions of Nashville Hot Chicken in one night (also using a double-blind study aka ate it at the same time on the trunk of a Toyota Prius) in order to determine the best one. 

Judges consisted of three men of different races, ethnicities, native languages, and styles of dance. Each person, though, has a strong passion for poultry. And no woman that night wanted to eat with us.

To control for as many variables as possible, we tried a mild flavored chicken breast at each one. This test did not take into account service, ambiance, and decor, or prices. It also did not factor into the overall ranking. 

Bolton's sat at second in our ultimate power rankings. 

Criteria and corresponding scores below:

*Spice (4/5): Fantastic spice with a lingering yo-this-stuff-sits-in-the-back-of-my-throat kick. Like many other Nashville Hot Chickens, they use a dry rub, but you know the folks in the kitchen let those breasts and legs marinate. 

*Meat Juiciness (4/5): Juicy and savory. Almost pornographic. 

*Skin (4/5): Crispy, but not the crispiest. It complimented the meat well, but I wouldn't say memorable.

Overall Score: 4/5

Other tidbits:
- I asked a native-born construction worker ahead of me if Bolton's was his favorite place, for Nashville Hot Chicken. He said, no. However, he recommended their white fish.

- I tasted their white fish, which is sandwiched in between two slices of white bread and mustard, and I would recommend this over their Nashville Hot Chicken.

- The spice level is higher than what most people can endure. I ain't like most people, though. #asianfolkslovethemsomespice

- The service is slow, but so is the rest of the South.

- Feel free to watch NBA basketball on the TV in the corner.

- The toilet paper roll sits super high up in the men's bathroom.

I recently changed gyms AGAIN... But I love this location. I have not had any issues.

Cleanliness. This space is ALWAYS clean, which is very important to me. I always see someone cleaning up and most people actually follow the instructions and wipe down the equipment when they are finish, which I 100% appreciate. 

Staff. The staff is friendly and just cool. No issues, they always answer my questions and they are very helpful.

Equipment. There is ample equipment at this location. Cardio section has elliptical, treadmills, stair masters, bikes, and a few variations of those things.  There are also sections dedicated, to weightlifting, abs, thighs, 30 minute workouts and more.

Spa. So for black card members, there is a spa area where you can get hydro-massages, chair massages, tanning, and a body enhancement machine. I love the hydro-massages; it is definitely a treat after working out.

Locker Room. Lockers, Full shower and Dressing Rooms. Actually pretty nice showers might I add. 

Parking. There is ample parking in the lot, so there really shouldn't be any trouble.

I normally go to the gym at 6am-8am  or 4:30pm - 6:00 pm range and there is never a crowd issue. Not sure about the other times.

Oooh baby I like it raw! But sometimes a few cooked items are ok when it comes to sushi, and at Kei (pronounced KAY) the menu has that balance down to a science! After two visits, I'll be back many more times in the future! 

I've been here twice in the past few weeks, sharing some of Reno's signature AYCE sushi with two visitors to our great city. I'd never been here before, but Shelby B, a trusted Yelp confidant and friend, told me how great they were IRL and in her review, so I knew I had to check it out. \

On my first visit I noticed a familiar face behind the bar, Jesus. No. Not that Jesus, but a sushi chef I'd had at another spot. I was excited because I knew he did things right, especially nigiri.

Next I noticed a section of the menu dedicated to "Specialty Nigiri"! The salmon rooster and salmon lover were both fantastic. One of them is topped with crispy salmon skin, my favorite ingredient! The Kei Tuna is also no to be missed on this section! 

Of course, we ordered some of the standard nigiri, and all of these were perfect. Fresh fish, solid fish:rice ratio, and the rice was also nicely seasoned. The albacore was a little mushy on both visits, so I think I'd just skip that one in the future.

On the dinner menu they have some really special rolls. Tres Diablos, with pickled jalapenos, was wonderful. I think the biggest surprise though had to be the Great White, with escolar, macadamia nuts, and a sweet mayo sauce. Freaking fantastic. I thought I'd hate it but it has been my favorite thus far! 

Be sure not to miss the Alligator, salmon skin hand rolll, and Jason hand roll! Plus, ask your chef for their special! They also have a big section of vegetarian rolls! GREAT JOB! And if you like it spicy, ask for the habanero sauce. But beware! 

So with all this love, why 4 stars? Consistency from chef to chef is of utmost importance to me when it comes to a sushi spot. On my second visit I wanted to wait for Jesus, but was encouraged to sit with another chef. While his maki and hand rolls were good, his nigiri was lacking, and just not as clean or composed as Jesus. 

I'm sure they're still getting the staff tuned up, so I bet this will fade over time. They've asked for some honest feedback on both occasions, offering a cool comment card at the end of the meal. 

A restaurant that appreciates feedback gets bonus points in my book. Kei, Welcome to Reno! I have a feeling you'll be here a long time!

An absolutely stunning co-working space in Indy. 

It's stylish, comfortable (with lots of formal tables as well as more informal couches and even a cozy fireplace area near a whiteboard wall, making brainstorming fun), and has plenty of presentation equipment, including high tech options with lots of touch screens and such. Staff as friendly and helpful with all the tech and more to boot! 

Bathrooms were tidy, coffee was plentiful as were sodas and waters throughout the day, and it's walkable to the City Market which makes taking a tasty lunch break easy to do. 

Not just a work space either. I could see this place being the perfect location for a lovely cocktail party or catered gathering as well.

Meh these DQ's are just ok . Really more for the Custard lovers over Ice cream lovers for their Blizzards which they are known for. Location is outdoor seating only on hard wooden benches when available, or take out. Kinda wish this place had an indoor Air Conditioned place to sit and relax on a hot summer day or night but it is what it is. Mostly for families with kids that are fans of this stuff. They do offer hot pork sandwiches hot dogs and a couple other hot items which I hear are decent but why anyone would get a hot sandwich at an outdoors only DQ is beyond me ? For me, I'Il pass on this place and go to Bruster's or Cold stone for real ICE cream on a hot Summer day thanks, but again, I can see where some might be big fans of this place?

LOVE Silver in the City. Great decorating items, fun gift items, jewelry--this shop is better than visiting local museums. I'm not usually into gift certificates, but this is one store for which I'd love to get one. Seems there is always something new; staff is friendly; and I love that it's an independent Indy original. Long may they reign.

Such an awesome bar. It used to be a brewery but they no longer brew their own beers. This bar does have an exquisite selection of drafts and bottles regardless. Especially if you like sours. The staff is knowledgable on good beer and very attentive. Prices are responsible. I had a pint of Ballast Point Dorado for $5 tonight. They also had Funky Buddha Last Snow on tap this evening. There is a private parking lot, plenty of seating, music at all times and happy hour during the week. They serve great food especially the pizzas and sings. Watch for bbq specials that are amazing! Dive bar that is somewhat upscale. I love this place :)

Iris is located on a nondescript little stretch of Decatur but the decor is nice, service was outstanding, and the food & drink were very good.  We'll definitely be back.

Among other things Iris is a perfect place to dine if you're going to the House of Blues for a show, it's about a block away and I'm positive the food is much better than the HOB.  Dinner started with a nice little amuse bouche and then hot homemade bread was brought to the table along with perfectly room temperature salted butter.  Great start.  We then received our cocktails which were very nice and within the fairly large wine list found a great value 2010 Rex Hill Pinot Noir in half bottle format for only $26.  After living in Oregon I have to say 2010 is shaping up to be one of my favorite vintages and even Rex Hill made some pretty darn nice wine in 2010.  Anyway, in terms of the food we started with pasta including the gnocchi which were excellent including some nice spice from chorizo and the squash "tortelloni" which would be more accurately described as large ravioli but were house-made pasta with tasty filling in a nice (if overly generous) brown butter sauce.  I love places that make their own pasta & gnocchi in-house so this was a pretty good way to start the meal.

For main courses we ended up going with a duck confit salad - which was plenty large for an entree - in addition to a duck breast Main course so we ended up with duck 2 ways.  The salad was good on its own and had an entire large confit duck leg on top which might have been slightly too crispy on the outside for my taste but that's just nitpicking, both the duck confit and the accompanying salad were very tasty.  The duck breast was cooked well and very tender but for some reason the dish just didn't have quite as much flavor or textures as I thought it would.  Don't get me wrong, it was still a pretty good dish (which went perfectly with the Pinot Noir) but I was hoping for more of a wow factor on our only Main course.  All of the food was good, but the gnocchi was the only dish with much of a wow factor which is why I have to round down to 4 stars for the moment and see if future visits bump it up to 5.

Clearly Iris has a solid kitchen and great attention to detail including some of the better service I've had in NOLA recently.  It rarely seems to be packed so Iris appears to be a nice under-the-radar option in the Quarter for those who might be looking for a last minute restaurant reservation.  I would put it in the genre of Meauxbar and Cafe Amelie also located in the French Quarter which have nice upscale atmosphere and very good food.  That's pretty good company.
Their pizza is stellar and reasonably priced! I really love the spinach white pizza and the garlic knots are delicious. The pizza is always fresh but is still ready quickly and the service is great!

So excited to be back at Pane E Vino.  We are getting take out as we just made it before 9pm closing on Sunday. 8 tables inside and it is cozy with fantastic food. We had the fettuccini in cream and spinach pasta with meat sauce.  We love their Italian dressing and the salads are good.

we will be back.

My family recently spent a long weekend here. We came in on Boxing Day and left three days later.  This is definitely a family favorite so I'm sure we will return simply based on the fact that we travel with an elementary school age child.  That being said, some things to take into consideration: 
Website/Phone registration: Abysmal. The website links don't work and/or take forever to open. I was NOT able to book  a room online.  I had to wait several minutes to get through to someone by phone.  She explained that now that Circus Circus has been bought out, supposedly they need to update their website. She urged me to keep my confirmation number even though she took my email address for confirmation. I never saw one so my trusty yellow Post-It stayed in my wallet until our room keys were received.  

Check-in: My Yelp Karma was in effect so we got to the front counter within 10 minutes. The bad news was our room was not ready.  In fact, it wasn't ready for three hours.  The woman who checked us in said we would be waiting from 30 minutes to an hour for cleaning to be done. Thank goodness the second clerk who helped us after our initial wait, a gentleman from Nepal, switched us into a different room so we could unpack and unwind.  

Bell Desk:  There's no bell but there needs to be one. Maybe I'll bring them one on my next visit. The clerks, able-bodied young men and a token woman, are responsible for manning the valet desk so they putter back and forth at whichever speed they deem it.  Sometimes they chitchat among themselves, oblivious to the stink-eye and side-eye they are receiving from those of us waiting to store our bags. 

Rooms:  We had been moved into a clean room(see above) and it featured handicapped accommodations(lower racks, a chair in the tub). We were so exhausted we didn't care. The walls are beyond thin. Our first night we had to endure the tween and teen cousins on one side(why do my people always pack the whole extended family into a hotel room like it's a clown car?) of us.  The second night we called hotel security on the young couples talking loudly and drunkenly on the other side of us. 

Hotel Security: You the men.  That is all.  That pounding on our neighbor's door was music to our tired ears.  

Fitness Center: Who is getting fit here?  Almost every cardio machine was out of order. I finally found an elliptical trainer and put the TV(these all work) on "Ocean's Eleven."  There is one weight machine and one small area for abs work. There is a vending machine for water so I was parched(foolish of me to not bring my own.)  They do provide clean towels.  

Food options:  We only checked out the Courtyard Buffet and the ice cream shop/deli. The line for ice cream was long and the battle for a booth/table was brutal.  

Midway:  This is why you come to Circus Circus. Your little one will love the carnival games and all the new stuffed animals they will haul home.  The whole family will enjoy the families of acrobats and trapeze artists and the campy dog shows.  If you plan ahead by taking a photo of the show schedule,  you can grab bleacher seats or stake out a spot to stand in front.  This  is what makes Circus Circus unique. It will make the crowds and lines worthwhile.

This place has some childhood memories for me, so be forewarned, my review may be a bit biased -- but I digress...

I've always loved coming downtown to visit Le Peep. I'm more of an omelet guy, so I ordered the southwest omelet. It was piping hot, loved the cold sour cream and salsa on top. It was also slightly spicy -- it must've been the peppers and sausage inside.

Our server was super fast an efficient, and aside from the home fries smashed into the carpet right next to my chair, the atmosphere was very clean, attractive -- kind of a subdued country home/french cafe feel.
Also, FYI, they don't do reservations -- they do "call ahead seating." The only difference I could tell is they don't assign specific time for the reservations. They just make a note that you're coming in and (I guess) adjust accordingly.

If my memory serves me right, this was previously a Doubletree, and while I love my cookies, I wasn't inspired to return.  Based on my recollection, it's much nicer now.  As for my check in, I was offered water for my "Hilton Honor status" be she didn't acknowledge that status and proceeded to school me on Homewood as Hilton brand...  Its obvious she didn't see my status. ‍

Morton's is solid, but extremely overpriced. My family and I went to the Philadelphia location for my dad's birthday 1.) because he loves steakhouses 2.) he's a Morton's member and they gave him a $100 gift card.

The location is great, right off of Broad on Walnut Street, but the interior needs major renovation. I felt like I was back in the 90's in this place, and it just looked tired.

I also don't like that they bring out that cart of raw meat and fish to explain their menu and the specials. First, the whole demonstration took about 10 minutes and we were thirsty and starving. I also don't like looking at raw meat covered in plastic wrap that has been sitting out for a while. NOT appetizing.

My strip steak was good, but I have to say that the $8 one I purchased at reading terminal and broiled at home was just as satisfying.

The creamed spinach was excellent compared to other steakhouses like The Palm, and my cucumber drink with St. Germain was absolutely delicious. The breaded shrimp in beurre blanc appetizer was forgettable, as was the chopped salad and asparagus with bernaise.

They gave us a free molten chocolate cake for dessert and it was terrible. Very commercial tasting. I've had better with a Duncan Hines mix.

Go here if you're on an expense account or have a gift card. Otherwise, patronize local places like Union Trust or Butcher and Singer.

So I had a business meeting here and didn't know what to expect.  I had heard really good things and knew a few celebs had stopped in at one time.  I ordered 2 crepes; the Batman and Robin which featured fresh fruit and ricotta cheese spread and the Romeo and Juliet which had strawberries and Nutella.  Both were to die for!  I didn't have their frozen yogurt that day, but I will go back to try it.  The crepes are very inexpensive, but they are small, so order a few.  This place has a bit of everything.  You wouldn't think it'd work, but it does.  Crepes and frozen yogurt? Yes, please!  If you're there in the morning, it's pretty quiet, but a load of business men and women come down for coffee, yogurt, and hot cereal.  It was snowing pretty hard when I went, so things were pretty slow that day.  

What I really love about this place is the local vibe it has.  You'll notice a lot of pictures on the wall that were taken by the main guy and features all kinds of attractions, monuments, and unique finds right here in Indy.  

The place is insanely clean and well decorated.  A great place to go for meetings and to hang out with friends.  Try it!

When i was in college and going to KOP was a big adventure, i ALWAYS wanted to go here.  I was introduced to Rubys by my friend from Southern California, where they are everywhere!  This place was great.

It is normally pretty crowded if you go at like exactly 12 or around dinner time.  I reccommend going at an "off" time

The milkshakes are awesome.  My favorite is the mocha although they always have seasonal ones that are tasty.   

I always seemed to  order the chicken Cesar sandwich which was always fantastic.  The one thing that was annoying is that their sandwiches don't come with fries, so you have to order them separately, but you can always get a big one to split

They have a sandwich that is pretty much like the day after thanksgiving sandwich and it is fantastic.  They also have pretty good seafood options.   My dad loves the fish tacos, which he orders every time... just for the "halibut"

After hearing such great things about Soy Café, I had to try it out, so en route to a friend's house to watch the Oscars, I stopped in for a smoothie.  Mind you, I'm not a vegan, but since my best friend of 18 years is, I've learned to love anything soy.     The café's atmosphere is colorful yet calming with ample seating and tables in the front and back with various reading materials (magazines, newspapers, etc.) available for patrons to peruse.  Very eclectic and appealing to the ever-increasing population of recent grads and 20-somethings populating the neighborhood.  The barista was friendly and made conversation with me as she was preparing my drink, and even after I had finished it, I hung out for a while before heading on my way.  I did pick up a copy of their menu and will be back to try one of their sandwiches or other vegan-friendly offerings!

Mind. Blown.  I don't think there's an item here that I do not like!

Ribs are definitely my favorite here.  I love the rub on the ribs, and it's just so much flavor.  In fact, I ate majority of the ribs without adding any sauce because it was so good just by itself!  Of course, I had to compare it to Pappy's since I think Pappy's has the best ribs, and I gotta say, it's pretty damn close.  It's not as tender as Pappy's but I think flavor-wise it might edge Pappy's just a bit!

Also a huge fan of the wings here.  It's smokey, juicy, and straight up addicting.  Since we were sharing the wings, I was so tempted to go back and order some more, but the long got really long :P

As for the sides, everything we tried were great!  The deviled egg potato salad is very unique.  First time I've had both potato and egg salad together.  The baked beans are smokey and sweet, and the BBQ pork skins was like eating crack.  For the pork skins, aka pork rinds, one of the guys working there told us to use the vinegar-based sauce with it and holy, it is good.  The pork skins are seasoned with seasoned salt so it's like eating pork-flavored salt & vinegar chips!  Awesome combo.

I think I still like Pappy's ribs more just because I like fattier cuts of ribs, but BBQ restaurant as a whole, Bogart definitely beats Pappy's any day.  Pappy's sides can't even compare to Bogart's and Bogart's menu is just more fun and adventurous!  No wonder it was rated the #1 BBQ spot in the US by Zagat!

We have come back since it has opened and they have an amazing amount of beers on tap! I was so lost trying to figure out what to order, and the man at the counter steered me in the perfect direction! I did a flight. The Blonde NV, Xertz, Revision IPA, and the Revision double IPA. They were all really well balanced, but I'm also an IPA lover. There were beers on tap that were not IPAs and they also had wine for the winos our there.

We went into the main area where you can see the beer being brewed and they had added a lot more games and picnic benches since they had first opened. They had board games, air hockey, corn hole, you name it. We played corn hole for the majority of the time we were there.

While they do not serve food, you can always have it delivered to you there, which is a nice touch. They are also dog friendly if you want to take your pup with you. We are excited to go back!!

*Revision is now in Costco for those of you that can't go to the brewery itself :)

Awesome place to get fresh, homemade ice cream. I had some delicious ice cream there. It's quite rich and flavorful. I love trying to pick fun combos to put together. They have some cool places to sit and friendly staff. I do wish that it was closer to where I live. I love supporting local businesses and would go there a lot more often. Keep in mind that their flavors are always changing, so I wouldn't keep too closely to what they have on their website.

Honey's Vintage Sweets. I drove by this building for several months and saw the "Opening in May" sign; I wondered if it would possibly be another antique store and wondered why anyone would want to open ANOTHER vintage store around here, but alas...I came in today and was proven wrong!

It's a cute little soda shop--okay, it's more of a sweet tooth shop, but they do have a variety of 'vintage' sodas/pop/coke. They have lots of yummy sugary sweets for those who like to indulge. They have cookies, ice cream, and of COURSE candy! One cookie that caught my eye was their 'Root Beer Float' cookie. WHOA. Unfortunately, I did not indulge in any of the sugary goodness as they are all dairy products (trying to be as dairy-free as I can here). I did have one of their old-fashioned Coca-Cola's though, hah.

It's definitely worth stopping in and looking around. They have lots of little goodies to buy, so if you need a pick-me-up or you need to buy someone an 'I'm sorry, please forgive me' candy bag, go here.

As for the decor, the walls are a lovely robin's egg blue! They have vintage chairs (acquired from the Franklin Theatre) that have been re-upholstered and vintage-inspired tables, as well as lots of other vintage-looking furniture. The music is pretty diverse too; just while writing this review, I've heard Buddy Holly, Grease, and now Cobra Starship. Whoa. Oh yeah, and they played 'I Want Candy'. HAH.

Yummy pizza. Love the dough, the sauce and the thickness. They were fast delivering the pizza and it was still steaming hot! The wings were good too. It's average in price and they do offer specials if you ask for them. Not bad. Definitely will order form them again.

I went to enjoy the food and festivities because my coworker had been talking so much about it. I went to get the raclete and a hot cider because it was freezing outside. I loved that it was a peaceful atmosphere yet very busy and there is so much to do and see.i had to wait in line for a bit but it was well worth it. The parking is the only reason i gave it 4 stars.

I am a huge fan of deconstructed salads. The traditional "chop everything up and put it in a bowl" is great, but when fresh ingredients are laid out you have the option of creating your own bites. So my salad dreams came true at Muriel's during a recent brunch over the Salad Midi. Huge juicy tomato slices, avocado slices, and a tangy pile of frisee topped with the best champagne salad dressing I've ever had. I wish I had one right now!

I combined the Midi with a tasty cheese porky torte, and the combination was a lovely light lunch. And the bread, dang. I could have eaten the whole bowl, but luckily I have some self restraint :)

The decor here is really nice as well. The front rooms remind me of a classic home-dressed up but still inviting. As you head toward the back by the bar and the bathrooms, the lighting gets softer and the decor gets more ethnic, and its gorgeous. And the service was amazing--we dined with a six month old, and the waiters treated even him like a little king. I've had some really fantastic meals in New Orleans over the years, and this was definitely among the best. I can't wait to go back.

If smoke is your thing, you'll find just the right BLEND here.
(See what I did there? :-} )

Blend is a lovely space located between Keystone at the Crossing and Castleton in the Clearwater Crossing area of North East Indy.  I actually didn't expect the space to be as large as it is.  Upon entry, I was surprised by how non-smoky the atmospheric air was inside of Blend.  

For the record, I'm not a smoker, and did not partake at Blend.  It was great to see that the space was as warm and welcoming to a non-smoker such as myself in addition to all of the cigar afficionados present.  If I had to put a label on Blend, I'd call it:  Giant Man Cave - But Classy.  Leather furniture and dark wood dominate the decor at Blend, and a gentleman wearing a red velvet smoking jacket wouldn't look out of place at all.

I was only able to give three stars, as I found the service at Blend a bit lacking.  The waitstaff did not seem as efficient as I would like, and there was a considerable time lag between placing orders and receiving them.  

My only regret is that I didn't get to explore the humidor; I hear it's grand.  If you're looking for a cultivated smoke, or just a quite place to catch the game, Blend might be just the place for you.

This is a lovely space for a spa.  I booked a massage here and the prices are very reasonable.  They have a nice repertoire of massages, and a bamboo massage that is unique to this spa, I believe.

When you enter it is a full salon atmosphere, so it seems a bit loud for a spa.  The spa seems like an add on upstairs, but thankfully it is a more serene environment.  I love the library of books and magazines here.  They also have a nice selection of product lines and special prices.

I like the upstairs, which is a bit quieter and has two nice lounge chairs to wait for your treatment.  The locker room is a bit small and when I was there, the steam shower was not working.  I enjoyed my massage with Lauren.  This is a nice spa to book treatments but I wouldn't consider it a day spa where you can lounge the whole day.

My visit here was my first time ever eating at Bob Evans. All of my friends love it there so one morning I finally had the opportunity to go. The experience was pretty average. Not over the top fantastic, but definitely not the worst dining experience I've ever had either. I LOVE breakfast and I was super hungry, so I wanted something that would offer a lot of bang for my buck. Unfortunately, we had to wait longer than normal for a waitress, but she came she was prepared to answer all of our questions and made good recommendations so that we could have everything we wanted for the cheapest price. She was also very friendly, almost to the point where it did not seem authentic, but I won't complain. At least she wasn't rude, right?  Anyway, I opted for the Homestead Breakfast which included two eggs, choice of meat, choice of potatoes, two biscuits and gravy. I also chose to have my potatoes loaded. The meal was very filling and tasted pretty good. Again ,not the best breakfast I've ever had but definitely good and at a decent price for everything included. I also had coffee (of course), and it's always a plus when a restaurant offers flavored creamers. Way to go BOB! All in all it was a pleasant experience and can see myself visiting here again.

I can't ever forget about Catch Twenty Three. I've been coming here since It opened but It been a few years since I've been here. Yes lots have changed but only for the good. Service remains at top notch and food is phenomenal. My favorite remains the lobster escargot dish. This place used to super upscale but now its a perfect mixture of upscale with an out doors sports feel. It's the best of both worlds. 

I recently took my son here for his 12 birthday and he absolutely loved it. We got to sit in the inside area with the window view an enjoyed half of the yummy sushi menu. 

Yelp check in hooks you up with a free domestic beer. Looking forward to taking the entire family here for dinner here soon. Can't wait! The boys will love it!

Do you like to dance? Nervous about looking ridiculous? Don't be! We love coming here, I especially love the early evening dance lessons. They really take the time to help you get in the groove.  So many of the regulars are also great about helping out and showing people new dances.

With an inflatable bull, three bars, huge dance floor, and usually a good size crowd it's hard not to have fun here.  Entrance fee is pretty cheap ($5) and the Djs do a good job of mixing country/pop/dance/ rap into the playlist after 10pm. 

If you haven't seen their jack Daniel's chandler or their whiskey barrel main bar, you really should come in and take a look.  I've been surprised at just how much I love coming here! Plenty of parking and always a good time.

We just left after getting to the restaurant 40 minutes before closing. Food was great, as usual, but I will NEVER return. When the clock struck 9pm there were still several tables eating, as per usual in ANY restaurant. So here is how they handled it...
1. They started bleaching tables next to EVERYONE while wearing blue rubber gloves. 
2.  When finished with each table they stacked the chairs on top. 
3.  This one is PRICELESS: They started a gas operated pressure washer INSIDE and when we asked WTH? we're told it was 'cleaning night'!? 

The fact that they couldn't wait for ANYONE to finish a meal. Literally 10-15 mins, is ridiculous and I hope they close. I am SO tired of being treated like the customer no longer matters in SO many places. Really, really sad.

OLD REVIEW:

I am SO happy Yummy House South opened!! Not only can we get great quality Chinese food during the week (including my favorite salt & pepper seafood!) but on Saturday and Sunday we get push carts of dim sum! Really the best thing that's happened north of Kennedy in a long time! ;-D

When we arrived, we were 20 mins early and worried that we were wrong about the time - not a car in the lot??? Then, within 10 mins, there wasn't a spot available! We were seated and almost right away the carts started coming out. The only thing I can say is I was in heaven! 

At first, the steam cart only had about 8 items, but within 30 mins it had many more. Anything we felt we were missing, however, we just asked our server and he brought it out straightaway from the kitchen! Service was impeccable!

Don't miss a weekend of dim sum for something different! It's the best! If you go in the evening and the parking lot is full, the bank next door isn't towing...at least they weren't when we parked

So, this gem is hidden away in a shopping center off of Lebanon Pike. 

If you go on their website, you can sign up for a 7-day free trial, which is what I did. They gave me a tour of the facility, and the next few days were mine to enjoy!

This gym has your basic workout equipment(treadmills, bikes,dumbells, etc). But they also have a swimming pool, hot tub, sauna, huge studio where they offer classes, and a track!

The facility is clean. It was never super crowded when I went...which I LOVED. The staff and people who worked out there were super friendly .

If you live in Hermitage and need a gym, I would highly recommend you check out Hermitage Fitness Center!!

I'm proud to be the first girlie girl writing a review about this awesome place.   Supplying all things for home brewing, wine making etc.    They primarily operate from their website and the storefront is for pick up of orders which is hugely convenient. 

You get on the website, order and pay for the items you wish, and then you will receive an Email when it's ready for pick up or you can pay to have it delivered.  I love this place because you don't have to "chance" going in and them not having the ingredient you need.  Prices are really fair and the staff are knowledgeable.  

If you are interested in any kind of brewing this is a great place to get you started.

Tried the pizza. It's really good! The house special with chicken onions and arugula was outstanding!! Get this!!! The meat lovers was a little heavy for my taste, but still good. Once again, great service (even with my Togo)

Rode's is an interesting little roadhouse (no pun intended) just north of the small New Jersey town of Swedesboro.  I was just looking for a quick bite to eat before turning in for the night and the place looked pretty inviting.

The interior of the restaurant is dominated by a large bar filled with patrons having drinks and a bit of something to eat.  Off to one side there are about a dozen or so small tables.   We were promptly seated and presented with an impressive looking menu,  a variety of appetizers, salads, sandwiches, and entree's made up of beef, poultry and seafood.  Very impressive menu for what appears to be a roadside restaurant.  I ordered the roasted tomato  bruschetta, a cup of french onion soup and a salad wedge, my companion ordered a seafood platter which which was made up of breaded shrimp and a crabcake.  I initially ordered a Yeungling beer and then tried a Port Road Pumpkin Spice Ale (A Budweiser product).  The roasted tomato bruschetta was very good, there was a strong taste of garlic and the tomato added a nice sweet taste to the appetizer.  The baked french onion soup was flavorful and rich, although a bit heavy on the cheese, which made it kind of difficult to eat.  The wedge salad was loaded with bleu cheese and bacon bits.  My companion loved her breaded shrimp but she thought the crab cake was a bit undercooked.  Not sure how that could happen.

The Yeungling beer was fresh and smooth, the Pumpkin Spice beer was crap to put it bluntly.  Should have stuck with a good thing.  For two people the tab was about forty dollars.  One thing I noticed, even though the place was three quarters full, the noise was at a level where you could hold a normal conversation, not loud and noisy like some places.

Although there is nothing on the menu that could be considered exotic, I found Rode's Fireside a fine place to eat and would gladly go back.

Great place for a group outing. I went here for Tuesday's $2 burger night. You start with the burger and bun with lettuce and add toppings for additional dough. I added mushrooms, provolone cheese, and mayo for a total of $3.50- not bad, eh? And the burger was pretty good. We ordered fries and tater tots for the table which were also tasty, and they have a good beer selection with plenty on tap. If you love burgers, head on over next Tuesday for good cheap eats!

Yessir!

The pulled pork was outstanding.  It was nicely smoked and very tender.  My wife has discovered that she loves pulled pork, just as long as it isn't sauced.  On the other hand, I really like mine with hot sauce.  In hindsight, I should have warned her that my little cup was filled with hot sauce instead of catsup, BEFORE she dipped her french fry into it.

This is an overdue review!  We went here a couple of months ago, and I've been jonesing to go back.  

We went on a Sunday for brunch...certainly not recommended if you're in a hurry, but we knew we would have to wait.  There were 5 of us, and it was difficult to huddle together and chat while we waited.  This shouldn't be a problem in better weather as there's a nice outdoor area, but it was freezing the day we went.  The result was that we paired off a bit until we got to our table, but there were yummy baked goods to ogle while sipping cocktails to placate us in the interim.  

The vibe here is hipster haven.  I found the staffs' many handlebar mustaches charming considering the restaurant is in a repurposed bike repair shop.  Everyone was very helpful and courteous especially considering it was standing room only.  Everything on the menu sounded amazing.  My initial order was a bust as they had run out of it, so I opted for the grilled cheese (walnut bread with cranberries).  Gourmet comfort food!  My husband had pork cheeks or pork belly and loved it.  Clean plates and happy faces all around!

Hattie B's is WORTH THE WAIT! My boyfriend and I stopped at this location on our way into Nashville on a Saturday night around 5:30pm. The line was well out the door, but moved quickly. We waited about 30 minutes. Once you order, your meal arrives within about 5-10 minutes. The service really is great here! They are efficient and quick in serving a delicious meal!

For dinner, I ordered the small white with mac n cheese and greens. I went with medium spice for my chicken. My boyfriend ordered the 1/2 chicken (medium spice) with potato salad and black eyed peas. Let's just say the chicken is phenomenal. It is cooked perfectly and the seasonings are amazing. Medium still had a lot of heat, although I'd be interested in trying the hot. All 4 of our sides were delicious. The mac n cheese and greens were my favorite! My boyfriend had some chicken leftover, which tasted great cold as well! The prices for Hattie B's are very reasonable, as you receive a lot of food.

Overall, I loved Hattie B's. It is a must when visiting Nashville!

Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant in the New Orleans metro area.  I found the waitstaff friendly, helpful and prompt.  My favorite Italian dish is eggplant parmigiana, and these guys prepare it exactly the way I like it.  A lot of restaurants in the area are Creole Italian.  Typically those restaurants have a red sauce with some spicy heat, so if that is what you prefer you might find the sauce bland or uneventful.  I love it, it's very tomatoey.  The eggplant is melt in your mouth tender, bursting with flavor without a hint of bitterness that you find at lesser establishments.  Prices are reasonable for what you get.  Expect bread with your entree, some delicious olive oil and balsamic vinegar are set on the table to enjoy.  Come hungry and these guys will take care of you for special occasions.

What was up with yesterday? Is Philadelphia closed on Mondays? Was it some Holiday that I don't know about?

My friends and I were planning on eating Mexican food for dinner, restaurant was closed. But, we were within walking distance of another, also closed. In fact, it was like a ghost town. It was a little eerie, basically no one on the streets, hardly any cars, the trolley was basically empty. But then, we see lights, and stumble towards them, like a moth toward a flame. 
Johnny Brenda's, how awesome you are. The cheeseburger I had was really good, the cheddar was the perfect amount of sharpness. Their fries are really good, not soggy at all. My friends got the octopus and the shrimp& avocado , and both loved them, though those are both considered appetizers, so an hour later they were hungry again. 

I am giving it a 4star because the first waitress we had was great, but we moved to a booth and some other girl waited on us(which I thought was rude, she stole us, when clearly the other girl was waiting on us). The 2nd waitress was fine, but I just thought it was weird. Also, I need to see a show here, for sure.

My quest for the best roast beef poor boy in the world finally led me to Domilise. I had been wanting to visit for some time now, but the universe always conspired against me. Once I was heading there for a poor boy when work called and I had to turn around. Another time I pulled up and saw a line outside the door. The last time I tried they were closed. This time I was lucky and found them open, and not very crowded.

As Shannon so accurately described the interior, the place is a dive. To me, that is a great thing. Even the men's room is a dive where you have to stand on a wooden pallet to use the urinal. The run down, old look adds to the ambiance and lets you know you're in a neighborhood joint, not some purpose built fancy building.

The roast beef poor boy comes with creole mustard when you order it "dressed". This is different than most other poor boy shops and they made sure to let me know in advance. The poor boy was good, but didn't wow me. It was far superior to some I have tried, but fell short when compared to others. The sandwich used the correct bread (there are giant Leidenheimer bags on the wall when you enter), had a good gravy/meat ratio, but I think the creole mustard may have detracted from the sandwich. Don't get me wrong, I absolutely love creole mustard, but I may have found one thing that I don't particularly like it on. Even if I had ordered it without the mustard, I don't think my rating would have changed. It was good, but for my tastes, I've had better.

In summary, Domilise has a good roast beef poor boy. While not the best I have had, if you're in the neighborhood and want a roast beef, give them a try.

Random find driving home to the hotel. Huge huge portions. I ate until I was stuffed and it barely looks like I even made a dent in the dish. I got the pad see ewe with chicken. The chicken is sliced thin, white meat and tender. What I love about this restaurant is that they included plenty of veggies, which is rarely in a Thai dish. Not really authentic but I am grateful. Veggies were carrot, broccoli, cauliflower, and baby carrots. Noodles were soft and flavorful from the sauce. Be warned they are closed on Monday. But definitely do stop by between Tuesday to Sunday and you won't be disappointed.

For a convenient, clean and comfortable stay among hotels in downtown Philly, look no further than the Crowne Plaza. I love the location! 
It's within walking distance to major attractions, main shopping streets, gay district, clubs, pubs, boutique shops.
They have complimentary Internet, flat screen LG TVs, big, soft comfy beds and for added security, you can only use your hotel key to access your floor in the elevator.
The hotel gym is located on the 8th floor which requires a hotel key. It's decent and there's a few thread mills, bikes and free weights in there. (See Picture) The scale needs to be adjusted though because there's no way I weigh 200lbs! :)
There is a small cafe near the lobby that has inexpensive breakfast items and a great pub attached to the hotel. 
The staff is very professional and it's definitely one of my favorite hotels.

Exquisite! Artistic!!

I have been planning to visit this place for a while now. Yesterday, I finally got chance to check out the place with my boyfriend. I am so excited to share my views on this place. There is so much to say!! :D

Attractions: 

- First thing you will immediately notice is the interior designing of this place. It is just beautiful and so welcoming. The owner took so much time to make every corner of the place feel like home, that you would want to come back here over and over, just so you can enjoy every part of this place :) 

- The 'giving wall' : This is a family owned business of Laura and Scott Burton. They have 8 children, who selected 8 charities for donations. Whenever anyone purchases a bottle of wine from here, 50% of the proceedings go to one of the charity. The buyer can select which charity in particular would they like to donate. 

Wine: 

- You can pay 10$ for 5 tastings of your choice of wine.
- You can just go ahead and buy the bottle.
- You can join the Peace Posse and get free tastings.


I went for the 10$ tasting, since this was my first time. I am a big time red wine lover!!! I chose two reds, namely, Sublime (2014 Pinot Noir) and Passion (2014 Cabernet Sauvignon); one ' a rose by any other name..' namely, Inspire (2014 Dry Rose) and finally two whites, namely, Bliss (2014 Sauvignon Blanc) and Soulful (2012 Oaked Chardonnay). 

WOW! My top favorite was Passion, followed by Bliss and then, Sublime. I didn't know I could love white wine too, until I found Bliss!! Hahahahaa!! Amazing. The service was so good. Our server gave us detailed information about each wine we picked.

Oh how much I love this place!! Can't wait to come back and purchase the Passion bottle and enjoy the place :)

PEACE OUT!! :D

First trip* So happy to have this place in our neighborhood.  A bit hard to find at first glance, it located right next to community center.  Small inside, but clean, bright and jamming to fun tunes.  Friendly staff.  The food- so yummy!  The chickpea tuna salad was flavorful, and I really liked the dill dressing.  For the "crab" Mac and cheese, they use heart of palm instead of crab and lots of other veggies cooked in too.  Big Easy bowl was generous portion.  And to top it off, bc of wait, they served us a free portion of their special- spinach and artichoke dip.  It was awesome!  Lots of spinach and I think the sauce was made with coconut.  Yum!   

Went back for more* update!  Now serving on normal plates instead of disposable and I've got nothing but love for this place now!  Started with drink of the day: Activated charcoal lemonade, aka black and gold lemonade.  (Who dat!)  It tasted like normal lemonade, perfectly sweetened (I'm picky, don't like super sweet stuff) and reportedly healthy way to remove toxins from gut.  She's not playing here;) I also had mushroom poboy and it was so good.  Sadly I didn't have my phone to take pic, but trust that this thing is massive. Loved that it was served on leidenheimer bread which is a fave of many locals, myself included.  Warning if you are trying to be healthy, the mushrooms fried.  For those that like fried food- know that the chef does them right: lots of crispy flavorful golden battered oyster mushrooms. The spread/dressing and spring mix bring it all together for perfect lunch.  I was again impressed with their super friendly service and good music.  Also like that there are two main community dining tables, so eating there feels a bit like shared family style meal. Thanks y'all!

I found out about this awesome seafood shop from a few friends! They usually rave about the Hot Sausage or Fried Shrimp Po Boys, so I just had to check them out. It's a small corner store on S Broad and you will have to find street parking around the area, but it is definitely worth it! When you walk in, there are two tables on the left side, a register in the middle, and a line of glass door fridges with beverages on the right. When it came to order, the lady was really friendly and treated everyone with utmost respect! I really feel like it's hard to mess up a Hot Sausage Po Boy, so I opted for their Fried Shrimp Po Boy for my first visit. I wanted to see how they made their Po Boys and what made them so special. When the food was ready, the order was announced through an overhead speaker and you can pick up through a window right out the kitchen. 

The food came out fast and hot! I unwrapped my Fried Shrimp Po Boy and instantly took a bite, something I never do because I always feel the need to take pictures of my food. I got excited because I saw that they used Hi Do French bread, my favorite French bread for Po Boys! The shrimps were average sized, not too small or too big. They were lightly battered, so I could taste the shrimp. There was the perfect amount of lettuce and mayo, so everything really went well with each other. I enjoyed every single bite I took out of the Po Boy and I understood why my friends were raving about it! 

I came here a second time to try out their boiled food items and wanted to show a friend the amazing Po Boy I had last time. The lady helped me out again for this visit and was nice as ever! I ordered a pound of boiled crawfish and their combo bag, which included two cut potatoes, a spicy sausage link, a boiled corn, a pig's foot, and long turkey neck. It was a really good deal for around 6-7 dollars! The boiled crawfish was delicious and had a good spicy kick to it. The potatoes and corn were the usual that you usually get at other places, but the corn wasn't boiled with the crawfish pot. I loved their pig feet, it was cooked perfected and had great flavor! The turkey neck was huge and I had to get a to go box to take home to eat later!

Overall, this place is awesome and I definitely recommend everybody to make their way here to eat some good crawfish and Po Boys! The service is always friendly and prices are very affordable!

I love it here! I can't believe how beautiful they have made this wonderful park. Even on Memorial Day weekend when the place was PACKED it was still very enjoyable. The beer line was not too long and they really gave a lot of thought to the layout. The changing lights, hammocks, river view, and fun snacks make this the perfect date night!

My friend suggested stopping here for coffee on Sunday afternoon. Parking is a little tight in front. If you drive around the back, they have a small lot and you can go in through the back door.

The owner was working at the counter. He was very friendly and informative.  He gave us a sample of their Venetian Cream drink that is his specialty. It was very good. I love when places let you sample the drinks first.

They have plenty of tables indoors, as well as a small back patio. Beyond the patio, there is even a backyard with chaise lounges and a hammock between the shade trees!

Great place! I'm sure I will visit again.

I love New Orleans Hamburger and Seafood. It's definitely not Gluten-free but it's the best burger you can find in the Elmwood area. 

I love how friendly the servers are and how welcoming the atmosphere is. My boyfriend and I ordered our food and immediately found a clean table with silverware. We were greeted by our busser with a smile. Our food came out quickly and I could tell it was good because the only people talking in the entire restaurant were those people who were finished eating. 

The burgers were delicious and the garlic fries were amazing. Both my boyfriend and I came close to finishing our meals, but had a few bites left. As we left, our busser told us to have a wonderful day and gave us a friendly waves. It's definitely good to know these friendly places still exist.

I come from New Jersey, so I always pass this place whenever I'm going to sports stadiums or other things in the stadium area. I kept telling my girlfriend and a friend of mine how one if these days I'm going to try this place. Well, last night was one of those days as I was in the area and decided to stop. 

Have to say, I really loved it there. My girlfriend and I split a cheesesteak and fried pickles. The cheesesteak was very high quality and had very good taste. I felt the steak on the sandwich was a higher quality than the other notable Philadelphia cheesesteak spots. The roll was also very good which overall made the sandwich a home run. It was also cheaper than the other places as well. 

The fried pickles were very very good. The pickles were the chip type and they had a lot of breading on them. They were bigger than usual and very crispy. I have been thinking about them all day.  

They have a very big menu so next time I stop we are going to try more stuff!

Tip: They don't have a bathroom, so don't come on a full bladder. They also accept credit cards, which I found quite convenient.

First time in New Orleans and this was the first place we decided to check out for lunch. It wasn't too busy when we went so service was generally fast. Our server was super nice and the food was good. I got a shrimp poboy, which was huge. I could only eat half. My sister got fish and chips which she enjoyed. I also love that they serve potatoes with butter instead of bread and butter. I'd probably go again if I'm ever back to visit.

My wife and I went here for our First wedding anniversary dinner, and it did not disappoint. We had never been here and quickly learned that people will travel a long way to eat here. We also realized that this is not a place to go eat on the regular as it is very pricey, but we knew this going in and were not too worried about it because of the occasion. I made reservations on OpenTable and mentioned it was our anniversary. When we were seated we were given a small card wishing us a happy anniversary, signed by the staff. We thought this was a nice touch for our experience.

We began our 4 course meal (they explain Melting Pot is typically enjoyed as a 4-course experience) with our cheese fondue, we chose to make our own with a local 4Hands City Wide. We thought the beer we selected actually reduced our enjoyment of the cheese and we probably would have been fine taking the 'classic' option. When you make your own, they use a small amount of the beer when melting the cheese and the table then gets to enjoy the rest of the bottle/can. 

SIDE NOTE- Since there was only one cooking station at our table, we had to agree on the style of cheese as well as the style for the entree phase of your meal.

We also ordered from their special wine offering, a 3-pour sampling of wines with a complimentary cheese board. This came out with our cheese fondue and it was quite enjoyable.

The caesar salad we both got for our 2nd phase was very good. We felt the portion size was appropriate related to the amount of food we were getting in full.

On to the main entree.
