This comes out raw and the cooking style you selected (we chose Mojo) goes into a new melting pot, from there you are given some tips on how long each should be cooked in the pot. This ranges from 1-3 minutes. You are given a variety of sauces as well, and all of those are fantastic. After your server leaves, you are left to drop your food and fish it out after it's done. All-in-all it ends up being a fun part of the meal. We were incredibly full at this point but we were assured we would find room for dessert.

For our chocolate fondue, we decided on the milk chocolate, with caramel and toffee. WOW, this was surely the best part of the meal. We absolutely loved our choice and actually discussed the possibility someday of coming back just for dessert it was that good. The fruits were fresh and the other sweet treats tasted great with the melted chocolate. I checked in on Yelp and received a free premium dipper. You can choose to get this for an appetizer, or dessert. We obviously chose to get the dessert version.

When we were all done, our bill ended up being the largest we have ever seen for the two of us. But we expected this so it was not a problem. This is not for a casual night out and you could tell by the way the servers were asking every table if something was being celebrated.

We did have one problem at the beginning where we waited almost 25 minutes to be seen by our server after being seated. I am not sure what got mixed up but after I let someone know, they were there right away. The GM also came out and apologized for our wait, and we actually got our wine tastings comped for the inconvenience. The delay gave us some time for check and recheck the menu before ordering so it wasn't really a big deal. But I know that would really bother some people. I am confident that does not happen often, and I really think there was just missed communication when our table was handed off from the host to the server. 

I would give this place a recommendation if you are celebrating something special for sure, or if you have money to blow on a fun dinner out.

While I despise putting together the furniture from Ikea, I do really like their designs, so time and time again I buy their stuff even though assembling it drives me to madness.

That being said, whenever I need a tchotchke for my house this it the first place I'll look. Cheap lamps, picture frames, mirrors, you name it. Their downstairs marketplace is where it's at! Though I admit I do spend too much money on junk, at least it's fun to do. 

I vastly prefer this one to the Conshohocken one. It's surprisingly usually less crowded. Also it honestly is more nicely laid out, and you can even see a rapidly rusting ship on the river from the cafeteria window. Food is alright, not gourmet but at least an experience. Their food market though has a lot of prepackaged interesting stuff. Those damn Swedes certainly know how to make pastries.

Time and time again I find myself here, and usually it's a pleasant experience. Just avoid the weekend crowds and you'll be golden. Sometimes I hate admitting I love Ikea.

Wow wow wow wow wow. Absolutely the best halal truck in Ucity. No contest. Here's a few reasons why I love this place

1. It is only 5 dollars ( es you read that right, even the fish over rice is only 5 dollars)! Cash only :(
2. The fish is actually some of my favorite fried fish I have ever had. Perfectly seasoned and crispy on the outside without being dry on the inside. 
3. Chicken and lamb are also dope, but not as good as the fish
4. Sauces are a perfect balance of flavor. I just get everything when I go there.
5. Service is fast and portions are large, it comes with the drink.

What are you waiting for? If you really need a Yelp review to decide on a food truck for lunch, well here's your 5 star review. Trust me and everyone else who loves this place and come here.

Somehow I feel like my reviews are being removed or disappearing but !!! I'm going to review Joey biscotti again because they are that good. Every dessert is done well here from their insanely good cookies to this Ny crumb cake. The ny crumb cake has a slightly crunchy crumb crust with a sour cream infused cake . You don't really taste the sour cream and it's their to provide moisture. The cookies are among the top 5 I've had in Clearwater and a must try. I usually opt for the more plain flavors so I got the chocolate chip and walnut. It's everything you wanted in a cookie , crispy on the outside and soft on the inside . Do yourself a favor and try Joey biscottis you'll love it

Visited for the first time in September 2021.  I wasn't terribly impressed with the flatbread, but I loved the kettle chips drizzled with a blue cheese dip and the truffles from a local chocolatier.  The water was room temperature, which I did not like.  I'm giving this place 4 stars because it was nice and cozy and the bartender was entertaining...I would stop by this place again.

Nita's place has firmly landed in my current top 3 places to eat in the Clearwater area.   Wow.....Nita is an incredible cook!

Nita used to be the cook at Nearly/Really Famous Tampa Style Cubans just down the road, and in fact their menu still features the "Nita's Sloppy Mojo Pork" sandwich in her honor.  I'm not sure I've ever seen such a tip of the hat at any restaurant to a cook that has gone into competition.   While the menu at Nita's is very close to the current one at Tampa Style Cubans, I've found her flavors a good notch higher.  

Looking at Nita's menu, you can read the history of her restaurant/family background.  In conversations with her, there's hardly a cuisine she hasn't cooked....Cuban, cajun/creole, Italian, Mexican, Chinese, on and on with lots of red-blooded American, good ol' home cooking fare for good measure.  She's always happy to bring you a sample of anything on the menu to check out...very cool.  And make sure to ask her if she's cooking anything off menu (as she often does).   Last visit I forgot to ask before I ordered, and when I finished eating, she brought out a tray of stuffed green peppers to try out after already stuffing myself with a platter of jambalaya.  They looked fantastic, but I was about to pop already, so I'll have to catch them another time.

Nita's is a one-woman show, she cooks, runs the register, and serves customers...quite the juggling act but she pulls it off well.  Even though there are only about 20 seats, it may mean there's a bit of delay in checking out, but at the end of such a great meal, you won't likely mind.  Note this:  Nita's is a very simple diner...very utilitarian and nothing fancy.  I'm not inclined to call it a dive because it's cleaner than my favorite dives.
;-)
I've tried a good number of items on the menu, and so far my favorites are:

-  Cuban sandwiches - great!
-  rice and beans - delicious
-  moho pork - outstanding
and finally
-  jambalaya - a must try!  Outstanding, best I've had in Tampa hands down, available as a plate or bowl

I haven't been able to get there for breakfast but the biscuits and gravy are on my list next time I'm in the neighborhood.  Prices are reasonable, with daily specials from $4-7, entrees $5-7, and three sizes of sandwiches (4-8-10") from $3-7.25. Soups, salads, and sides round out the menu and make sure to ask what cake/pie she's made fresh for dessert.  Takeout is also available.

After my first meal, Nita asked if I liked it and I told her I would sleep in the booth if it meant I could eat there every day.  My second time the food was so great I asked her if I could hug her (she gladly obliged, grinning from ear to ear).  Last visit I took my Mom there and she fell in love with her and her cooking, too.  I told my Mom I'd adopt Nita if I didn't have a Mom already.  I think she knows I'm kidding, but hey, Mom is getting up there in age...Ha!
:-)

Atmosphere:   3
Service:   5
Food:   5
Value:   5

Now I would normally give this joint three stars (don't stone me y'al, I know some Elite Yelpers love this place) but my drink was so damned good (which I remembered the name of it, see my picture) and the ambience at the bar, plus the cute bartenders was awesome so I bumped it up to 4 stars.

Let me explain, it was a Saturday night and the place was packed. We waited a bit for a table and when we got seated we got the ditziest waiter imaginable. Fortunately there we were still near the bar and near where waiters went in and out so we could catch someone to help refill our glasses etc. as other reviews have stated it. Gets really loud in here. I didn't notice it at the bar but when we we were seated it was tough to hear. 

After thoroughly reading the Yelp reviews I ordered the goat tacos to share as an appetizer and they were good but kinda small. I ordered the mussels which were good but nothing to write home about. Sadly the best food I tried there was a friend's side of grits, damned they were good! My friends were disappointed in the small portions of food. 

So I would definitely recommend this joint to grab a nice strong drink at the bar and to hang out there. Not so much for the food.

Happy drinking!

This little coffee shop surprised me. We have seen white some coffee shops in Boise but always tried to stick with what we were familiar with, Starbucks, until we tried this little local owned coffee shop 3 months ago.

The coffee is rich and perfect to the taste.  I always like mocha or latte type of coffee.  Doesn't matter what flavors I ordered, they were just perfect to my taste.  The flavors will not overwhelmed nor too sweet than the coffee itself.  I just ordered a holiday special "Snowball Mocha " (I think).  Marshmallow melted on to of the hot coffee, it is rich but the bitterness of the coffee underneath it just make the coffee perfect (although I am not a big fan of marshmallow, I think this combo makes them perfect together).

I had a chance to stepped inside and it is such a cozy welcoming coffee shop.

Give this little place a try.  You will love it!

I love this hotel so much! It was my first time in New Orleans and I ended up choosing a great hotel! The staff is great. We were able to check in 2 hours early. The room was such a great vibe. Great location. Parking is $45 which is pretty expensive but nonetheless it was an amazing stay. Right across Lululemon!!!

After spending almost a week in Bradenton on business I finally had the opportunity to head back home to the east coast. After merging onto I-75 north bound I quickly got up to speed, it was a little before 9:00 PM and traffic was moving a little over 80 mph and all three lanes were still congested from rush hour. This highway is a good example of what I dislike about this side of the state, I guess if I was retired and didn't have to venture out during the morning and even rush hours I may consider moving here being I love the gulf waters over the Atlantic side.

Just as I settled in for the ride I realized I needed to fuel up before crossing the state so I exited once I saw the sign for this station. The exit is not lit and with pouring rain it can be a little difficult to maneuver when exiting at a high rate of speed. The first curve forced me to scrub most of my speed but I had to immediately get back in it to cross the (3) lanes while merging to get all the way left to turn into the station - note to file this seems to be a popular spot for the "Road Ranger" (sponsored by State Farm) I'm not sure what the attraction is but I did notice (2) during my short visit maybe "donuts"?

I don't know how old this Racetrac is but it's very clean and the fuel prices were competitive. Getting in and out is very easy and the parking lot and fuel Islands are well lit. It's doubtful I'll ever become a regular here but I'd stop in if the opportunity presented itself again...

after all the reviews and hype on yelp, i desperately wanted to love this place.  west philly needs a nice pub.
you walk in, and it's a good size place, kind of dark...full of personality, my kind of place.
the food is "meh", or perhaps a "meh-plus".  beer selection is awesome awesome awesome.
but...it's packed.  how are the bartenders going to get to know my name when i can barely squeeze by?  how can i compete with wannabe indie hipster/penn students and vie for the bartender's attention?
ack.  
so yes.  pluses on the drink and decors side.  and i want them to do well and have lots of business...but not if i can't easily find a seat and be comfortable!

Milk House is one of my go-tos for delivery. They are fast and affordable, even when you consider delivery fees/charges. My usual is the caesar salad with rosemary grilled chicken. It's a huge salad with tons of chicken and it fills me for the entire day. The dressing is delicious and there is always a nice amount of parmesan. 

I have occasionally ordered some of the other salads and they are always very fresh and tasty. I did have a botched order once when I ordered the signature salad and it arrived without bacon. How did they forget the bacon?! 

I'd love to try the grilled cheese sometime but that would require a planned splurge - they sound amazing and also amazingly fattening! I'm so glad Milk House sees all of its customers and provides quality food for everyone at an affordable price!

I like the open space of this mall and it's gotten better, in my opinion, with more stores and restaurants.  Love the convenience of it being so close.

I recently went to the Christmas Tree Lighting on Sunday.  Wow, was it packed with families, food trucks, vendors, carolers.  That was really fun and I am glad they put on this show for us South Reno-ites who sometime like the convenience of staying local (although most everything is only 10 minutes away in Reno)

I have yet to visit a restaurant in Summit - Land/Sea.  This may bump Summit up to 5 star as we need always need fine dining on this side of Reno.

I had fun at the tree lighting and glad there was this family fun opportunity so close by!

Took my mom and my 6 year old here for a perfomrance of "The Flea & the Professor", not only was this great Children's Theater - but it was great theatre in general.  All 3 generations laughed and enjoyed.  Great actors and very good for introducing kids to the love of live performance.

We love it here.  This was our first year as subsricbers and we will subscribe again next year.

We also had awesome seats - there are NO bad seats here - small theater with good sight lines.

We loved every minute.

First off, let me divulge I was here for an event so I did not pay for the food and drink, however, the gratuity we left was more than deserved.  

Sunday brunch here is a great deal especially if you love Sunday Fundays..... for $10 unlimited mimosa, screwdriver and bloody mary bar- and you pour your own!  A few kinds of infused vodkas and several different juices offered and lots of garnishes including some fresh large shrimp!  

Service was fantastic- truly - without a doubt- even our waiter told us how much he loved working there- you can feel that vibe.  Comfy outside couches and tables, intimate private room next to a glass enclosed wine vault.  Gorgeous décor - cosmopolitan yet casual.

The food we tried was really delicious.  I highly recommend the shrimp - even for a nonseafood lover like myself I would go back and order it again!!!  The crème brulees were great- but try their churros with a trio of sauces!!!  The prime rib was cooked perfectly - definitely a winner!!!

eek!  Unfortunately I waited too long to write the review that I don't remember what I ate!

I do remember that I loved the eclectic theme, mismatched chairs and tables, older building in s. city, very home-y feeling.  

I liked the food, but I remember taking forever to decide what I wanted.  I was having a little bit of trouble reading the board, it was a real chalkboard menu and personally I felt that it was a little disorganized for me to be able to pick out what I wanted.

My friend and I both ordered hot tea and unfortunately we were served with a tea kettle...  idk about anyone else, but I don't think it is physically possible to pour water from a tea kettle and not spill hot water everywhere which is exactly what we did... I'm getting soda next time!  :o)

Is there anything better in this world than pizza? I really don't think there is.  And Jockamo's is one of the consistent best. I think I've only come here once and thought it was just okay, and I've been here a. lot.  

Their salads are delicious, their draft and wine list is good, and their pizzas are just too good! Love their crust. Love their unique toppings.  Love that it won't break the bank! 

I just wish that there was a more convenient location for me. Can I request an expansion to the north side, please?! It's so good though, that I'll continue driving out of my way to eat it. 

Last week's pizza pick was the meatball pie and it was tasty! I've also enjoyed their So-Cal for a lighter, vegetarian friendly pizza. Really, anything is good! Now I've got my mouth watering for my next visit.

So my and my guy have decided that each time we go out to dinner, we would try something different.  So we get on yelp and see what's nearby.
I would have never picked this place because it is just off the main road and in a strip plaza with an auto tire shop and a music center.  
Looks are deceiving.
This place is a gem!!!  
Italian and Greek came together and had a baby and it's called Romanos Restaurant.
The palm ceviche was chunky bits of hearts of palm, grilled shrimp...so so good...radish, grilled pineapple...o.m.g. it was good.
I then had the bruschwtta and salmon and honestly it was very different bruschetta but I'm down for new things....so so good...the salmon was cooked perfectly...the chicken parm was to die for good...the sauce was perfect and it had grilled tomatoes in it that I fell in love with.
The Baklava was probably the best I have ever had.  My guy had never had it before and the ice cream with what I think was crushed pistachios was the best compliment to it.  They also had a Ukrainian layered cake but there was no way we could have gotten two desserts.  I was full when I left.
Danyelle was our waitress and I'd like to give a shout out to her!! Awesome through and through.  It's so nice to get a competent, efficient waitress and she did not disappoint! Give that girl a raise!!!

Gorgeous park and it is huge. I feel like this is the place where there is something for everyone. I have been to Nola numerous times but this was my first time going to city park and I'm already looking forward to going back. It was a
Lovely day with great weather. I love that the have a cafe du monde so you can skip the line of the one in the French Quarter. The child amusement park looked so fun for people with children.

The Bar Louie girls -- the high school group of six -- decided to celebrate our second anniversary of getting together by going back to Bar Louie -- where it all started!

Three of us got there 30 minutes "early," so we speared a lovely rounded booth facing all the TVs. Got water, reviewed the imbibement list and took a little minute to decide.

Our server (We kept calling her Susie, but then explained to her why we called her Susie, and she got a hoot out of it.) was just spot-on with the leisure and flavor of our table! I wish I could remember her name, but she was absolutely delightful and extremely attentive.

Tuesday is $1 burger night. Well, you gotta know the $1 burger is lettuce and a bun -- it says so explicitly on the menu. No arguments from us readers!! You want cheese, bacon, mayo, grilled onions, raw onions, tomatoes --  anything else -- it costs extra!! For the most part, additions are 50 cents extra. Mayo is 25 cents extra.

The dollar burger menu encourages you to order a basket of fries or tots. Ask how much that costs -- 'cause it ain't $1. We asked. And we asked how many that basket would serve.

OK, here's the rundown: one basket of fries or tots costs $4, and it serves 2-3. BINGO! You got the picture.

We started out with a cone basket of calamari with its lucious ketchup-horseradish sauce. It was wonderful. I wish we'd ordered two.

Then we were on to the burgers. Everybody got exactly what they ordered, brought out by the "kitchen"? Not sure, but he was fabulous. And we got a basket of tots.

By this time our sixth attendee had arrived, and she was giving her burger order to the kitchen guy. He was taking it all in, but then Susie was there, so she took over. Great service!!

And we ordered another basket of tots. There's just something about tots that reminds me of childhood. And, yes, tater tots were already invented when I was a child. (So was fire.)

The burgers just hit the spot! Great buns, a good-sized patty with nice beef flavor and a reasonable amount of lettuce. Add a little ketchup and a lot of mustard (both free), dig into the tots, and you gotta a great meal! I added Cheddar to my burger, so it was a $1.50 burger. There were four cheese options: Cheddar, Pepper Jack, American and Provel (I think).

That second basket of tots was HOT-HOT -- fresh out of the tot-maker!! Yum!! The six of us did not finish that second basket.

A fabulous evening with good friends, good food, good service!

I love Natty Mechanics. It is such a large and garish spot, that it's funny to me that I often overlook it when trying to think of a quick spot to get beer and grub. 

The interior is absolutely excellent. I'm particularly fond of the oddities and other unusual decor. Plus, I'm a big fan of the community-style seating. 

The staff is always super-friendly and very attentive. 

And the food: granted, I rarely order other things than the veggie burger (which is one of the best in the city), but I've never had anything that I didn't like. (Except last night I had a side salad instead of fries and the balsamic dressing was just "off" - no other way to describe it.)

Also, I'm always supremely happy with the draft beer selection.

Really loved the food - it was surprising to find such great vegan options at a mall. 

The toast may seem a little expensive at first glance, but they give you a lot of food and use fresh, delicious ingredients. I was skeptical when ordering, but was completely convinced after I got it.

I could see this place being very popular in DC - I hope they continue expanding!

For my 1100th review, I review the iconic Muriel's Jackson Square, one of the loveliest restaurant/event spaces in New Orleans. I first attended a wedding here on Halloween 2010. My two fabulous friends pulled out all the stops and had an amazing horror movie-themed wedding where Jason and Leatherface got things started with a bang (er, a chainsaw). Sure seems like the folks behind Muriels worked well with my friends and the wedding was an occasion to remember. We were upstairs, where private events are held, and took breaks from the main room in the bordello-like seance room. One of my favorite things about this night included hanging out with cocktails on huge balcony overlooking Jackson Square. 

By the way, if you're dining here and there isn't an event going on, you're free to go upstairs and check all that out. You can even have a drink and bring it up to the Seance Room (and I strongly recommend that you do, if you like rooms dripping in red, chandeliers, velvet and brocade. It makes me want to decorate my entire apartment in a similar fashion). 

Recently I came to realize that besides the gorgeous environs, the restaurant serves up some really great food and drink. My friends and I had lunch here recently. We were seated in the room where they open the huge glass doors to the sidewalk so you can watch passersby and listen to music being played out in Jackson Square. 

At lunchtime, they offer $4 Bloody Marys, wines and martinis. I indulged in a Bloody Mary, as I am often wont to do, and found it to be quite satisfactory (garnished with olives, pickled green beans and citrus and served in a pint glass. No skimping here just cuz it's a mere 4 bucks). 

I ordered the modestly-named Vegetable Plate. I'll be honest and say I wasn't expecting much because I've had many a pedestrian veg plate where they barely even marinate the vegetables before skewering them and grilling. Booooring. 

I'm thrilled to report that Muriel's Vegetable Plate belongs in the Vegetable Plate Hall of Fame. First of all, it contains braised kale. Almost 'nuff said there, but I'll go on to say its flavor is just so so so very good. The other star of the plate is that compact square of polenta flavored with herbs and Parm cheese. Everything is so delicately placed, which I love, and nothing overwhelmed with oils or heavy sauces to "make up for" the fact that you're eating a plate of vegetables. There's a delightful little bit of everything from beets to parsnips to tender shittake mushrooms. A healthy, hearty plate. Thank you, Muriels! I seriously could not stop thinking about it all day.

They also have a gluten-free menu.

I think I'll be dining here on the regular when I have visitors in town. It's just the perfect place to take them when they want the quintessential French Quarter dining experience.

I'm on vacation in Philly and seems like all I've done is eat!

And by far, one of the best restaurants that I've been to is Lolita's.  Granted, I did not order a complete meal.  I simply had an appetizer and dessert.  But the food and the service was phenomenal.  Great service was provided by Lewis, he was kind enough to give his opinion and try to steer me in the right direction.  I settled on carnitas con naranja y canela.  Yeah, like we all know exactly what that is!  It's orange-ginger glazed pork with a hint of mexican cinnamon and was served with pickled red onions, guacamole and salsa.  I loved it, the favors were amazing and it was deliriously spicy hot.

For dessert, I had tres leches de coco.  And while it was not the best version of this dessert that I have ever had, it was still delicious.

I highly recommend this restaurant.  I went in on a Friday night and the place was packed.  And rightfully so.

I really wanted to love this place but they came up short.  The smoked bbq brisket sandwich I had would have benefited greatly from a slice of cheddar.  Alas, that is not a cheese they carry.  Not sure why...it is a natural for a sandwich shop.  

The brisket was alright but nothing special.  Little to no smoke flavor came through with this sandwich and it was a mess.  Also, as previous reviewers have noted they smash their sandwiches unnecessarily.  I left about half of mine uneaten.  

The wife had an Italian and it was better than what I ordered but still nothing spectacular.    

Sorry Snarf - I really wasn't impressed...

This is not a location to purchase bread. This is the commercial bakery. You have to go to a store who carries their bread. 

That being said...oh yum. This is more European than much of the bread around NOLA with a thick heavier crust on their baguettes...which I say as someone who loves a crust. You may have already had their delicious bread as many restaurants around town use it.

Check out their website for their current retail partners which include wine shops and local groceries. PLUS you can take classes with them once a month! which I totally need to do!

It's your standard, run of the mill Ameri-mex.  

Everything was just decent.  The service was fine.  Servers were very friendly with my kids.  

My daughters favorite thing in THE WHOLE WORLD is queso blanco dip.  This queso was SO, SO good but quite a bit to spicy for my nine year old.  I loved it but she had to battle though.

If your on the Westside and craving some junky mex, give it a go!

In the heart of the Italian Market, this authentic Mexican eatery shines brightly.  It serves up some of the best Mexican food I've tasted north of the Rio Grande.  The only possible drawback is not actually a drawback - it's too popular with both Mexican and non-Mexican Philadelphians.  But the service stays always super friendly no matter how many people are trying to crowd into its small space.

The tortas here are in my opinion the best in Philadelphia.  The accompanying sauces are awesome and all are homemade from the Chipotle to the Salsa Verde to the eponymous Mole Poblano.  And on weekends they cook up a totally awesome Tamale as well as their tasty Barbacoa.  If you love south of the border food, hop on the bandwagon trumpeting this Mexican restaurant!

One thing I would like to share is the poor hygiene and sanitation of the place. A friend pointed out the fact that the ice was handled by a young man wearing no gloves and pushing the ice into the 'sno' machine. He was sweaty and itchy which resulted in him scratching himself all over and wiping off his sweat with his bare hands followed by handling the ice and pushing it in the machine. The counter was a mess and seemed like there was no real order. The staff had to run back and forth between the rooms to grab different flavors. I guess they are trying to change little but it seems that things would run more efficiently if small changes were made. I have been to other sno cone shops in the area which are cleaner and more sanitary. I guess people down here are so fond of their childhood memories of this place that they fail to notice these small details. If you don't care about hygiene then you will love Hansens.

Lovely setting along the downtown St. Petersburg waterfront makes this a great choice for al fresco dining, when the weather allows. The interior features brightly colored walls and lots of windows that fill the space with natural light during the daytime.

The interior can quickly become noisy during prime dining times so keep that in mind when deciding whether to dine indoors or outside.

Some of the chairs had seat cushions but not all. Not sure what the rationale is behind that but your behind may appreciate a little extra cush beneath the tush so select your seat wisely.

The menu, true to its backstory, focuses on foods featuring citrus, seafood and smoke. The prices seemed a tad on the high side but the dishes served were definitely well prepared and well presented.

There was a bit of confusion regarding my order but what I was served in its place was definitely tasty and worth a ordering again if, and when, I visit again. 

This would be a great spot to meet for a drink and have an appetizer while watching the sunset but not sure it would be a regular stop for lunch. 

Definitely would recommend to anyone who has not yet tried it, especially to guests of the hotel as well as others visiting the area for fun or for business.

My friends and I swung in here post the event at City Tap House and had a pretty alright time. 

The waiter was on the ball and attentive for the most part and I probably scared him away after telling him we enjoy reviewing restaurants on Yelp but oh well. 

They apparently changed up the menu since the last time my friends were here so out goes the banh mi selection. I settled on splitting a order of disco fries which was essentially fries covered in gravy and cheese. It was pretty OK but to be honest, I would've much rather had my fries drenched in gravy and cheese because I love heart attacks on a plate.

Though I didn't order any beer, the selection here was sweet so I'm definitely looking forward to a round 2.

I really liked the lighting and set-up of the place- overall, a great atmosphere for food and drinks.

This was our first stop upon landing in Tennessee. AND I DO NOT REGRET IT ONE BIT. This is some of the best BBQ I've ever had! I got the BBQ pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw and mac& cheese for the sides... HOLY MOTHER OF PEARL. SO GOOD. 

PRO TIP: You better wear some stretchy pants to this place or just unbutton your jeans! The portions are huge and the food is so good you will NOT want to stop eating lol. To be honest I didn't LOVE the coleslaw (but I'm a coleslaw snob). The BBQ pulled pork and mac & cheese were mouthwatering, I wish I could've gotten seconds because it was THAT GOOOOD. This is a must if you're ever in Nashville. And it's on a side street away from the crazy crowds so you're not jam packed next to people. The entire staff is super friendly and there's unlimited seating inside + outside. Check it out, you won't be disappointed!!!!

Couturie Forest is a super cool spot in City Park that is perfect for exploring trails and bits of wildlife. There are some fun teepees built around the forest and a swing you can find to enjoy some fun time on. Priscilla loves the forest and the peace and tranquility of a walk through these trails. It's beautiful any time of year.

Why is it that we love the things we can't have? I guess it's that "grass-is-greener" mentality - the things that are taboo to us seem the sexiest. But in this case, I don't think it's unhealthy, and I believe I'm right to covet that which I am denied on many occasions. 

I love Cuban cigars. And Cuban rum for that matter. And because of some age-old grudge, which really no longer f*cking applies, I can't get them in the U-S-of-A. And it annoys the ever-loving shit out of me. 

So every time I travel outside of the US, I find my way to a tobacconist and score (not with my money, if the US government is reading this) myself some of the finest hand-rolled tobacco to grace the face of this earth. On a recent trip to Canada, I found my beloved brown beauties at Burlington-on-Whyte, which stocks an impressive collection of vintage, regional and specialty selections. 

The staff at Burlington are incredibly friendly and helpful, willing to provide suggestions for those of us who don't know the whole Cuban portfolio, since our stupid and outdated governmental policies won't allow. Of course you'll pay a pretty penny for this selection and knowledge - prices much higher than I'm used to forking over for similar product. But these babies are well-kept and cared for, and sublimely curated, so that probably does add some value.  

There's nothing quite like the buttery deliciousness of some fine, island-grown hand-rolled cigars. Find yours at Burlington.

Even though it's in a very new building we walked into what felt like a cozy inviting place. 
I'd let them know on Open Table reservation that we were celebrating a birthday & asked to be seated in a nice corner. They have a private nook in back that was perfect. I really appreciated their attention to detail. 
We started with the bread & butter. The 2 butters were full of flavor & the fire grilled bread made for a good beginning. 
Next we shared the Duck Pastrami Salad. Almost went for the Beers but my wife is a sucker for Brussels Sprouts & we were both thrilled. The individual components were varied & each quite tasty but gathering a single bite containing all was exquisite. On a side note - neither of us are duck lovers but the pastrami was a revelation. 
The main took a very non-traditional detour (for us) in that we opted for Beijing Chicken & Big Night Pie (a vegetarian dish) setting them between us to share. 
I'm convinced some voodoo magic was employed to get chicken that crispy & cooked through while remaining light & juicy. The marriage of sauces was fantastic & I could've eaten a plateful of the dim sum.
The cheese in your first bite of pie bursts forth in your mouth evoking the very best memories of every time you've eaten cheese. As an Aussie I appreciate savory pies more than most & will gladly eat this again. 
I can't forget to tell you that YOU MUST get the Vegetable Potato Salad for a side. If you've never had warm crispy potatoes in a salad you'll thank me. If you've had this, or it's very near kin at Etch, then you know exactly what I'm talking about.

Excellent sushi, decent prices, nice setting, attentive service. They have a traditional sushi menu and excellent quality fish. uni melted in your mouth and it was reasonably priced, which is rare. I hope this place catches on because it is a lovely alternative to crowded and overpriced nearby sushi place which will not be named. Hope they get more outside seating and maybe a few more salad appetizer or gyoza options. Worth a try

This is the spot during summer. The location is scenic along the Boise River. The staff is friendly, is owned and operated by a husband and wife team. They're proud of their work and love to show it off, and offered my friends and I a tour of the facility. 

The wine. The wine... yeah that's the good stuff, too. All the better when you know you're supporting a great local business ran by great local people.

Open in winter and they have a fire pit, don't let the cold discourage ya

I love the decor of this place. Classic warehouse turned into venue with spacious dance floor and good sound system. One issue I have is the drinks being one level above you in the 21+ section, eliminating any convenience

What a great brunch experience this was for me! I pass by this restaurant often and today finally stopped in for brunch. This was exactly the relaxed vibe I was looking for as a way to start my week. Although I spent most of my time sitting and eating outside, I was invited in by the owner and Manager who collected my info for seating. He was immediately able to sit me outside! Drew, Gage and the Manager truly made this a great and welcoming experience for me. They each checked in on me frequently but not in an overbearing way. I absolutely love a staff who has an awareness of customer needs all while they are working so hard to meet the needs of other customers. Additionally, the food here did not disappoint. I order the fried chicken sandwich that came with collard greens on top. Flavorful would be a complete understatement. That sandwich was SO good that I ordered a side of greens after I was finished with my meal. I mean, does it get any better than this? I'm so happy to have found a location that is well kept, that follows covid-19 safety regulations with seating customers, has impeccable customer service with food that keeps me coming back for more. See y'all soon and thanks for a great experience!

Chicken pot pie.  It's an All-American comfort food that just screams your name ("Allie!  Allie!  Allie!") on a cold winter afternoon.  We'd just finished up a movie at the Riverside theater and I popped over here to get something warm and filling.  For $11, I got the chicken and mushroom pot pie which was just the perfect size (not too big, not too small) AND a very generously sized salad that came with Gorgonzola cheese, walnuts and sliced apples.  The decor was simple but inviting. Loved the music - a little bit of Michael Franti, a little bit of Bob Marley, a little of the Nappy Roots (hey, give me credit that I even KNOW who the Nappy Roots are).

The only downside was the service, which is provided by kids who are coming out of the foster care system.  After waiting for at least 10 minutes, no one came by to bring water or take an order.  Finally got up and went to the  cash register. No one there. Peeked my head into the kitchen and finally got someone's attention.  So perhaps a bit more training and a suggestion to be a bit friendlier and warmer to customers might be helpful.  Maybe the kid was just shy and new.

PRO TIP #1:  Only saw the sign as I was walking out, but if you like them on Facebook, you get a free beverage.

PRO TIP #2:  Parking on the street is free on Sundays.

PRO TIP #3: Validated parking in the garage on First St. by Silver Peak. 

PRO TIP #4: They sell their Pies Take and Bake for those nights when you just need a little comfort!

It is seldom that I am underwhelmed by a tiki bar. But I have to say, overall, I was not that impressed with this one. My bf and I stopped in one night and ordered a drink to share, as we were already getting a little soused. The bartender looked disinterested and bored, and did not crack a smile or engage us in any way. He had the personality of a piece of cardboard, which is not typical of a tiki bar at all. I have yet to go to one and find such a surly welcoming committee. 

The bar itself is actually very lovely, and HUGE. I think it has a bit too much space, given how empty it was when we walked in. But who knows? Maybe it gets busier over the weekend. I am not really sure. It is, however, well-decorated, and about as tiki-fied as you can get. Bonus points for the decor and seating. They also have an interesting spin-the-wheel game, for those who can't decide what to drink. 

The next night, I visited once again, and the bartender that night was much more engaging and friendly, cracking jokes and bantering with the patrons sitting at the bar. The only downside? They were out of the liquor gummies I wanted to try, and they were also out of their house-aged rum they use to make their strong Mai Tais. Oh, well. The drinks he made for us were good, though. Made up for the experience the night before, anyway!

My only regret going to Edmonton is that I didn't see any cows. However, that didn't stop me from eating some, and DOSC was the best introduction to the Albertan beef culinary scene I could've hoped for. 

Located right in downtown Edmonton, DOSC has got that classy but unpretentious vibe that I really dig. Beautiful open space with rustic furniture, wood beam ceilings, slightly steampunk feels. I love it. Fantastic place to grab a craft cocktail or a great steak, which is exactly what I did. 

Visiting from Toronto, I cannot get over how much steak I can get for my money. A beautiful 10 oz dry-aged ribeye for $42...that's better value than the Keg! And obviously so much tastier. The juicy steak was perfectly medium rare, sitting on a fluffy cushion of garlicky pomme puree. Also go the Oxtail Poutine which was great with fresh fries and savoury oxtail meat but the real star of the show was the Brussel Sprouts. The large size was big enough to share between 4 and the sprouts were perfectly crispy, a little citrusy and a little sweet. We added pancetta to it and it was absolute perfection. Great recommendation from our server, who was also superb! 

If you're looking for a great place for a date, or just craving some good meat, DOSC is the place to go!

The ice cream flavours are stronger than before, and much much tastier! The matcha was the right amount of flavour and sweetness. 

My sister tried the ube and loved it-- said it tastes exactly like it would in Philippines! My brother got mangga (mango) and really enjoyed his as well :)

Awesome team here at WaWa. I've lived in the area for almost two years now. Within the first week of visiting WaWa the staff made me feel like a regular, as if they knew me for a decade! Staff is so friendly, professional and I always feel taken care of. Love their positive attitude! On top of that, the location is super convenient and the facility is always clean and organized. What more could you ask? Well, they also serve delicious food! I recommend the everything bagel. :D If you haven't been to this WaWa, come on in. You will feel welcomed and get good service!

I am not a fan of truffles, at all, but I love their truffle parmesan fries. They taste so rich and flavorful. The amount you get for $3 is a good deal - I highly recommend them! Four stars for the fries.

I tried their Sonoran corn dog because I love Sonoran hot dogs, but this just wasn't the same. The yellow mustard was pretty overpowering and the guacamole seemed to have muted the other flavors. It definitely needed more jalapenos and aioli and way less mustard.  Three stars.

I think the truffle parm fries are keeping me interested and I can't wait to try Stack's buffalo chicken sliders.

The ramen is really good! The soup wasn't too slaty and I loved that the noodles weren't too soft; it was the perfect texture. The service was excellent as well. I went around dinner time so there were other customers in the restaurant, but we were seated immediately! The waiters are constantly refilling water and making sure everything is good so A+ for customer service!

This was the second taqueria in our two-part taste test for the best local taco joint. You can tell this place is a favorite because there was a line before they even opened, and everyone was ordering food for dining in plus more food to go. The man in front of us ordered something like 30 tacos plus another couple for himself to enjoy in the dining area. I wanted to crash whatever gathering he was catering! Or steal his lunch for the next five days. 

I give four stars because I personally loved Lilly's more. Don't get me wrong... the flavor of the food was excellent. I know why there is a line now. It's personal preference. I did appreciate the condiment bar at Lilly's. The one at La Super was more limited in options. The dining area isn't large enough to accommodate the crowd that comes to this place, but maybe that helps keep courteous people making their seating available as soon as they've finished. 

I encourage you to give this spot a try though! Maybe check out another spot or two in town for your own taste testing fun.

I'm kicking myself in the butt for not getting the cold brew with coffee ice cubes but I did pick up a latte. The latte was so well balanced for me, I didn't have to add any extra condiments or added sugar (which is very rare for me). It was so good, I need to go back and get the cold brew with coffee ice cubes because I'm sure that would've been just as great. 

The first thing I noticed was the Christian music playing in the back ground which I loved! It's so rare to walk into any store and hear Christian music without shame.  I'm not talking about the kind of Christian music everyone listens to like "Oceans" by the Hillsongs, I'm talking Christian music that sings "I believe in God our father, our god is three in one". 

While I waited, I enjoyed the open window concept where guests can watch the employees make donuts and bring your creation to life. 

On the down side, I did wish the menu was posted somewhere. I expected the menu to be exhibited behind the cash register or on a sign somewhere on the ledge as it normally is at most places but after a minute I noticed they only had laminated menus to look at. 

All in all, I had a pretty positive experience. The ambience, customer service and coffee was great!

When in Nashville for a holiday weekend, I had originally intended to trek over to Marche for a leisurely Saturday brunch. At the last minute, I recalled that I had driven by Thistle Farms a couple of days prior and my dining companion had said how much she wanted to try it out post-renovation. After checking out some Yelp reviews, I suggested that we forego the longer drive to (and inevitably longer wait at) Marche and give Thistle a go.

GREAT decision.  It was easy to find a parking spot in the lot behind the restaurant, and it was so inviting stepping into the bright, spacious, sunny space.  When you visit, look up.  Above you is a seriously cool teacup installation, which is a cool contrast with the somewhat sleek and un-fussy decor.  In front of you there is a sign directing you to grab a menu and then proceed to the register to order in this fast casual establishment.  Menu was enticing with a lot of tasty sounding salads, sandwiches, sides, and staple brunch dishes like quiche and a breakfast bowl.  At the register, we were engaged in friendly conversation, affirmation of our good choices, and then we took our number and proceeded past a tasty-looking pastry display to find a good table.  

A few minutes after finding our way to a very comfortable communal table (there are private tables and booths, too - in more than one dining room), our server brought along our order.  I had the Bombay Avocado Tartine which was honestly the best avocado toast I have ever had.  And, let's be real, I live in NYC and I'm not afraid to admit that I'm a little basic and I've had a LOT of avocado toast. It was the perfect blend of spice with fresh herbaceous microgreens and cucumber and a very flavorful drizzle. It was great with my little pot of tea, and was supremely fresh.  My dining companion had the farm-fresh breakfast bowl with eggs, potatoes, some greens that she said tasted as though they had just been plucked from the earth, etc.  She also had the London Fog and said it was a very good take.

Nearby, there was what seemed to be a bridal or baby shower, and we commented that this would be a good place for a party, a ladies who lunch date, an actual date, or even to come do work - a welcome break from the Nashville coffee house scene. Everyone who worked there was so friendly, stopping to say goodbye before we headed out, and it's really a wonderful mission that I was happy to support.

Definitely stop by the shop on your way out - I left with some lovely citrus body butter and some other cool odds and ends.  I hope that Thistle Farms Cafe gets the traffic that it very well deserves!

I usually rave about Surf Shack.  Not so much this time.  Service was great.  The food was acceptable. I always love the various shrimp tacos.  The chicken tacos were a bit dry. Daughter reported: Her Mongolian bowl was too salty.  I tasted it and it seemed fine. We'll be back.

Haven't been to a five guys in quite some time, probably a year. I used to go to the one in florrisant all the time. Is it just me, or have the prices gone up? I mean really up. I spent almost $15 just on a burger n fries, at a fast food spot. To me that's a lot, like I could've went to a sit down restaurant, at those prices. Anyways, my burger was just so so, as were the fries. I didn't even finish the fries, that's so unlike me, I love fresh cut fries! So I proably won't be returning to a Five Guys anytime soon, I will just go to steak n shake instead, prices are more reasonable, and burgers are always fresh.

I get why some people may have felt a little lukewarm about this place. It's kind of tucked away in the back of a strip mall. The service can be hit or miss. The decor is not really my style either. But I have two words for you: TUNA DUMPLING. I would seriously walk to New Jersey to order the TUNA DUMPLING.

Uh, so best thing to do is look at my picture, but it's basically a faux dumpling that looks like a soup dumpling but instead of a dumpling skin, the outside of the dumpling is made out of tuna. The inside is a combo of creamy crab and something crunchy... panko maybe, I don't know. It is served on a plate with two sauces -- a sweet hoisin type sauce and a creamy wasabi sauce. Combined with the tuna and crab it is deeelicious. It's something I truly crave. Like I seriously could just come here and eat two of these and call it a day.

Otherwise, we generally like the sushi. Loved the Halloween roll this last time. The Cha Cha Roll was OK, my hubby really liked it. Also like the New York handroll, with slices of green apple. Sunday and Monday sushi is 30% off. TUNA DUMPLING.

I always love going for a hike/walk through the park. If you're looking for something flat, Forbidden Drive is great. Otherwise there are plenty of hiking trails throughout (watch out for the bikers-they come in fast but always announce themselves). 

The area is super dog-friendly and has great views. I love coming in the Fall to see all of the leaves change. Tons of great places to go eat/drink nearby after (I love going to wissahickon brewery!). 

The only drawback is the lack of parking.

Great to be back in the STL. I was here on a job assignment three years ago and back again. Brought my bike with me from California and my first ride was to ride the 6-mile loop around Forest Park. Love that there is both a gravel and paved trail to accommodate wheels and feet. I've cycled this park in snow, rain and sunshine and always come away feeling peaceful. This park has a special place in my heart.

Everything, and I mean everything is here. Whether it's fruit and veggies, to furniture, to pretty paintings to cheesy 8 track tapes.  They have everything here and a great variety. If you are a male or female, young kid or teenager, there is something for you.  Even the wonderful pets in your life have a place to shop.  All the jewelry and purses that girls love and the make up and all that good stuff, it's there.  Lastly, all that stuff that you buy at the touristy places, souvenirs, etc, yep all here.

I am excited to have gone here. I feel like it's one of the biggest flea markets with everything in it, not just the same ol stuff at each stand. My favorite was the tiki guy who makes tiki bars. They have so much detail, of course they cost and arm and a leg, and I don't know if people actually spend an arm, leg, and whatever at a flea market, but hey it was really cool!

Check it out! I think it's good for one of those rainy days when you want to do something but don't want to stay home. I always feel like when it rains, I have no idea what to do since it's always sunny in FL. 

P.S. You can bring your doggie!
i love this place....DAMN the burgers are good...cant  stop wont stop mmmm

Why 5 stars? Because it successfully helped with me severe case of missing-Hawaii-itis.

   ---   ---   ---

After getting married in Hawaii a month prior to this writing, we've been visiting every Hawaiian restaurant that we can find in Tampa Bay. The Honu is definitely one of my favorites so far! I ordered the Manu Kea & Keck I & II, which is a long way of saying beef, spinach and rice. The beef had a phenomenal flavor to it, and despite its basic nature, I really loved it and could eat it every day.

For dessert we shared a couple of things: the macademia nut ice cream and this cookie crumble thing that was served inside a glass. I was really glad we ordered these two things together because they complimented each other nicely. If I had to pick a favorite, I'd have to go with the ice cream.

As for the vibe of the Honu, they definitely did a great job of making you feel like you're actually in Hawaii. If only we could add some mountains in Dunedin, we'd be all set. We sat outside with our dog, and they even brought him a meal of chicken and sweet potatoes for $3. If Moose could type, I'm certain he'd be offering a 5-star review as well.

I really wanted to give this Chili's a higher rating, because it really was a mixed bag of good and bad.  Unlike many other reviewers, we had no problems with the service.  Our waitress was friendly, helpful, and efficient.  And our Southwest Eggroll appetizer was great.  But they always are.

Then we got the drinks.  The Margaritas were very good, but my wife's Cosmopolitan was not well made at all.  She thinks it had way too much Triple-Sec, but she didn't like it.  And as I've mentioned before, she tends to judge a restaurant by its Cosmos.

We went to Chili's because I was in the mood for Fajitas.  I had the Chicken/Carnitas combo, and they were very, very good.  I love the way it looks, the sound of the sizzle, and the aroma coming off the pan.  But I was the only one happy with my dinner.  My wife's tacos were stone cold by the time she got them.  My son's steak was very underdone for him.  I like a very rare stake, but he's more civilized than I am. 

My daughter was very disappointed with her Margherita Flatbread.  It was downright soggy.  Seriously, why would they do that?  She is a vegetarian, and Chili's does not have many vegetarian-friendly menu items.  The Margherita Flatbread has always been her go-to at Chili's, and this experience may just guarantee that we'll never be back.  

And I will sure miss those fajitas.

Came in on Thursday morning for breakfast. We were seated right away. Our server gave us a warm greeting and tried to upsell us on some mimosas (it was just too early for us to start drinking)... took us a minute to make a decision, but our server was more than patient in our indecisiveness. 

My boyfriend and I both ordered omelettes. They were ok. I wasn't feeling the carbs, but my bf said the potatoes were good! When the food runner brought our food he asked if he could get us anything else, and then immediately brought it to the table, then asked one more time - I loved that & SOOOO appreciated it! This way we weren't waiting for additional condiments while the food got cold.

Honestly, the food was ok. But the service is really what made it a good experience for us. Fast, quick, efficient, easy. What more do you need from breakfast?!

I've been wanting to write a review for the Peppermill Casino for a while now. Its more of a one stop casino, resort, spa and dinning desination. 
We love to come and take advantage of the beautiful pool area in the warmer months. They have two large pools, plenty of deck area with loungers and seats. And great poolside service.
The restaurants are all fabulous with great food that is plentiful. They offer fresh baked  pasteries and desserts, gelato and specialty coffees.  Most times my husband and I split plates. They have an outstanding prime rib french dip in Biscotti's.  Bimini is a top notch steakhouse with really unparalleled service. And huge martini drinks that they fill to the tippy top. Over by the Sports Book they have a deli with a new york style ruben and pastrami on rye. Even the sauerkraut is fresh made with hints of sauted bacon. 
The rooms are spacious and well appointed. I love the smell of the bath products. 
When we stay at Peppermill we actually never need to leave. I love all of the screens and photos from all over the world. Its fun to sit in a quite spot and literally watch the world go by.

I want to love Yats, I really do.  But what holds it back is that the food tastes about two levels above Whole Foods hot takeout. In New Orleans, this would be called "Creole-style" and "Cajun-style"-- order a variety of what they offer and you'll find that much of it tastes the same, and the seasoning and depth of flavor is just MIA.  The portions are good and the prices are friendly, as are all the staff members. Yats has had a solid run for many years now in the city and I appreciate them. What they do, they do quite well.  Just don't expect to be blown away by them.

Know what I love about Mod Pizza? You can out anything on your pizza and it's all the same price. It's like Subway but better. I love the crust and the option of toppings. I do wish they had broccoli. I give it 4 stars only because the wait can be quite long, but the food is always good. Ask for a side of ranch, no additional fees.

What a neat beach! 

The parking is awful, but if you time it right you'll be able to find a spot in the front lot. It's on the smaller side so beware. There's also a restaurant on site. However, what makes this beach so awesome is how accommodating it is for dog owners. Yes, it's a dog beach! But how many dog beaches have designated dog-leash and off-leash sides? And a dog washing station? (It's not free though)

It's great for dog owners and dog lovers (just cause you don't have a pet dog doesn't mean you can't love them am I right). The beach is also clean, although there was a little too much seaweed for my liking. Overall, it's a good beach to check out!

I have been coming here for three years now! A summary of this place is a little slice of heaven. The pizza crust is a nice texture, not too doughy, but not burnt to a crisp. The cheese actually STAYS on the pizza and doesn't rip everything off when you bite it although it still stays nice and stretchy. The breadsticks are very nice, chewy just like I like them.

Before I get into specifics, the only reason this place is a four star because of the price. Being a middle class citizen with a humble income, the prices are a bit high, so I only come here on special occasions. Starting off with the pesto, very zesty, and right amount of herbs. Meatlovers is the best, no other words.

JOCKAMOS IS THE BEST! Friendly services, good food, but a little bit of a high price.

Six Mile Bridge is located on Dorsett just west of Schuetz, the atmosphere here is very simple, with about 10 tables and a small bar. The staff provides a fun and friendly attitude which adds to the charm. Food service here is limited to popcorn, however you can order from the Frankly Sausages food truck which is located outside Thursday-Saturday evening. I highly recommend the Mary's Little Lamb, you can thank me later.

As far as the beers go I was pleased with everything on the menu. My recommendation is to not try just one of two of their delicious brews but try the flight, that way you can sample them all. Personally I preferred the Irish Red with Honey, it was perfectly balanced and satisfying beer. However much to my surprise I really enjoyed the Irish Stout, and that says a lot considering I am usually not a fan of stouts in general, it had the perfect balance of flavor and a slight hint of chocolate.  Kudos to their brew master for introducing me to a stout that I finally love! Other two beers were the Session IPA and the Bavarian Hefeweizen, both were very refreshing.

Six Mile Bridge is a great new addition to the St. Louis Craft Beer scene, I recommend stopping in and trying a flight!

If you are looking for a place where you can buy hot donuts then Shipleys is the best. We love hot donuts and If you ask Shipleys they give you hot, out of the fryer donuts. We got a dozen and boy these donuts are so soft, melt in your mouth. Now these are best eaten the same day, usually to me they don't taste that great if you leave them for the next day. I definitely recommend this place.

Okay so I'm not even a sushi fan but baaaaaaby!! When I say fire, Fire!! It's fried and delicious! Especially dipped in the soy sauce! Now if you come hungry get a full plate yourself but if you're just looking for a snack you can share with another person. I love the scenery it's legit rock and roll. The menu looks like a record and they play rock and roll on the TVs in there. They've been low on staff so they may move slowly but as quickly as they can. You'll probably get your food faster ordering to go. You'll be parking behind or on the side street prior to getting to rocknroll, I usually find a park so it's not really something to stress about. If you like sushi you'll enjoy it, if you don't like it, go give it a try. I'm not a fan of sushi, wouldn't be my first choice but I loved this and I've been back plenty of times!

I love love love love...did I mention that I LOVE Ted's Famous Smoked fish! I've been coming here for several years and it never disappoint. There is nothing more delicious than some fresh smoked fish with their amazing German potato salad and coleslaw, yum! It is cash only so don't forget to bring some money and they also have the best key lime pie as well.  Did I mention the smoked fish spread, yes you want to try that too! Plenty of open seating as well :)

Not sure what happened to my previous reviews I was just going to update this but I disappeared. 

To this day Umami has the best Korean Fried Chicken wings. The wings are fried to crispy perfection and the soy garlic is the cherry on top! I would bathe in that soy garlic it's liquid gold! Michelle is always so friendly and always says hi to everyone who enters the restaurant. The vibe is always chill I love the k-pop music that plays in the background. Also, the patio is the perfect spot for date night! 

Tip: pls be patient while waiting on your wings it's so worth it! Also, try to let cool before devouring!

Brought the fam jam to Huma post swimming in the Mill Creek Ravine outdoor pool (free for the outdoor season again this year - 2018... but I digress ;-)

Now first off, I'll admit it and get it right out there that I haven't not found Mexican in Alberta that lives up to what I grew up with in Washington State and California.  

Huma was a solid 3 Alberta stars.  The food was okay - not mind blowing, not bad, okay.  Neither of my kids like the beans which is weird because that's usually they're favourite. 

We came on a Tuesday... but no Taco Tuesday specials in sight.  The special of the day was mojitos and I most definitely enjoyed a cold one of those made with love.

Our server was friendly and knowledgeable. 

the kiddo special (quesadilla) was a hit with mom and dad but not the kids.  My kids must be broken. 

Overall, we left satisfied but not really wanting to come back for the food.  As mentioned by other reviewers the decor is awesome and the ambience perfect.  Unfortunately, the food just didn't hit the spot with any of us.  

If you're looking for authentic delicious fresh Mexican, I'd highly recommend Calle Mexico on the North Side just a hop and a skip out of downtown.

Ice cream in December? When it's OwowCow, the answer is always a resounding YES. 

This place prides themselves on their locally sourced product. Everything is made or procured locally, and it really makes a difference. Sure, you're going to pay a little more for a cone here, but you're supporting multiple local business and getting a delicious, organic treat that's free of the extra garbage corporations will add in. It is SO.WORTH.IT. 

They are always trying new flavors, so you can easily try something different every visit if you'd like. The kids behind the counter here are super friendly and will happily give you a tasting of any flavor before you get stuck ordering something and don't like it. 
They are peanut free here, which is cool for all the peanut allergy folks out there. 

Let's just say, I don't think you can go wrong here. The house vanilla is still my favorite, but I also have not been disappointed in any other flavor they offer. They have a ton of topping choices as well- my fav being the chocolate "chips". I don't know what planet these hunks of shaved chocolate would be considered chips, but they are the perfect pairing for the vanilla. 

Bunch of fun cone options here too. Waffle cones with fancy dipped treat edges- from cookie pieces to candy bits. I usually just go with a cup because I can't finish the regular size on my own, but if you want a challenge, go for the waffle. 

The fridge at the counter is also full of local drinks, pints of their ice cream, and various to go treats depending on the day. They offered ice cream pies and ice cream sandwiches on my most recent visit before Christmas. 

Owowcow, I love you. I wish I could pack you up and take you home to South Carolina with me! I will, however, stop in here every time I'm in the area!!

Visited on new year's day around 6:30pm and half the restaurant was empty. No wait compared to the other restaurants near by was a huge plus. But don't underestimate the food and service! I enjoyed coming here way more than our first night at Felix. The oysters were bigger and better (you can see them shucking away in the corner). It was here that my husband felt that the chargrilled should be a bit more done, but I thought it was perfect. Maybe because of my love for raw ones, so hey no harm done. 

What helped me decide on going to Desire instead of other restaurants that night was their offering of crab mac and cheese. It looked so good and the photos and lives up to the hype! I can also see why it's an appetizer instead of an entree - it's a lot of bites of the same creaminess that you might want to share with others instead of eating it over and over. My husband got the fried oyster and shrimp poboys - pretty good too. 

One star lost since they were out of a lot of ingredients for their signature drinks. I guess with the Clemson/Alabama fans and NYE, visitors depleted the city.

I had the opportunity to eat at Gordon Biersch for first time on 7/17/2015 for my brother's wedding rehearsal dinner. I was eager to try it due to the rave reviews & I am pleased to say that I wasn't disappointed. 

The event room was set up to seat 26 people with a preselected menu that included: an appetizer, a Caesar salad, three entree selections, & dessert. 

We had only one server who was attentive and patient with our large party needs & requests. The kitchen was slow with preparing our food to come out simultaneously but we entertained ourselves with toasts & speeches to the bride & groom. 
The glazed chicken wings & Caesar salad were good. Those who ordered the Alaskan salmon all agreed including myself that is was a bit dry & lacked seasoning, but the kale & quinoa was tasty. However those who ordered the pasta dishes stated that they were delicious (cajun pasta & lobster & shrimp mac n' cheese) & will order it again. For dessert we all had the triple chocolate brownie topped with vanilla ice cream & we all loved it. 

Thanks Gordon Biersch for making this a memorable event for my brother, new sister-in-law, & family. We had a great time!

This place is just plain fun for lovers of all things pizza.  Do they make the best pie in the world? Not even close. But for an all you can order/eat type establishment I was very impressed. But unlike places like CiCi's and other pig trough buffet lines where pizza primarily bakes under lamps until it gets refilled, the concept here is more fun and unique. Order a pie or two, or three... etc. And they will bring it by your table and ask how many slices you want. You can take as many or as little as you want. But the fun part is that pizza keeps rolling by your table from other tables orders hot and fresh, so you really never need to leave your table to try different varieties of pies. What goes through the dining room uneaten gets put on the buffet line for people to graze if they wish. They have an eclectic assortment of pies with funky ingredients and they also let you create your own. And the best part. The dessert pies are simply sinful! If you leave this place with an empty unsatisfied belly, you're just not doing it right!

Wonderful experience at The Mill!

Top reasons to dine here:
--Inventive menu that delivers on quality and flavor from starters to desserts
--Knowledgeable and friendly service throughout
--Funky decor with unique touches
--Tasty cocktails and local beers on tap

Eat here now! That's really all I need to say. If you love good food this is a must eat.

As a Cuban American born and raised in Miami I have been searching for an authentic Cuban "cafeteria" style restaurant since I moved to Tampa 7 years ago. 

7 years. That's how long it took for me to find Maikel's Kitchen. Since I stumbled upon Maikel's Kitchen two weeks ago I must have eaten here about 10 times, and each time I have dragged a friend or friends to eat this God-sent food that has been cooked with abuela (grandmother) like-love. 

I have had all the types of rice, the ropa Vieja (pulled beef), the bbq pork ribs, picadillo (ground beef), the Cuban sandwich, media noche (midnight) sandwich, pulled pork sandwich, steak sandwich, smoothies, and their Cuban style pastries. 


Let me be the first, and most bold, to say that Maikel's Kitchen has the VERY BEST Cuban Sandwich in ALL of Tampa Bay (yes, better than West Tampa Sandwich and Bodega). The folks claiming the Cuban was not good, also described a Cuban sandwich that was not authentic. Therefore, what they were looking for is not a Cuban sandwich. 

Everything about Maikel's Kitchen is authentic. From the moment you walk in to the moment you walk out. 

Not only is the food AMAZING, but the prices are unbeatable. A Cuban sandwich goes for $4 and change, and a full meal will not run you more than $15 and will be enough to split with someone else or save for later (I can EAT, and I can't ever finish the meal on my own.) 



Anyway, I'm so excited they are here and hope they are here to stay. They are now running with the best Cuban Food Crown. 

Pictures to come. 


- an excited Cuban Kid from Miami.

Amazing attention to detail and customer service!
Attended a private event here recently and felt right at home. We were able to hang decorations, confirm dietary preferences and set up a dessert station all before the guest of honor arrived. From the moment we were seated, we were offered beverages, given fresh baked garlic knots and dishes flooded with olive oil and roasted garlic gloves that melt in your mouth like butter.
The food just kept coming and only after I thought I may have to roll myself home did I stop to breathe.
Round one began with heaping bowls of spinach salad, then juicy meatballs covered in gravy with extra side dishes of gravy, and handmade arrancini balls, with.... you guessed it, more gravy!!!
We elected to choose our individual entrees and a friend and I swapped plates to share  the mushroom ravioli and chicken over mashed potatoes with asparagus.
Those raviolis though! Just when I thought I couldn't get one more mouthful  down, in anticipation of dessert (we provided -and I was determined to eat) I'd take a bite of the ravioli and a chunk of perfectly cooked mushroom rich and early would explode out.
Lucky for me I only had a 2 hr meter so I had 2 mini breaks to run and re up the meter and digest.

Cute, quaint, delicious and byob- go try it!

I don't get people to go here enough -- the rooftop area is phenomenal, and probably unbeatable in Old City, and the whole menu and bar is very classy. I've been here for some drinkery and brunch. 

For happy hour, loved it. Doesn't get crowded, and at least in the early spring, we were able to bring a large group to the roof deck. Quite a treat! For food, the one meal I had there was brunch (no drink specials for brunch, by the way. Scandalous!) and the quinoa salad was quite good.

I was a bit disappointed in the lack of vegan options ... but I was mostly put off by a clueless server. When I asked what was available that would fit a vegan diet, I swear she looked at me like I had three heads and basically betrayed that I might have been the first vegan she'd met in her life (as a server in Philadelphia? this I find hard to believe). I'm happy to explain "vegan" after 11 years, but the treatment was quite odd. This coupled with an incorrect bill the last time I came for happy hour ... I have my doubts ... 

Still, it hasn't put me off ... I'd probably come back for a happy hour that turns into "maybe" dinner to try the menu again, and maybe have better luck. One of those places where even when it disappoints me, I'll probably keep coming back.

This place was a pleasant surprise. From outside it looks like a cute little restaurant, but it's much bigger inside. We came for a holiday dinner party. We were seated in a side room that had a TV, a larger party like ours, and two smaller parties. The room was pretty spacious. 

The spot:
Great vibes. As soon as you walk-in, you're immediately greeted by the host. Welcoming and friendly. It was a Friday night at 5pm, the place was already busy for happy hour. This would be a great spot for happy hour, one of the few spots that has a Monday-Friday happy hour from 4pm-6pm. This is a fun bar for groups, an intimate dinner, or cocktails with friends. I would recommend this spot to anyone looking for an overall good time. 

Service was excellent. Our server (forgot her name) was attentive, helpful, and very friendly. 

They offer private dining rooms for larger parties, such a great option for a holiday dinner party! 

The food:
You had me at gluten-free pizza crust. I'm always in search for the best gluten-free pizza crust in town. And I thought I found my favorite, but I have now found the winner! There is no comparison! The dough texture is very similar to regular crust, soft just not as fluffy. The taste is spot on and doesn't taste like some of the sad bland gluten-free pizza crusts you'll find at other local spots. Gotta love a pizza straight out of a wood fired pizza oven. It is literally the BEST! This is exactly what I want in a pizza crust, since I can't have gluten. Local pizza joints should take note of Liberty's pizza crust! Just WOW! It's that good! It was a $3 up charge, but it was definitely worth it. 

Okay, I'll stop drooling over the pizza crust and move on! I got the Fun Guy Pizza, it was exactly that, a fun pizza full of tasty flavors. The Pesto Cream is to die for, the mushrooms added a subtle salty flavor, the pine nuts added a great crunchy texture, and the truffle oil brought all of the flavors together. I added potatoes to the pizza, they were thinly sliced and added a little crunch. Hands down, one of the best pizzas I've ever had! 

The other two popular pizzas at my table were the Bee Sting and the Apple Pie. Both equally delicious! If you're looking for a sweet, salty, spicy pizza....both of these options are the jam! What sets these pizzas apart is the 72 hour fermented organic dough, fire! 

We ordered some appetizers and we were so glad we did. The Cauliflower was magical, basically melted in your mouth with the garlic and chili oil. We also ordered the Meatballs, these were a huge hit at the table, they couldn't be consumed fast enough. The sauce, the flavors, the texture, all tasted homemade. Wood roasted beets were delicious...honey thyme goat cheese, pistachio oat streusel (gluten free), and a smoked orange sauce. Just amazing! 

They have a really great menu and offer something for every palate. They have some great gluten-free options, just be sure to ask your server before making your final selection. 

The drinks: 
Hello spicy Margarita! It was perfect! There was a poblano spice to it which made the cocktail so addicting. I would highly recommend it. They crafted some really fantastic cocktails, definitely a bar that creates innovative and delicious cocktails. 

Sadly, I didn't get to take too many photos. I was so overwhelmed with all of the delicious food and drinks. All you really need to see is how great the pizza looks. Haha! And you'll just have to visit this spot to experience all of the amazing eats and drinks. Don't sleep on Liberty Food & Wine Exchange, it's that good!

Cajun Seafood was one of the only places that I hear you can get decent crawfish during the off season. For those that don't know crawfish season is during spring. Most places in the French quarter do not sell any crawfish after the season ends. I was pretty disappointed for my trip because I do love crawfish. So when two uber drivers told me to come here we made the journey. 

Beware this is definitely not in the tourist part of the city and I would not come in the evening nor would I do anything over than take out. This is just based on me evaluating my surroundings and taking a warning from my uber driver. But on to the food. The crawfish was $5 a pound and u could add potatoes and corn for 50 cents a piece. I got 2 pounds which was not hardly enough. I read things that said crawfish are much smaller in the summer so maybe during the spring 2 pounds would have been plenty. Be prepared for the spice because they were pretty hot. The corn was too hot that I couldn't eat and the potato was hot but not overbearing. 

This place also acts as a seafood market you can get crabs and shrimp as well as some varieties of fish. They also sell beer, juice and soda. All in all I can say if I ever came back to NO during non crawfish season I would definitely return

We've been seeing Dr. Hadley for almost a year now. He's a great dentist and very personable, but the wait time for an appointment is atrocious. Just for a regular cleaning, I had to wait 3 months for an appointment. I was sent an email, as well as told by staff, that they were hiring another dentist and hygienist to help accommodate clients, which made me quite happy since I was considering leaving. Well I just had an appointment yesterday with the new dentist, who was real friendly, but when I went to make an appointment for my kids I was told their soonest would be over 2 months out. That's kind of ridiculous. Also I've had problems with staff submitting paperwork to my insurance company.
