I had asked for specific charges instead of estimates and was told that wouldn't be a problem but it would take a month to hear back. I've NEVER had to wait that long at another office but didn't make a big deal about it because I figured we had plenty of time before our appointments. Fast forward to the week before our appointment and I still hadn't received a phone call. I called their office and turns out they never submitted my paperwork and my husband's was in pending limbo. The staff would not call my insurance and my insurance said they couldn't approve charges until they heard back from the staff. Luckily my insurance company was willing to call them while I was on the line and push it through quickly seeing as how our appointments were coming up soon. That was a headache and a half! Sorry, Dr. Hadley, but your office needs to get it together. I'd love to stay but I think my family and I will be looking for another dentist soon. Shorter wait times for an appointment might fix this as well as competent staff.

This place has only been open for about a month and I can say it is probably one of the cutest places I've been to in a long time. The decor is so girly and had flowers pretty much everywhere. Absolutely loved it!  Definitely a perfect girls night out kind of place with plenty of photo ops for social media. 

We did the DIY chocolate bar and it was so fun!  The hardest part was trying to figure out the 3 mix ins as they had such a variety!  Then while the chocolate cools they serve mini desserts while sipping on some champagne.  I mean best day ever!

The owner was there and she was such a delight. She also mentioned they will be opening another location in St Pete in the summer of 2021 that will serve brunch. Can't wait to check that out!

Goodness! I love Bacchanal.

This is the perfect place to gather with friends or a first time date or a 10th date.  You walk in and are surrounded by bottles of wine.  Get a single glass or a whole bottle, as I'm sure you'll drink it all once you sit down in the cool courtyard.  Bacchanal serves delicious cheese plates; you select your cheese, they plate it with toast and other pickled things.  There is also an outdoor kitchen for featured chefs that serve some of the best food I've had in NOLA.  Everytime I've sat in the courtyard, live music was being played.

Delicious cookies!!!!  So fattening though so I usually skip :( 

I used to LOVE the 'double doozies' from here!   They are two soft chocolate chip  (usually) cookies with SWEET cream in the middle.  

I've only bought a cookie cake once from here and it was sooo good (and very sweet).  

They're a bit high priced though so I stick to my little local Shoprite.  

Cash only.

After quite a few friends recommended Leo in my mom's group, I knew he was the man for the job - our carpets were in desperate need of a cleaning after our twin terrors (said with love) had taken their toll on them over the years.  

He was so easy to work with and getting scheduled was a breeze.  The most important thing in my book? He was honest - one of our carpets was just not going to be able to be saved - he told us this upfront because he did not want to charge us for a job that wouldn't work - he enabled us to make a decision as the homeowners and really seemed to value our hard earned money.  I will definitely keep referring him and use him again down the road because of this honesty - it's just too hard to come by these days.

Sometimes you're staying in an Airbnb in New Orleans that's a little less comfortable than you'd like (read: a broken water heater and a bachelorette party next door). Sometimes you find yourself craving the sweet, sweet predicability of a good hotel room (read: temperature control of the air and water sort, housekeeping, etc etc). Sometimes you book yourself that good hotel room and fall into a state of vacation bliss (read: Ace Hotel New Orleans). 

I've been to the Ace in Los Angeles and Palm Springs, but only as a lady who drinks next to the pool and never as an actual hotel guest. I love each Aces I've been to and how they're designed with regional decor. The NOLA location features many nods to the city itself, with lots of lush plants, a classy Southern bar, and cool antique glass bottles. The staff here is incredibly friendly--hey were flexible with us and offered late check out, plus watched our bags for a bit after we checked out and explored the neighborhood. 

The rooms themselves are truly wonderful--comfy, stylish, and equipped with anything you might need. I absolutely loved the SMEG refrigerator and amazing assortment of snacks and drinks. While I don't usually indulge in the minibar, having my favorite wine + Zapp's chips within arms distance was too much to pass up. Make sure to try on the comfy bathrobes--you'll never want to take it off. 

Make sure to grab a drink or bite in their restaurant, Josephine Estelle (awesome cocktail list) or lobby bar. The rooftop pool is a must stop--grab your aforementioned bathrobe and head upstairs for a dip and a drink. There's a beautiful Stumptown coffee shop attached to the lobby for your morning caffeine fix (their almond milk latte was fabulous), plus lots of awesome restaurants in the area (we loved Willa Jean for brunch at Seaworthy for dinner). If you're in the mood for shopping, check out Freda, Friend, and Defend New Orleans, three awesome shops on Ace's block. 

Whether you're a hotel snob or just looking for a rad place to crash, Ace Hotel New Orleans is THE place to do it. We will absolutely be back soon!

Blown minds should be part of their slogan as when you walk into the Morean Glass Studio, your breath is immediately taken away.

You will want to slowly walk through there gallery as every piece is a one of a kind piece of art. Not to mention you are is a house of fragile glass. 
No matter how big or small the piece appreciating, learning and understanding the different techniques that each of their featured artists creates is amazing. 

Personal fan favorite was Susan Gott's work ~ Totally Breathtaking ~ Very fluid and flowing for metallic and molded shapes adorning her pieces. Especially the one of the wind spirit that reminded me more of a female sea spirit or mermaid :) If I only lived in Florida and had just the right spot to display that.

I went in to watch one of their open to the public sessions, that reviewed techniques of how blown glass is made before signing up to make a masterpiece of my own.
Well and of course as a blown glass lover and collecter had to buy a small piece or two ;)

Then upon taking the class I was fortunate enough to get a one on one personal tutorial and extra hand on utilizing their tools carefully, as to not totally burn myself as a novice.
You are able to pick from a handful of blown glass miniatures like a star or heart paper weight. I picked to create the teardrop or raindrop shape.
You get to select your very own colors for your design, which was great! They make sure it's all cleaned up for you to pickup next day or to be shipped. Being from NY I opted to have it shipped, note that's at an extra cost [$20].

Totally loved the world of blown glass experience and my TLo original piece ;)
I encourage the inner artist in you to take advantage of everything this location has to offer.

I live downtown so I have chosen this pharmacy as my go to and I love it.  It's very small and gives you a small town feeling. All the employees know me and always recognize me and are always super nice. The place is very clean and has a homey feeling. I never have any issues or long waits when dealing with my prescriptions.

La Colombe really brings out a mix of feelings. Let's start with the good!

1. The interior: beautiful. How can you walk in here and not love it? If you don't have a soul, and that's pretty much the only way how.
2. The care they have taken in presenting... everything.
3. The cookies. And they are only $1! I almost don't want to let anyone know this because they are by far the most underpriced item on the menu, and one of the most delicious.
4. The food is good.
5. They also brew rum?! And can liven up your drinks if you want.
6. No wifi: people actually sit around and chat

Okay now the downsides:
1. Honestly, the coffee is not that great. You won't be getting the best coffee in the city here - not even the first tier of coffee, honestly. Go to Elixr, Reanimator, Rival Bros., etc etc for that. But the coffee's not bad, either.
2. It's expensive. The food is good but not that good. And don't get me started on the bakery prices - they are simply extortionary.
3. It's perpetually crowded. There is *always* a line and it can be hard to get seats on the weekend, even as vast as the space is.
4. No wifi. I have to sit around and chat.

Bring your friends from out of town here. Meet a couple of friends here. Enjoy the scenery here.

After an afternoon cafe con leche or dinner in nearby historic Ybor city, I highly recommend a visit to the Tampa Theatre. This historical landmark brings you back in time to days long gone, but believe me, this place will leave a lasting impression on you. This place is hands down the coolest and most romantic old theaters in the U.S. 

This is a magical place that I always loved as a kid, and so did my parents about forty years before me. As you make your way to the Theatre the first thing you notice is the old-time sign in lights atop the entrance. Then, as you make your way pass the ticket booth your eyes begin to take in the interior, which reminds me of an old Spanish hacienda. Then the main room is something to behold - continues the Spanish hacienda or Mediterranean theme, but the audience feels like they are sitting in the courtyard of this estate. You look up to the ceiling and there it is, the night sky with stars, some of which flicker in the distance. Highly recommend to sit in the first row in the balcony to take in the scenery and the movie. 

If you happen to be in town when a good movie is playing here, take the time to visit this place, you will not be disappointed. Please note that this Theatre was built in 1926, so the seats are not the most comfortable and the sound system is a little behind the times, but who cares, you will still enjoy the experience.

Absolutely stunning!!. I am so glad my boyfriend discovered this gem. Although we had to wake up at 4 in the morning to get to the super glow show at 5, it was absolutely worth it. There are plenty of vendors with snacks, breakfast, coffee, and hot cocoa. The mass ascension was something out of a magazine. Once all the balloons took flight and filled the sky, it was out of this world. And to think we can experience something like this in the quaint town of Reno. I fell in love and will be back.

I am a fan of tiki cocktails and have been to some of the best tiki bars in the country. I was pretty happy that Latitude 29 opened in the Bienville - I like having options and while I like Tiki Tolteca (practically next door) a lot, I dig Latitude 29 in a whole different way.

First of all - the tiki drink recipes are classic and meticulously researched by Beachbum Berry, who is probably one of the world's experts in tiki drinks. (No kidding.) This means that these cocktails are strong, have amazing ingredients and taste even more amazing.

Second, the food menu has something for everyone. The apps price point is perfect ($5-11) and the options are great for someone wanting a small nosh with your cocktail. I love the pineapple bread and the dumpling burger. For the mains, the loco moco is a great option, as is the burger or the steak frites.

Speaking of the steak frites - it is only $15 during happy hour! What a deal! (There's also drink specials and I am partial to the Odin's punch.)

The bartenders here are pretty cool - not snooty and actually pay attention to you at the bar. Now that's refreshing in itself.

Come here with 4+ people, order L'Enorme, and be happy with the best fries in the city, which you can make even better by dipping into one of the 12 house-made sauces. You may also consider having the 2 lb pail of mussels. It's available in like a dozen flavors, and I love having the variety to choose from. 

If you can't come up with 4+ people who want to go here and drink Belgian beers and eat mollusks and frites, get the large frites and be exciting with the 3 sauces you get to choose. I prefer the roasted garlic aioli (you'll dream about it), the pesto, and I'm trying to make my way through the rest of the list one at a time. 

Brugge brews their own Belgian-style beers and also serves other craft beers on draft and in bottles, including sours and lambics which can be hard to find. They offer bottled small-batch sodas too and a pretty decent wine list. 

Wait here can be long, and I'd say the menu definitely lacks that "something for everyone" quality. If you're not into crepes, swiss-ish cheese, sausage, or mussels, you may find yourself out of luck. There is nary a burger to be found. 

Kids are allowed downstairs and on the patios. Upstairs, in the bar area with common seating, expect to be sharing your table with strangers and keep in mind you order from the bar. No kids allowed upstairs. There is a TV both bars and they're usually showing soccer.

Being the person who lives in Philly and loves to try new restaurants, I waited WAY TOO long to come to Zahav. Well, mostly because you can barely get reservations there. 
Trick to get reservations there is to CALL IN. Don't try to search for reservations on opentable as it's always booked. This time, I decided not to be lazy and I called in and asked for same day reservations and I got it. :) 

Ambience is nice. Service is top notch. I have never had any place with great service like Zahav. They are constantly filling up your glass of water, cleaning the tables after each course and always checking up on you without being super annoying. And the food comes out really fast 
The only negative thing I'll say is that, the music gets a little loud and I could barely have a conversation in there. 

They have a bar section where you can walk in and dine, but you usually end up waiting 1-2 hours if you come during busy times. They also have few seats near the kitchen where you can watch the chefs cook (but it's blocked with glass, so it's not that great). 

Let's talk about FOOD. 
- I ended up loving some vegetables that I thought I would never eat. Their salads were great, but my favorite were the cabbage, beet, and string beans. The one I really didn't like was eggplant. It just had a little too mushy in texture. 
- HUMMUS!!!!! Hands down the creamiest hummus I ever had. I got the Tehina with tomatoes and peas as toppings, but I wish I got the plain Tehina because the toppings didn't make any difference to the flavor. I wish they served the hummus with the original pita bread instead of naan looking bread. It was good while it was warm, but then it started to get crunchy and hard. 
- Mezze: Fried cauliflower was ok but their Pastilla was absolutely delicious. It comes in a Pastry form filled with apricot and cheese. The best was their Haloumi cheese, and I loved how they paired it with some type of liquid jelly base. It was odd but best pairing ever. 
- Al Háesh: The chef recommended us to try the chicken and I am so glad I did. The flavor wasn't strong, but it was light and perfect. THE TEXTURE WAS AMAZING. I have never had chicken that just melts into your mouth like that. As a mushroom lover, I had to try their Crimini mushrooms, and they were so juicy and flavorful. 
- Dessert: If you're a coffee fan, don't miss out on trying their coffee custard. 

P.S - Go there with an appetite and get their Tayim ($45 meal course. It comes with hummus and salad to share for the table, 2 small plates per person, 1 grilled vegetable/meat per person, and dessert per person.

I love Ikea. For the furniture, and the food.

I've furnished my whole house with Ikea stuff. The trick is to NOT buy the cheap stuff because you get what you pay for. The cheap stuff will eventually come unhinged or become uneven. Drawers will become slanted, kitchen chairs will start to fall apart. But the more expensive stuff really does hold up. I guess because they make it out of *real* wood. I also got a sectional from Ikea because I like the idea of being able to change the slip cover if I want to change my decor. It's also nice because my cat's a spiteful vomiter, so I'll need to take the slip cover to get cleaned at some point.

Anyway, as for the Ikea food...you can't go wrong. I've had the .50 cent hot dogs. They're A-OK. I've had the meatballs, chicken fingers, french fries, and macaroni and cheese. It's all GOOD! And cheap. Seriously, sometimes I go here just to eat. There's no shame in it!!

If you're going to come here, be prepared to spend more than you planned. There are so many cool things you can't leave without picking up something you don't really need. Also, plan to spend a whole day. Or half day, maybe. Leave time to see everything.

Not too long ago I ordered two burgers and an extra basket of fries from here, hoping everyone would assume that at least two people would be chowing down on all that. Just between us, that food was all for me. Totally worth it. 

The fries. Dear lord, the fries. Hand cut, perfectly cooked and salted. Amazing, just incredible. And the burgers are just as good. The meat is from Porter Road, so you can feel all righteous about eating locally right down to the patty. 

The sheer deliciousness of this place has been written about over and over by us Yelpers, so the only thing I can tell you is: Everyone's right. We're not always right (I've eaten in some pretty terrible places, thanks to mistaken Yelpers) but we've hit the nail on the head with Riverside Grillshack. 

You'll love it. I love it. In fact, I feel a two-burger day coming on.

I came by here in early summer during a weekend getaway with college friends. We wanted to grab a nice breakfast before the drive back home. 

Honestly, Fiona C has perfectly worded EVERYTHING I would want to say about this place. Everything on the menu looked amazing and it took forever for me to decide what to get. The food was prepared beautifully and the servings were enormous, I should have shared! My favorite part though was probably my salted caramel latte. Unlike snobby coffee shops that charge for syrup/soy, this place includes it! Super nice for those who are lactose intolerant because hey, having to pay extra to avoid being gassy sucks!

My reasons for not giving 5 stars are more of personal preference, I'm just not a huge American breakfast lover! Definitely a great brunch spot though!

I went to Ella's on  Wednesday night, and was very happy with our dinner choice! I have been wanting to go to Ella's for months - it is a bit off the beaten path of my normal restaurant choices, so I never think about it. My friend recommended that we go there, and I'm so glad she did! We shared a southern spring salad, and split a Eggs & Bacon pizza. The pizza was absolutely delicious! I loved every bite. The salad was a bit on the sweet side though. I think next time, I will go with a different dressing that is a bit more savory to balance out the sweet ingredients. I had a sangria as my drink, and I will say it was not that great - a bit too sweet for my liking. Next time, I'll just go with a glass of wine. Overall, an awesome experience! I can't wait to go back!

Atmosphere is amazing - something you would expect and is such a great concept and idea. I do wish they had a few more food options but the Greek, Pizza, and Mexican were great. Also, love that you can order from multiple places and get a great beer all in one sitting.

My boyfriend and I fell in love with this restaurant so much, that we decided to go two days in a row this Labor Day weekend. We initially only went in for drinks (which were delicious ) and decided to try some of the food afterwards ( so yummy!)  aside from the drinks, and food, the hospitality by both Solie and Eddie is what made us feel welcomed. I truly wish them both the best, by far the best service we've had in our years coming to Santa Barbara. We'll definitely be there next time we visit SB.Caesar SaladCaesar Salad

I love the atmosphere in this restaurant, especially when they have live bands playing. The staff are really chilled, their cocktails are delicious and so is their food. I look forward to many more nights at this new restaurant on Whyte!

Excellent espresso, a full notch above the nearest geographical competitor Mo'Joe. Definitely worth trying to find this place. Top 5 espresso in Indianapolis.

Wish they had more options for food though, that's what will stop me from bringing the family more frequently. Owners, if you're reading, please add more breakfast items - something like yogurt or even biscotti should be easy to maintain and might bring in more people like me.

Wife loved the Cafe Miel on both visits, toddler loved the chocolate doughnut (offered weekends only), and I really enjoyed my cappuccino, macchiato, and Smokehouse (spin on a cortado with sorghum & liquid smoke). Try them all, especially the Smokehouse if you're a true espresso+milk drink aficionado.
Absolutely loved the shrimp po boy here. They don't fry the shrimp, which is how I prefer it. My only complaint is that the carrots didn't really go with it. However, my husband loved it.

Gets four stars for being open 24/7, clean, and has a friendly staff.

Ever been on your own, sick, and not really felt up to driving but knew that you HAD to get something to relieve all your sinus pressure or you'd be more exhausted and thus more sick the next day?  I HAVE!  Walgreen's has saved me on more than one occasion.  I also come here to get Pedialyte for the boyfriend when he gets headaches (it's for kids, but it's heavy on electrolytes and lower on sugar than Gatorade and thus better at relieving headaches caused by dehydration).  

The pharmacists are extremely helpful.  Tell them your symptoms and your budget, and they will offer you suggestions.  They do push the wal-brand, but if you're not a generic freak then you're probably fine using those!

There's occasionally a line, but the employees are pretty good about getting another register open.

I love that Wal-green's sells "As Seen on TV" products that I have to convince myself live without.  

There's refrigerated beer and a wine aisle at this location.

"Can I have some more?"
~ Oliver Twist

Went here with a couple of friends for lunch and I immediately fell in love with the decor. I was also very intrigued by the association and history between Peruvian and Cantonese cuisines so I wanted to try. I had the spring roll and tried my friends' pho and house green salad. All were good but left me wondering where the Peruvian influence would present itself in each of the dishes. I mean, compared to the dinner menu, the lunch menu is more heavily Asian inspired than it is Latin American, so I hope that maybe soon the lunch menu can be updated to reflect that. 

Service was great and the food and cocktails are too. However, the drinks were a a bit high ($9 for a well gin & tonic?) and the portion sizes are small. I was disappointed in leaving Chifa still hungry but what was also starved were my pockets so I grabbed a snack at home :-/ 

Like I said earlier, I'm looking forward to coming back because I still want to try the dinner menu and see if I'd like that better.

I love this Dunkin because they know how to make a caramel iced coffee taste good. I think its because of their technique of shaking the drink to mix up the caramel.  The place loses a star because I saw that the employee used the same hand he grabbed my credit card with (he had a plastic glove on this hand) to close the straw hole opening to shake my drink up.  The plastic glove basically defeats its purpose if he's going to use that hand to touch everything. I'm not sure if that would pass a sanitation inspection....

What a cute little spot at the tip of mass ave!! This place is perfect for a dinner with friends or little date night. They have an outdoor space that's so well done but truly the inside is just as cute. As some people would say "Instagram worthy."

Bow onto the food - HUGE portions! You could definitely split any of the entres. I love pad Thai and their pad Thai is one of the best I've had in Indy. I got medium heat, I feel like I could have gone all the way since pad Thai sauce usually calms the heat. 

Appetizers deforest the fried tofu and absolutely the crab Rangoon (some of the best).

They have a huge list of beers and crafty cocktails. You can order pretty much whatever drink your heart desires.

Enjoy :)

So I ordered tonight because I wasn't in the mood to cook. What happened to this place? Why did they change the name? Fresh works now. The rolls at one time were so good, tonight mine not so much. I haven't ordered from here in roughly 3 years but I wanted something different.

I ordered a cheesesteak, it was so soggy! I even ordered the roll toasted. Keep in mind I didn't order anything to make it soggy. It was also very small, $8.25 and it was tiny. A lot smaller then what they once were.

I also got a small order of wings. I love wings! Who doesn't? But I always order them well done, always. I like them crispy. Again I was let down. The wings were soaked in sauce! I hate when I order well done wings and there is a bowl of sauce in the platter. Their sauce has always been good, they do a hot sauce/blue cheese mix.. 

The one bright side is the delivery was fast. Sadly I'm officially done with this place. I won't order again, well maybe in a few years? Only time will tell.

Who would have thought the Greeks could make a great restaurant!  Well I did of course and this family didn't disappoint!  

This really is one of those classic family run places.  Now the location is great, right across from Clear Water Beach so after working up a hunger running in the waves you can sit on the patio, enjoy the view and some great food.  

I put the pressure and started with the Greek basics.  Greek salad, gyro plate and oh yeah, for breakfast I tried the biscuits and gravy!

The Greeks salad was what it should be, not what you get at most places. Lots of fresh veggies, some oil and vinegar on it and a big chunk of feta cheese with it.  The gyros were really good as well.  Both went together perfect and the sauce for the gyro was fresh and homemade, loved it.  Now the breakfast of biscuits and gravy was really good as well, maybe not a Greek dish but very good none the less.  Now, I judge the B&G knowing that no one makes them as good as I do at home but still, these were good.

This is the place to stop for any meal while visiting CWB, hands down. 

KT

We came here for restaurant week and unfortunately I was not impressed with it at all. 

I love the ambiance of the place with the dim lighting and candles. Makes it great for date night. However, the space inside is a bit smaller and tables are pretty close together. 

The drinks are really good. I had the White Whiskey Lemonade which was strong and refreshing. I am not a Gin drinker but everyone else in my group loved the Market St. Wino and the Evil Genius was super strong for those looking for more of a punch. 

Moving along to the food. I was actually very disappointed. I ordered the crab bisque which was the favorite part of my meal, so I recommend that. The Cheesesteak Spring Rolls were a bit greasy and lacking flavor. The Calamari was horrible, the batter was not crispy at all. The ribeye which I ordered lacked flavor and was cooked a little more done than what I ordered for a medium steak. 

I left a little disappointed which was unfortunate. I would probably stop by for drinks again but I'm not sure about the food.

This place has serious potential. I had a salad for lunch recently and it was "almost amazing ".
It is set up like chipotle but offers a wider variety of items . They use a lot of cilantro in everything which I love.
You can get several types of salsa and guacamole at no extra charge, like chipotle.They are not skimpy on toppings but the main topping I had was not good.
I chose the pork as my protein and it was just not good. It was chopped in really small pieces which I believe contributed to it being very dry. I was there at prime time lunch hour so I can't blame being there at an off time as an excuse.
I will be trying the chicken and beef sometime soon as everything besides the pork was excellent !
I really hope that this was just an off day because this could be a great lunch option for me.
Usually I won't give a place a second chance , but I love cilantro!

"oh my GOD!"

Exactly what I said when I ate the chicken fried steak special today. Crispy, moist, scrumptious. The best gravy I've tasted, ever. You guys continue to rock my socks off. I love it!

The Lodge at Grant's Trail was truly an awesome experience. A friend and I were looking for a cool place to stay for our trip to St. Louis. She just happened to find this awesome place while we were looking for hotels in the downtown area. The great thing was that it's about the same price or cheaper as the hotels and was a much cooler experience. We were very skeptical at first about staying in a B&B as neither of us had been to one. We were coming from 8hrs away and knew we would get there without any staff being there so that concerned us. We decided to call and get information before booking reservations. The man we spoke to on the phone was incredibly friendly and reassured us that everything would be fine and our keys would be securely waiting for us when we arrived. We loved the idea of the themed rooms and really wanted the Alaska room, but someone had booked it right in the middle of our 3 day stay for one night so we decided to do 2 nights in the Christmas room and 1 night in the Alaska room. Prior to arriving on the day of, we were contacted by the staff to go through all the check-in procedures, determine what time we wanted breakfast, and to verify we were happy with our rooms selections. We confirmed and they sent over an email with the code to the front door and how to pick up our keys. We were all set and super excited to arrive. We got there just before 8pm and our code got us in the door and then our keys were available for us. We went straight to our room and everything was exactly how we expected it. We had a note waiting for us on the bed describing some of the amenities such as drinks downstairs, ice in the kitchen, WiFi, etc. We were very pleasantly surprised by how cozy and awesome the Christmas room is. We were warned it might be too Christmasy, but we didn't feel that way at all. It was very nice with TV, a nice bed, a Christmas town that lit up above the fireplace and an AC that worked very well. The bathroom was HUGE which was nice also. The next morning we woke up and went down to breakfast. Clark was who took care of us over the duration of our stay and he was AMAZING! He brought us an awesome warm breakfast of waffles, bacon, and sausage with fresh squeezed OJ. There was also toast, bagels, pastries, muffins, and cereal available each day. As well as coffee, water, and teas. The next morning we had a quiche that was absolutely incredible! Then, the final morning we had breakfast strata. We were pleasantly surprised with all of our breakfast items. Clark provides great service and truly makes sure you have everything you need. We only shared a table once at breakfast and it was with 2 very friendly people. The atmosphere here is truly wonderful. There's a nice area downstairs with the kitchen to sit, there's a game room area which we took advantage of, then there's a big outdoor space with picnic tables and some trails with a green grassy area. We saw dear and a beaver once we made it to the Alaska room since it has a balcony. We enjoyed this room, but the Christmas room was still our favorite. Clark let us walk around and see all the other rooms that weren't occupied while we were there and we believe that Christmas is the best. The bed in the Christmas room was a lot more comfortable than the Alaska room although the Alaska bed is bigger, it squeaks A LOT. The details in the Alaska room were very unique which made it cool, but it had some decorations we weren't a fan of. The Christmas room felt like you were sleeping in a room in someone's house with a big homey feel. The Alaska room made you feel like you were somewhere strange and a lot more noise was heard from this room than the other. The bathroom in the Alaska room was small, but it wasn't a problem for us. One thing we noticed was how clean everything at the lodge was. I'm not sure I've ever seen showers and bathrooms as clean as they were, they were immaculate! Clark does a wonderful job and made our stay that much better! We loved talking to him and learning more about the history of the lodge. We were there during the week so luckily there weren't any events going on, but we did see a few people coming in to plan their events and do walk throughs of the property. If you are looking for a unique place to stay less than 15mins from downtown this is it! We were able to go to the zoo, brewery, cardinals game, the arch, and all the famous food places with no trouble from here. I highly recommend giving them a try!

I love a good greasy american chinese food experience as much as the next person, so I know there's a difference between "bad" chinese food and bad chinese food. This was the latter. 

I got the broccoli in garlic sauce and an order of hot and sour soup. The garlic sauce was a surprising mix of cloyingly sweet and runny, and somehow the hot and sour soup tasted both vinegary and stale. The veggies were very sad - the advertised carrots, bamboo shoots, and wood ears turned out to be some unidetifiable melange of soggy vegetable shreds. 

They do delivery, which is why I chose them in the first place, and the second star is for fast and friendly delivery service. The food, though, deserves a hard pass. Next time I'll suck it up and do takeout.

We went a few weeks after opening and were unimpressed beers were okay and food was okay. We tried it again a few weeks ago for lunch and I'm not sure what changed but keep it up! We both ordered sandwiches which we loved(Pastrami for me and Fish and Chips for the wife)  and I had a Beer that was called Liam Neeson awesome Coffee IPA with Irish cream(which i usually avoid). We took some visiting family for dinner a few nights ago and everything was on point again.....except maybe the Last Days of Summer(I think) Beer I had was just meh. Great tropical fruit nose but not very interesting on the palette

Located just steps from the Society Hill Towers, Zahav is a fantastic Israel-Mediterranean restaurant that sets the bar for fine dining in Philadelphia.  Not only did all my friends who ate there love it, but it lived up to all of my expectations.  A recent pick for a date night with the BF, the atmosphere was warm and inviting, with great views of the surrounding neighborhood.

The menu is a little overwhelming at first as it's served "tapas style" with many little plates, but I highly recommend ordering the Tayim tasting menu, which allows you to try their amazing selection of salads (salatim), hummus, and house-baked laffa bread, along with two mezze, one grilled meat plate, and dessert (so if you're dining with a partner, you get to try a large chunk of the menu).  The hummus and salads tasted so fresh and perfect, a great way to start off the meal.  For the mezze, we tried the fried cauliflower, kibbe naya (their take on a lamb tartare), crispy halloumi cheese (my favorite dish of the night), and the stuffed grape leaves.  I'm not one for stuffed grape leaves personally, but the way they created it with the ground veal and raisins made it taste that much better and more elegant than standard Greek fare.  Our main plates, the duck kebabs and beef cheeks, were also cooked to perfection.  And dessert, which we barely had room for, was also incredible: sweet enough to signify the end of the meal, but not too sweet.  I really enjoyed the warm valrhona chocolate inside the crisp Kataifi, as well as the homemade Turkish Delight in the Roasted Apricot dessert.

The service was impeccable and was able to not only make good recommendations, but provide an easy way to read and decipher the menu. Zahav also has an expansive and terrific cocktail list, and the two of us ended up splitting a pitcher of their signature cocktail, the Lemonnana (essentially, lemonade blended with herbs and bourbon).  Overall, I greatly enjoyed my experience here and it truly deserves to be among one of the best restaurants in the city.  Definitely worth it for a special occasion or for elevated Middle Eastern cuisine.

4.2. This place is gorgeous if you're into historical beauty with a modern twist.  The place is huge so have your walking shoes ready.  No, really!  I'm not playing.  Parking is expensive and we didn't want to valet everyday for an additional $40/not so we opted to self-park for $27/nt.  Okay now to return to how massive this place is, it has atriums, upon atriums, with hidden atriums, pools, etc.  In the words of Al Green, "Simply beautiful!" Very romantic-esque for our anniversary celebration.  There was a small mix up with the room due to them being completely sold out so we had to get a double based on availability at check in, but the next day we were able to get the king as promised.  Although not happy about it, it wasn't enough to ruin the experience.  The tower rooms are so nice. I love that each individual room has it's own character.  I read so many reviews mentioning lack of service and water pressure - neither of these were our experience. The light and fire show were amazing.  Take home message: If you're into history and you like to find ways to sneak exercise in without knowing it, while having a modernized room, this is the place to be!

It's very important to note to little dog owners that there is NO LITTLE DOG AREA. None. Nada. Everyone is mixed in together. That's fine since the space is quite large, huge even, & there are many trails for your dog to run around in but for little dogs, this is not a great place. 

I do love all the shaded area but I wish owners would pick up after their dogs. I can't tell you how many dog piles I saw all over & not even on the trails but on the way to the fenced in area. 

So little dog owner go to Connolly Park. Much better park for our little ones.
This place is excellent for snow balls on a hot summer day. I love the nectar with condensed milk. Mmmmmm. I would definitely recommend this place!

Hello Martini!

Wednesday was my Birthday and it had to start off with a cocktail or two or three.  The hubby and I use to frequent this place a lot when we were dating, it's a great low key place with awesome martini's.  The names of some of the martini's are enough to break the ice especially on a first date =)  

We had a dinner reservation was for later in the evening so we took full advantage of their half priced happy hour app's from 4-7pm.  The hummus platter was $4 and was a nice sized portion, not too big and not too small...just enough to tied us over till dinner.

The martinis here are exceptional!  Their happy hour specials have changed a bit since we were last in and the Wednesday special was faculty night, 20% off for teachers, professors, etc, so no happy hour drinks specials for me.  But that didn't stop me from ordering more than one.  

I started with the Peachy Keen, think chocolate covered peaches and cranberries.  A mix of Cranberri Vodka, peach Schnapps and White Creme de Cacao served in a chocolate rimmed glass.  So sweet and smooth!  My second martini was their Dixie Normous.  Try ordering that without blushing!  A creamy chocolate and banana liquor treat.  It is seriously one I could slam like a milkshake.  My final martini was their Coffee and Doughnuts.  A caramel-y coffee cocktail rimmed with caramel sauce.  Another sweet treat.  I almost had to be carried out to dinner.  

I love this place.  I have never order a martini I didn't like, but I love martini's a lot...so I think that makes me bias, especially when under the influence of one or two or three.
I love New Delhi! The food is delicious, and the inexpensive buffet offers a number of different choices.  My friends and I go there all the time.

Really love the green chile burger and SUPER happy Blake's came to Tucson.  While I do live on the southeast side, I have no problem driving thirty minutes to get one of their burgers.  The drive through is pretty busy, but they move people through fast.  Welcome to Tucson Blake's!

I love that they've recently opened right next to Jackalope and both are using the communal seating area. Sometimes I want coffee while he always wants beer. Problem solved! Add music on Friday nights and Sunday afternoons along with food from Zolli throughout the week and you've got a win-win situation. The hand poured coffee selection is terrific and Zolli (the owner) is friendly and loves new faces. So don't be a stranger and stop by for your daily pick me up and a bite to eat!

Love, love, Love Retrospect!!! It's my favorite vintage store in Philadelphia. Stopped in yesterday and purchased the cutest hat! Staff is always friendly. I always leave with a cute outfit. A little disappointed that they raised the prices on their sunglassez. They are now $16 :(

Fresh homemade soymilk on the house! What a delight and still warm....soo good. New Harmony has the same and original owner, Ming who used to own Kingdom of Vegetarians that is now under new ownership. But NH is the real deal and Ming is the man.  Stick with NH and you get great service and vegan dim sum aplenty. It's our tradition whenever we're in the city of brotherly love.

we'd discovered their afternoon/evening TO GO case!!!! we run late, so don't always have time for breakfast or lunch.......we dropped in last week & got some smoked Gouda pasta, trying to be funny with Nick after he said to put it in the microwave for 1 minute (i Have to Wait??? HURRY) !!! well i followed his directions (tick, tick, tick) & after tasting it, my hands shook as a warm feeling enveloped me, THEN SCREAMED, that's the BEST  pasta i've ever tasted !!!!!!!!!! the next day i had to work & sent my b/f with the orders "To buy it All" 
one side of the case is usually dessert items, & the other things for dinner
we love their noodles of any kind, today i picked up some more pasta, Asian sesame noodles with Nicholle's help, oh & their Hummus is To Die For (cheaper & tastier than marsh's)
Matt is one of the best / fun servers in town as is BJ

This place is fantastic.  Tons of options and fresh ingredients.  Not "just salads" as the name would have you believe but also a wraps and bowls.  I started with the Buffalo chicken salad which was great and I added their crispy onions. Yummy! Their poblano ranch is heaven.  Can't wait to make this my new go to salad spot. 

If you reuse your bowl- they offer discounts.  Like $1 off or free cheese add on.  Who doesn't love cheese ??

Went into this Doggy Style to check out some dog toys. When we walked we were immediately greeted by the staff. They kindly asked if we needed any help. We asked if there were any dogs up for adoption and they took us to the back to show us one. Her name was Star she was a pit bull that's been there since Thanksgiving. Very sweet dog if you're looking to adopt. The girl told us a few facts about Star's personality and was very helpful with answering any questions. The store was kept organized and you could tell the employees really love what they do.

I know. I'm crazy. I visited Soup Dumpling STL on 9/22, their opening day. The space is super clean and modern. All the new Chinese restaurants are doing this instead of looking like a pagoda exploded. I like it!Love the Soup dumpling & steamer wall mural on the west wall. You order at the counter and then go choose a seat to wait for your food. I ordered the pork soup dumplings and the Shrimp & Cheese dumplings. Yes this is too much food for one person. I like to eat and try everything! I did not finish it all. These each come with a cup of soup. I believe the only Xiaolongbao I've had in St. Louis has been at Mandarin House during weekend dim sum. This was so much better! 

The Good:
The skin was tender, smooth, and almost translucent. The "soup" at the top was perfectly hot and liquid and the pork filling was nice and tender. The shrimp was delicious but the pork was better! Lots of flavor!

The Bad:
Lots of opening day confusion. Food not coming out of the kitchen fast enough or at all. I waited 1 hour and 30 minutes for my dumplings. That's about 1 hour and 15 minutes too long in my opinion. Some tables got up and left long before their food would have been ready. Some people who had just gotten there ended up getting served food made for people who left and getting out very quickly. EVERYONE who walked in after me got served before me to the tune of 15+ people. At some point the entire restaurant started complaining that someone other than me was getting served. 

It was delicious and I will go back but I'll wait (quite a while) until after they have a little time to work out the kinks!

My review should obviously be less than 4 stars but the food was good, I want local businesses to succeed and I'm here because I love food and the local restaurant scene. I'm not here to trash a brand new local business.

The black bean burger and wrap are ah-mazing! Loved them both. This brewery offers tons of space. Their "Nook" for food is a bit crammed but they make up for it with all of the out door seating. Which the servers actually tend too! They also have live bands on weekends. We tried the flashlight, which is a light beer similar to Stella and another light beer that tasted like apricots! Both amazing. They had a spicy beer that was very dark and too spicy for my liking. But this is a great stop for a casual night out.

Got a facial here with a Groupon.  I loved my facialist as a person - she was bubbly and uncensored and a good chatter - but the facial itself wasn't my favorite.  

What made it bad was her squeeze-pores-removing-blackheads technique that put my skin (a relatively tough cookie) in pain and I left with red splotches all over my face which lasted for the rest of the day.

That's all.  Just my experience with the facial.  I'd go back for a haircut or something but no more Pileggi facials.

Good down home food some what reasonable.   Friendly service seems clean n Love the old time feeling it gives me.  Usually go for breakfast but lunch a time or two. Give it a try sure you'll be pleased.

A new restaurant on the scene from Starr Restaurants, The Love is in the heart of Rittenhouse Square and provides a nice ambiance and dining atmosphere. There is a bar adjacent to the host area with limited seating and the general dining area is inviting but not pretentious. The restaurant isn't overly spacious and though our table was a bit small it was nicely located near a window. 

The service was attentive and the pace was good. 
The menu features a variety of appetizers, pasta, entrees, and vegetable sides, many of which seem to be comfort food or southern inspired dishes. 

We enjoyed the Parker House Rolls, served in a cast iron skillet and accompanied with chive butter. They were tasty and a nice starter.

The caramelle pasta was probably the least inspired. Although it was nicely presented the portion was minimal and though the butter sauce was warm, the pasta twists themselves were cold which was somewhat off putting. 

The highlight of the meal was actually the seasonal chicken. I'm not a huge fan of chicken but this chicken was fried in buttermilk, boneless, and was soft and flavorful. The accompanying grits were a bit heavy on the butter, but okay. The collard greens were fine, the comeback sauce was well prepared. 

For a side vegetable we tried the torched broccoli with hot sauce. The presentation was a little unsightly, it was more like broccoli tossed haphazardly in sauce, but it was tasty. 

Our drinks were good, the restaurant has a good enough variety of cocktails, wine and other libations to get along with, though I wouldn't characterize the pours as particularly generous for some of the prices. 

Our dessert consisted of the Dirt Sundae, of chocolate mousse and topped with crushed cookies/fruit. The presentation was nice and the mousse was well flavored and a good way to conclude the meal. 

All in all, I think the ambiance and service were where the restaurant excelled. We enjoyed most of the fare, with the exceptions noted above. I would be curious to try some additional entrée dishes or return for brunch.

I absolutely love this place! The fried chicken is phenomenal, and the spicy honey that comes with it will change your life. They pour huge beers there, so expect to have a good time! Love the dynamic, community style seating and the family style side options! Their mac and cheese is to die for. We will definitely be returning! This place is a great addition to Mass Ave!

A praline is a must while in NOLA and you can't beat the ones from southern candymakers.  These were melt in your mouth incredible pieces of sweet perfection.  I ate almost a pound of them myself and out of pure love and determination was able to bring some home to my husband without eating them.  Try the sweet potato prailines.  This was easily one of the best foodie experiences of my life.  The staff was so sweet and nice.  The shop is tiny, but full of character.  Once you get a taste, you wouldn't care if these were being sold from a dumpster.  Just go, order, devour and enjoy.  You only live once!

I came here for the second time a few weeks ago and really enjoyed the food. Their sides are sooo delish and I loved the fish I got for an entree. For an app we got the calamari but it was legit like eating little tiny raw octopuses because they didn't fry it so it was chewy and rubbery in my opinion. I wasn't such a fan. But I get the concept they're going for with the unique take on normal calamari & I can appreciate that. On the flip side the sauce it came in made up for it and was awesome. 

The service was pretty good and as usual I always love the ambiance that this place has to offer. Very cool new Mexican vibe within the decor selections. We came on a Saturday night (they were busy) and were pleased to be seated immediately! 

Price range is a little higher but with an upper scale mexican restaurant, I'd say that's to be expected. They do have some reasonably priced dishes though. I had the margarita and my date had the sangria both of which were very tasty in my opinion. I think I liked the marg a little better but then again I'm 100% a margarita girl. The cocktails range from around $8-$11ish they're good tho and i was pleasantly surprised with the size of my margarita. 

With that being said, All in all a very good experience!

MY NEW FAVORITE BRUNCH SPOT IN SB COUNTY. 
Hands down, the BEST brunch/ breakfast place in all of SB county. I have been dying for this place to open back up since it closed because of the pandemic. It was worth the wait! So so delicious! 

My friend and I got the make your own hash (since that's what they're known for!) We couldn't decide on if we wanted regular potatoes or sweet potatoes, so we just got both and shared. I personally liked the regular potatoes more, but it's just because I cannot eat a large amount of sweet potatoes at once. However, if you love sweet potatoes, get it with sweet potatoes! It's so unique to see it as a hash option at breakfast places. The sweetness of the sweet potato with all the yummy savory veggies, runny egg yolk, and sauce is so DELICIOUS! Out of both sauces, the hollandaise was tasty, but I enjoyed the tang of the salsa more! 

We also got the Madagascar vanilla bean latte & the dark chocolate latte. Both were superb! Also, please don't forget to put jam on your toast, it is so good!! 

As for customer service, it was also amazing! They continuously checked up on us when needed and were super chatty/ helpful! We came on a Monday afternoon and it was packed, so I would be ready for the weekend if you choose to come. 

I will definitely be coming back to get another make your own hash & try to the french toast! 

Fun fact: they make their bread, chocolate sauce, and jam in house! 

Recommendation: 
- Madagascar vanilla bean latte
- Make your own hash: sweet potatoes, salsa, over easy egg, mushroom, spinach, pepper jack cheese and corn

This location has been open since 2014. It is located just a few businesses down from Publix. It is open 10 AM to 9 PM Mon thru Fri; Sat 9 AM to 9 PM; & 10 AM to 8 PM on Sundays. This is a chain store that buys and sells gently used clothing for teens, misses, women, men, & plus sized individuals, as well as footwear; handbags; & accessories. Its webpage advertises Plato's Closet as a business whose clients are in their "teens and twenties;" however, many of the clothing styles represented today could be worn by women & men of any age. 

Shoppers can save up to 70% off retail prices. Overall, prices were lower than I expected, but I did find some items of clothing that were definitely overpriced considering they were pre-owned. This is a BAGLESS store, so come prepared! Customers have 7 days to return any items, but the tags must still be intact & accompany the original store receipt. 

Should you wish to earn extra money by selling your gently worn clothing, etc, BUYING HOURS are 10 AM to 8 PM Mon thru Fri; Sat 9 AM to 8 PM; & Sun 10 AM to 7 PM. Plato's Closet buys & sells Women's tops in size XS to 6x & bottoms size 00 to 30. For men, staff will buy size XS to 4x in tops & size 28 to 40 in bottoms. On each rack, there are LIMITED options available for those who are Plus size. Currently, if you wish to sell your "trendy" clothing, it should be Spring & Summer fabric/style. (I brought in a large bag that contained New w/ Tag winter clothing; I was sent packing. Lol.) At this time, MEN'S CLOTHING & ALL SHOES (especially shoes) are in HIGH DEMAND. Plato's does NOT buy underwear and/or PJs.

Wish to save even more? Once you sign up for the Rewards Program, you'll "forever have access to exclusive discounts, promotions, & events. More points. More fun." Sign up online or sign up by texting PLATOSWC to 578-277.

This is a decent-sized store. It is clean, well-organized & brightly lit-- SEE PICS. The aisles are comfortably large, but too many racks were packed so tight that it was somewhat difficult to examine clothing without struggling to pull the hanger from the rack. (I had to retrieve at least 3 tops from the floor.) There are approximately 7 dressing rooms. Just outside each are metal folding chairs, a clothing return rack, & a bin for shoe returns-- SEE PICS.

During today's visit, one young staff member was very friendly & wore a huge smile. The shift leader, though, never smiled & lacked a warm & fuzzy personality that often helps attract return visits. According to Plato's website, the company is hiring for full-time & part-time positions. Upload your resume online.

Before I drove off to donate my big bag of clothing to Salvation Army, I left the store w/ 3 never worn items of clothing priced $3 to $10 that this 50-yr-old (non-teen & non-twenty-something) plans to Rock! Lol. I LOVE fashion & I love deals, so it only makes sense for me to return once the fall/winter line hits the racks.

Great food. Its not super fast, but the food is great and prices are reasonable. I love table outdoor seating.. it's so different from what we have back in Chicago haha. I like the char burger and fries.. #1!!!! My bro got onion rings and a shake and those looked pretty darn good as well. I've been here a couple times before and can say that each time I am satisfied !

Really enjoy this place.   Their onion rings are delicious.... some of my favourite in the city.  The hot dogs are very good as well.   Love the steamies. They are simple and delicious, topped with a delicious subtle flavoured sauerkraut (and I don't generally care for sauerkraut) 

The gentleman at the front desk is very charming and accommodating.   They are open late (not sure how late but he said they want to catch the midnight rush) 

Most pop here is the good stuff in glass bottles.  And the pricing is on point.

I love this place ! It is close to my work and they always are fast. I have ordered take out and dine in. Both were with fast service and they always get my order right. I love the atmosphere here. It is very relaxing but great quality food. I tend to get the drunken noodles but have also tried the curry. I only wish they had a better drink selection. We usually like to do happy hour after work and if they had better drinks I could convince people to go here more. We love going for lunch.

Gorgeous and delicious are understatements. La Colombe's first location to serve actual food (not just pastries and biscotti) gives me hope that they will open up other locations in other cities. (*hint hint* San Francisco please!) Speaking with one of the food runners, this is apparently La Colombe's new flagship and headquarters (since they're based in Philly). Hence why this is a behemoth of a location (and I say that in a good way). As soon as you walk in, you'll notice incredibly high ceilings, cute vintage lighting, and a bounty of pastries, bread (you can order half or full orders of bread), and display sandwiches. They also freshly prepare salads, tartines, boards, and skillets (which looked amazing, but seemed a bit too heavy for a weekday meal). Basically, this is more like a restaurant -- you order food up front, they give you a number, and they bring it to you.

Of course, their star attraction is the coffee. La Colombe's single origins and blends are mighty tasty. I ordered an early grey tea to be iced and that was incredibly smooth yet still herbaceous and heady. It was naturally sweet in some ways... so delicious on its own I didn't even add sugar (which I usually do!). 

Now, I took the subway from Center City so I could EAT. And eat, I did! I ordered the porchetta sandwich. And, my gawd, I wanted to delay my flight back home so I could return here for dinner. Sigh. Oh well. It was delicious while it lasted. Piled onto a fresh piece of baguette was the meat covered in roasted peppers (so Philly!) and sharp provolone. That was probably the wisest $10 I've spent on the entire trip. I especially loved every bite where I could taste the fat from the meat and the natural roasting oils absorbed in the bread. It was so heavenly. 

As mentioned, this location is their flagship so you can imagine this store to be incredibly handsome in regards to its interior. It is "industrial chic" (if you wanna call it that): modern, sleek, simple, and romantically urban. There is plenty of seating. I will say, however, that like all (I believe) La Colombe locations, there is no wifi and limited electrical outlets. They probably think it's distasteful to stay in a store all day working on something and not clearing up room for patrons (which I get to a certain extent). That said, come here to read a book/magazine or catch up with a friend. Don't plan to study for your final or finish up that complicated report for work. I suspect the no wifi and limited electrical outlets is intentional so one can engage with the world and not just zone out on the computer.

I used to be somewhat wary of La Colombe because their stores often felt uncomfortable and uninviting (I'm thinking especially of the locations in Chicago), but this Philly location changes my opinion. La Colombe: if you continue to build stores like this (with attention to comfort AND with the ability to serve quality food [not just coffee]), you'll probably have even more loyal followers.

Definitely a nice Texas meat place. 

First off, the service here was amazing. Everyone was very friendly, knowledgeable and cheerful. The rolls they bake fresh are very delicious (although I didn't particularly care for the cinnamon flavored butter). They also have roasted peanuts at every table (and also two very large barrel-fulls of the roasted peanuts at the entrance/waiting area). My parents really loved the peanuts and couldn't stop eating them.

The price was really quite reasonable since most of the dishes come with two sides. We ordered a full rack of ribs and side orders of mashed potatoes and steak fries.  The ribs were literally falling-off-the-bone  delicious. The flavor and texture of the meat and BBQ sauce was among the best I've had in a while. The quantity of the mashed potatoes was a bit disappointing since the size was the equivalent of a large spoonful in a small dish. Also, the steak fries were only average, although they were well seasoned. It would have been much better if it little was a little more crispy on the outside. 

We also ordered the grilled salmon with a side of Caesar salad and a sweet potato. The salad was very fresh and well flavored. The croutons were super yummy, although it didn't feel like they gave us enough (either that or they were just that good). The sweet potato was also very well steamed and flavorful. The only complaint is that the salmon smelled... well... fishy (not in a good way). The taste was also a little off... and definitely did not mix well with the ribs. We ended up eating only a few bits of the salmon, and thought we'd let the manager know about the potential problem with the freshness of the fish.

We asked the server if we could speak to the manager (and she immediately went to get him for us). We explained the problem and the manager immediately offered to get us another dish or to take the grilled salmon off our bill. I was very impressed with the professionalism of his manner and actions and would definitely go back (although I would probably still avoid ordering the salmon).

I strongly recommend going to this place for the ribs (and the freshly cut steaks seemed yummy too!).

I got to say Crescent city is amazing!  The food here is delicious and homemade!  The Mac n cheese is excellent!  A huge bowl of creamy Mac n cheese for $9...you can eat it as a meal or share it with the table as a side.  Definitely one of the best Mac n cheese I have had,, rich and creamy loaded with plenty of cheese!

I also loved the jambalaya, my friend and I agreed that it was the best jambalaya in town!  The jambalaya has plenty of sausage and meat, beans, spices, and tons of flavors!  A plate of jambalaya is like $9, cheap and satisfying!  I ordered the mixed grill plate, which is a combination of daily house made sausages.   My favorite was the beef sausage; served with a sweet bbq sauce...it was sooo good!  Just think of little smokies, except these are a tad bigger and homemade, so good served with their bbq sauce!  The other sausages were good, but I felt they were too lean.  The lamb sausage wasn't bad, slightly sweet, served with a mustard based sauce.  You can only eat so much sausage, and for $15, it could feed two people.  A slice of house cured pastrami was served on my mixed grill plate; I didn't like the pastrami, it was too salty for my liking.  The house pickles were excellent!  All in all, the house made sausage was a winner, and they feature different sausages every day! 

I would definitely come back here, the food was all excellent and the prices are cheap!  The service here is also excellent.  I would recommend this restaurant for anyone would wants good jambalaya or sausage...I have not had their other entrees, but I heard the pizza is excellent!

If you're anything like me, Honey's is the type of place you're likely to go to again and again in order to try everything that piques your interest on their giant menu.

The wait is notorious, but that's pretty much the same of any great brunchery. You're in luck though if you go at an odd time such as a weekday afternoon or any evening.

The food is spectacular, with probably the most creative breakfast options I've ever seen. There's no shortage of huevos rancheros and other Mexican-inspired dishes, heck there's pretty much an amalgamation of some of the dishes you could think of- standard American, Southern, Jewish. The menu is just miles long with breakfast, lunch and dinner options for everyone. And as busy as the place is- the service is pretty on-point.

As a spicy food lover I must also indicate that there's not one but THREE different bottles of hot sauce on every table: Frank's, Tabasco & Sriracha.

Best part: breakfast served all day.
Worst part: their wait is notorious as I'd mentioned and the place is CASH ONLY

Honestly, I need to go here more often to try again and again. It's worth the wait.

Soooo, headline: EXCELLENT FOOD, lovely cocktails, rough service. I am confident my rating will improve once The Henley works out it's kinks in service. Until then, it's a tough call. We had a great time, and the environment is posh and fun. But the server was asleep at the wheel - as in, he forgot to bring our entrees and just handed us the check. When we asked for our food, he stared at us blankly. The manager was apologetic, but I do think they could generally do better at polishing service. That said: standout dishes were beef tartare, shrimp entree and mushroom sides. Wine list was lovely, but server was clueless about it.

Pre-game for a Union Transfer show. Walked in and was greeted by two lovely ladies handing out whiskey samples. Yum. Went to the bar and ordered a beer. They had a nice selection to choose from. Found out later they were known for their whiskey sours. Had a classic sour with egg whites. It was awesome. The service was great, the two bartenders were very knowledgeable about the beer and whiskey and were very nice and attentive. They also knew how to shake a drink. The shaker was moving like one of those shake weight commercials.  The place itself was cool although some people may call it a dive. I liked it myself. Old films being shown on the wall and a 60's style go go dancer providing entertainment.

I'm not much of a coffee drinker, so when I meet friends at coffee shops, I'm inevitably sipping a hot chocolate. Today I thought, lemme get fahncy cawfee. And there was one that caught my attention. My addled brain can't remember what it was a month ago, but in order to catch my attention, it probably had a citrus flavor in there somewhere. And the barista made it fahncy with a pretty design on top. Whatever it was, it was tasty and clearly worth the $5 I must have paid.

The atmosphere is very open and airy and this is a place clearly loved by locals, from trendy hipsters to neighborhood families with kids and dogs.

I had plans with my nearly 90 year old grandmother to go to a matinee of The Wizard of Oz at Touhill on a Sunday and I was looking for somewhere nice to go to lunch prior. I chose Hendel's Restarant. We arrived at about 12:15pm on Sunday and they said the wait would be about 10-15 minutes. Roughly 15 minutes later they sat us at a table for 2 on the patio under a heater which was fine. We had to flag a server down who walked by us 3 times and ask if she was our server. She said she didn't know but she'd be happy to take care of us. We explained we were in a hurry and ordered drinks and lunch right then. I ordered the gyro sandwich with French fries and my grandmother ordered the Portobello mushroom sandwich with French fries. The food arrived promptly which gave us about 20 minutes to eat. She loved her Portobello mushroom sandwich and we both loved the French fries which turned out to be large potato wedges with an orange seasoning on them. My gyro sandwich was sad. I was expecting pre-made strips and knew that somewhere like this they weren't carving the meat off a spit or anything but when I took the pita off the taco stand it came on and looked inside there were only 3 or 4 strips of the gyro meat. I was hungry all afternoon! The place is cute and there is some clever presentation like serving the gyro on a taco stand and serving the French fries in a mini metal fry basket but in my opinion the food I ate did not match the atmosphere. They didn't actually make anything on my plate. Anyone could assemble this from any restaurant supply company. Also when we were seated on the patio there were 6 empty tables for 2. They were staggering seating people when they had plenty of empty tables. I wasn't wowed here. Star #3 is for the nice server.

*In case you were worried we made it to our seats at The Wizard of Oz with 4 minutes to spare and it was lovely!

I really like this place - they're super accommodating in removing meat and subbing it with something else without upcharging. We had a boarder plate (subbed mushrooms) and a special avocado toast they had with egg and chorizo (subbed red peppers) - both were outstanding! I also had a mimosa (or 2) - they're heavier on the OJ than I like, but that was a quick fix. Pricing is super reasonable, and we'll be back! I love their enclosed patio.

I received a manicure (with gel nails) and a pedicure.  It was absolutely awesome.  Here is why I'm rating so low.  The receptionist (as sweet as she was while I was) didn't give me an approximate time on when I will be able to start my pedicure.  Another couple walked in after me and the gentleman behind the counter told them it'll be 45 minutes. I would've love for her to say, "Ma'am it will be about a 20 minute wait, is that okay?" NOPE, I didn't get that.  She also told me she'd booked me for a facial on Monday (which was my birthday and I was really excited about it), but on Monday I went in for my facial and was told "She tried to call you (WHICH SHE DID NOT), but she didn't get an answer."  I immediately went to my missed calls (nothing), so the receptionist lied.  The young lady apology and told me I can wait about 15 minutes and she'll be able to assist me, but it was my birthday and I wasn't waiting (hence me making an appointment).  As much as I love the ambiance here, I will not go back.  There are so many nail places that I don't have to pay these high prices for such basic service.

I was in charge of looking for a lunch place for a group and this one sounds pretty good, as it has a variety of food from pizza to burger to veggie bowl.  Not to mention their beer.  

Many places boast about their beer selection, but Oak & Stone is altogether another level.  They have like over 50 taps, all line up along the wall. You get a wristband, after having your ID checked, and then you can go to the taps and pour yourself whatever you want to try.  Each tap has a screen with the basic info and you can tap on the screen for a more detailed story.  The beers are mostly from Florida, up and down the state, with some limited releases, grouped by style.  They even have 4 or 5 ciders!  You are charged by how much you pour, down to 1/10 of an ounce, so you won't feel lose out if you happen to pour 4.1 oz. All of us love this system and keep leaving the table for more beer.  We end up drinking (and paying more) than if we were to just order a glass, but we all felt that the price is very reasonable for the amount we drink, and the ability to try just two or three oz of something without bothering anybody is priceless. 

Okay, on to the food... even though I admit I'll be back just for the beer... 

The pizza has a lot of interesting toppings.  We get the fun guy (wordplay on fungi) which is so delicious, and the Far East, with Korean meatball, sesame slaw and even some molecular gastronomic soy sauce pearls. The latter is too sweet for my taste. The turkey burger was a little on the mushy side.  Overall, great beer, good enough food - what you'd expect from a beer-centric restaurant like this. 

Service is phenomenal.  Needless to say, they are all ready to guide us through using the beer system and help us with the menu, but when we leave, they pour extra lemonade into little cups with straw for the kids to take along (and that's after a refill). How awesome is that!

Please please, Oak & Stone, make your way down south soon!!

Our nephew was driving back to Missouri, so the family drove together... decided to have lunch in Indianapolis.  While The Eagle wasn't our first choice, we ended up here because the other location didn't open until 12pm, but glad we ended up here.  We arrive little after 11am, got seated right away and after reviewing the menu, we went with the following items:

- Whole fried Chicken
- Fried Chicken Sandwich
- Fried Chicken BLT
- Blackened Shrimp Po'Boy
- Side items:  Collards, Mac-n-Cheese, Spoonbread and fries.

The bills total was around $90, this included few drinks as well and this order was for 5 people.

Our Favorites:

- Fried Chicken - the chicken was perfectly fried, moist and juicy!!  I would highly recommend their fried chicken. What makes this chicken even better is their spicy honey!!  Pour on top of the chicken, dip it, whatever you do, don't forget to try it!!

- Fried Chicken Sandwich - very simple, yet delicious!!  Perfectly fried crispy chicken breast, with coleslaw in between two soft buns!  I could eat this everyday!  I'm not a fan of chicken breast, but the meat was tender and juicy, heck yeah, I could be converted from darkside!!!

- Collards - didn't expect too much, but was blown away by the taste and flavors in their collards!  Perfectly seasoned and the greens were cooked perfectly!  Their collards are in my top 5!

- Spoonbread - excellent, moist, love how they brushed the top with butter before serving and with spoon on top.  It's one side you must order with the collards!

Good, but...

- Blackened Shrimp Po-Boy - What I expected and what I got is the reason this dish ended up at the bottom.  The shrimp was perfectly cooked, but it was not "blackened" as expected... that I can let it go... but the charred avocado relish didn't help this dish.  They took a simple po'boy and tried to make it sophisticated, just keep it to the basic.

- Mac-n-cheese - this dish was on salty side... most likely due to the type of cheeses they used in the dish.

- Fries - had them in other locations before.

- Chicken BLT - not bad, but while the BLT concept was there, wasn't blown away by the sandwich. 

Their menu had more drink options then food options and their focus seems to be their fried chicken.  This is a good location if you are meeting up with friends or colleagues for drinks.  The street it was located on, reminded me of Chicago.  The service was excellent and if you are in the area would highly recommend stopping by.  Oh, on Sunday's parking is free :)

I've been here a few times now and it's been awesome every single time. The mood is vibrant and fun and the service is always great. There is something special about feeling like you are getting food from a beloved uncle who lives what he serves you. 
I've only ever got the Cuban. It's generously sized and the bread is soooooo yummy. I convinced my skeptical Cuban friend to come and she had three media Noche. She said she felt like she was at home again. 
The yellow rice is simple and flavorful and they bring you a shout of Cuban coffee near the end of your meal. It's really something special and I highly recommend it. 

I will suggest bringing a jacket if you get cold easily. I'm always freezing in there!

The food speaks for itself. 
I've had lunch and several take out orders from the restaurant and the truck(you'll find more in Wilmington than Philly). Excellent portion sizes, a nice friendly staff and reasonable prices. They do have 2 pages, catering and dining check both out for the photos  Book them for an event if you desire. The restaurant has a lovely atmosphere and nice decor. Oh and they are fast! I was in and out in no time(even in the lunch rush). They are approaching their brick-n-mortar 1yr anniversary, give them a try before they get "big time" like everyone is expecting.

The service was not to friendly, but the food was excellent.  We went very late, like about midnight, staying in the French Quarters, this was walking distance, for my LOVE for pancakes child who couldn't resist.  Food was fresh food was good, but whenever they forgot to bring something, and you request for it again, you can feel the energy, and the vibe of not wanting to do so.  
NO, it was NOT busy.  I believe it was one couple, and just ourselves (family of 3).
The scenery was nice, walking distance to the Walgreens, for hotel snacks, and fun, memorable walks.
I will dine here again, if I'm in the area.

Why 2 stars? Because nothing turns me off more than pushy salesmanship.

   ---   ---   ---

Lately, I've been on a quest to find a place where I can get an oil change without having someone list the 13 things I could upgrade to or different system flushes that I need. I don't know why this is so hard to find, but in Tampa, it seems to be a requirement to try to rip people off if you're in the oil change business.

I was in the area anyway and saw the great reviews here, so I figured I would give them a try. As I pulled up, there was literally no one in line, and this was the kind of place where you just stay in your car while they are working on it, which was perfect!

The guy (named Andreas) seemed to be having a lot of fun doing his job, as he was laughing and dancing as he worked. He was making a lot of jokes as he was putting my info in the system, which is definitely nicer than the person who is obviously miserable in their job. But that's about where the fun ended for me.

He begins quoting me on the different price options, and of course, he starts at the highest number, which is something crazy like $79.99. As he is working his way down the ridiculously high priced services, I see the list of prices next to my window. To see the cheapest options, it requires you to sit up in your seat and look all the way down to the bottom. I saw the lowest option was $36.99 so I said, "let me stop you right there - I want the $36.99 oil change."

He said, "wellllll.... I'm going to do something special for you..." and then he began to whisper, "I'm going to hook you up with a 25% discount for the high-mileage oil change at $54.99. What do you think about that?"

I was quickly trying to do the math in my head for 25% off $55, and then he whispered some more, "Just nod your head and say yes..." as he was giving me the creepiest stare and nodding his head up and down. 

I said, "look, as long as it comes out to the same or less money than the $36.99 option, I'm good with that." 

He said, "yeah it actually might end up being cheaper."

So then he goes about doing the oil change with his partner and continues being loud, cracking jokes and trying to make small talk. At this point, I'm really annoyed at how I've once again found such an oil change place that's built upon up-selling and pressuring people. 

It comes to the end of the service and he tells me the total is $45.69. I say, "woah, what happened to $36.99 or cheaper."

He says, "well after you have Uncle Sam and yadda yadda, you get to the $45.69. And see - only $3 more than the original oil change, plus you get better oil!"

So here's what bothers me:

1) The pressured up-selling to begin with, have I mentioned that?

2) He told me that the price would be equal or less than the base-line oil change.

3) The total came out to $3 more, which he obviously knew beforehand.

Does paying $3 more for something bother me? Absolutely not. But in principle, this level of sleaziness agitated me to my core.
