I write a ton of positive reviews for great local businesses that I love, but in this case, I'm so glad that we have Yelp to get the word out about people and businesses like this. In the past, consumers would have to deal with this kind of stuff without a way to warn others.

So now that we have this tool, here is my official warning: I would highly recommend looking elsewhere for your oil change, but sadly, I've yet to find a place that I can really vouch for! After my wife had a similar experience at another location, I know one thing for sure - I will never visit a Take 5 again.
My experience goes back and forth as of recent I felt the need to let you all know service has improved and errors have decreased!  Also, back in menu is the beloved white cheddar I missed!

After visiting the Mormon temple open house, Nando F and I came here for a late lunch. I was so glad it was relaxed and laid-back spot.
Yelpers, whether you're a veggie lover or you enjoy your meat, you'll find something delicious and more exciting than your average everyday meal. You won't be able to resist not trying the smoky flavors of the grill.

We started with tasty cold appetizers combo of all of their menu appetizers (a table spoon sized portions,) and it sure surprised our senses and excited our palates. Followed with an incredible, marinated & charcoaled chicken breasts with a loud and clear flavor. The chicken was super-flavorful and moist. It was served with rice, potatoes, and house-made tzatziki sauce.

- Service: Spot-on.
- Ambiance: Cozy.
- Cost: affordable.
- Food: Amazing.

Four and a Quarter Yelps.

Where has this place been in my life? The fact that there's a coffee shop with iced lattes "on tap" is such a novel idea that I love. My only criticism is that I wish they had a branch in Pittsburgh. The taste of the coffee was very smooth with slight accents of dark roast flavor and no acidic aftertaste (which I hate). If the owners of La Colombe read this, please consider Pittsburgh for your next location!

Hidden little juice gem in Franklin!! Loved the staff and their helpfulness and friendliness to find me the perfect juice. The store being super cute also has a lot to say. 

I made sure to use the Yelp buy $5 get $10! 

I ordered the Go Green and it was so delicious! Another favorite is the sunrise !!! 

That hint of ginger is such a pleasant surprise !!

3 Stars out of respect for tradition. (STL tradition that is)
This place has been around for years and is considered an institution around those parts.

It is just custard though. 

Was it life altering? No
Was there a ridiculously long line? Yes
Did I feel compelled to finish my cup? Nope
Was it the best Ive ever had? HARDLY
Will I return? Meh

Put it this way: STL has boasts a crazy good food and drink scene. Maybe I should have managed my expectations for this place. I expected it to fall in line with the rest of the food and drink scene I have come to love.

Love this place! The food here is made so flavorful and quick. My friends and I had several dishes here. I really liked the spicy edamame and the hot wok tiger shrimp. I also liked the dynamite rolls. The customer service was ok, but the food made up for it.

Delicious. Nearby. Vegetarian choices. Eager to please. Locally owned. Thank you!
Sure, beans & rice alone can make a fine burrito or taco; but Indy Taco sizzles up veggies like mushrooms, onions, & zucchini & serves 'em up in a grilled flour or soft corn tortilla topped with fresh cilantro, radishes, cucumber, lettuce & tomato. Squeeze that lime wedge, don't be shy, give it all a little sprinkle. Love their elote; asked for & received their chili pepper shaker & gave it a really thorough dusting. Spicy! They also have quesadillas & tortas on their menu, with choices of beef, chorizo, chicken, & pork to mix & match. Chips with guac, salsa or queso, and cans or bottles of drinks. 
They know the restaurant biz, after years at Mama Carolla's. As time goes by & with support from the neighborhood, they can grow. Urge them to incorporate some outdoor seating for the season! Heaven knows there's plenty of parking in this little center, cordon off some & perhaps build a little deck. They deserve to be that busy; try it yourself & you'll see.

Truly one of the hidden gems of outdoor life in Nashville: it has a campground, but also a parklike area with picnic tables and access to the water directly in several areas, as well as a boat ramp.

The great thing about it is that only the campground itself is a for-pay area, while the rest of it is entirely free.

I've taken my son to seven points lots of times, and he loves to go and throw rocks in the water.  We can spend a quiet hour together, I watch to make sure he doesn't get too close, I watch the boats pass, I enjoy the blue sky, and my son loves the opportunity to make stones splash into Percy Priest Lake.  We've gone at least a few times for the last three summers, and he always gets a kick out of it.  We visit a beautiful area for free, he drains some energy, and I get to have quality time with my son.  What can be better?
if you're a fan of the TV program, then you'll love the outlet. Much of what you see ends up on the outlet floor. When people return items they come back here, and you get them for a great price.

I came to this park a lot as a kid. My fondest memory was the cat gang that was always squatting near the playground. Years went by before I would visit again and I mentioned to someone how all these cats used to be there- all the time. Some old lady was keeping them fed. It was kind of weird when I showed up 15 years later to see that the cat pride is still strong, maybe stronger than before...and someone practically built them a village. How has no one mentioned this in all these reviews? Hah. So there's one portion of the park where you'll see a ton of cats. 

Other than that, this park is pretty decent. Lots of wandering to do in the woods, which is something I always love. It's gorgeous in the winter when it snows and the water freezes over. I tested my luck walking on it last year after I saw guys dabbling in some ice fishing.

It isn't my top park, but a cool place to swing by when I want to change things up.

I absolutely love their bath bombs. I really do. And I've gone to this store several times to purchase gifts for friends and family because who doesn't love a Lush gift?! My biggest complaint is the layout of this store. I always feel so closed in and it's difficult to navigate their products. And when I wholeheartedly want to just browse in peace, I feel like I constantly have to keep rotating around the store to be fair and make room for other customers. It's just a space issue, honestly. But their products - top notch. My next purchase will hopefully be a glitter filled bath bomb. Because who doesn't love glitter in their tub?

We are slowly but surely eating our way through the HipCity Veg menu and, as meat lovers, have been pleasantly surprised and extremely satisfied.  I'm officially obsessed with the crispy ranch "chick'n" sandwich - I don't know how they do it, but the protein looks, feels and tastes miraculously like chicken!  I have dissected it and all but looked at it under a microscope, and it's a total culinary revelation.  It even reheats well for next day lunch leftovers.  The fajita wrap is super flavorful, and the veggie burger, though not as inexplicably identical to its carnivorous counterpart as the crispy chick'n, is meaty and hearty.  Sweet potato fries are good - pretty standard - but what makes them unique is the dipping sauce, a whipped concoction of savory cilantro goodness.  The only downsides I can see are that they've been sold out of the kale the two times we've tried to order it, and there's no restroom for their dine-in customers.  But all in all, this is not what you think of as typical vegan food - it's substantial.  It's flavorful.  It's total man food (no offense to my male vegan friends).

We all scream for Mike's Ice Cream!  It was so good.  This is not my favorite ice cream place ever, but its very good and as good as it gets, or at least that I could find, while I was in Nashville.  It was so hot the week I was visiting Nashville and this was a true joy to find.  Creamy ice cream in fantastic flavors... try the nutter butter!  Its a must try if you love ice cream!

Great place to go for lunch and the service is wonderful. I am able to get in and out of this place all during my lunch hour -- granted, I work close by. Decided to upgrade my review from 4 stars to 5 because it is always a great experience each time!

This place was rocking! I had the short ribs lunch and though the portion was smaller -- possibly because it was a lunch portion -- it was absolutely delicious! The waitress even offered us some sake because it was their anniversary of the restaurant but we declined because it was our lunch time. We definitely love this place and the employees are very helpful and kind. Glad we live by this place because we will be returning!

I finally came to Ralphs along with Dr. Eagle and the gang. It's an older establishment with an authentic Italian charm to it. There are about 10-15 tables with lots of decor and history on the walls. 

Ordered the chicken parmigiana as it was HIGHLY recommended by the waiter as well as several others at the table who have already been there. The portions were massive and it came with a side of pasta or vegetables. Others at the table ordered the ( veal parmigiana - also highly recommended), ravioli with meatballs and spaghetti with meatballs.  All dishes were good but I think the red pasta sauce (which they call gravy) was the real hit. 

OH, they gave complimentary cannolis for the table and holy moly, they were SO good. Only if all cannolis were made with this much love and flavor.
Expensive but good. Father in law slipped and fell on ice while walking in. The lady did a report on it and was very sweet. They have all kinds of food. Love it

My order: Crispy HipCity Ranch (chick'n) $10 added Buffalo Sauce for $1, and sweet potato fries $5. $17; I brought my own water.

Everything was yum! The sandwich is super similar to that of a chicken sandwich. It was very flavorful; I'm glad I added the buffalo sauce because I love a kick. It's a mild spice, so no worries. The ranch sauce that comes on it was the perfect pairing. Next time I'll pass on $5 fries. I believe an order of fries is enough for 2 people. The sandwich is filling enough. I love that the utensils and bags are compostable. I'd definitely come here for another one of the sandwiches.

i love this place. 

the owner is pretty awesome. hes friendly and takes his time to speak to u. this can be a slow process but its well worth it.

the spot is a true proprietorship and i wish the best for them.

since ive eaten here once, i had the hot pastrami n roast beef. 
the small is a joke. the medium is nine inches.
the fam is a two footer and decent width.

the bread was delicious. i took the meat out of half my sammich and dbl meated half so that i can eat the soft sourdough roll that was used. the bread was rly rly rly good!!! 

the pastrami was nice and tender. no extra salt or pepper which made the natural juices thrive.

the roast beef was whatever. 

the spot is small and shares patio with the smoothie place. 

i like this place and will visit again when im out there in sb. 

fyi: its on route to the scenic drive that puts u passed shoreline park which is absolute eye porn. santa babizzles is soooo amazing.
i would like to live there someday.

Quick version: fantastic pizza (they deliver too), reasonable prices on food, fresh ingredients, horrible adult beverage prices, could use a better air conditioner.

My wife and I love the pizza here; we find it better than another local option Buona two miles south, which has been on a steady decline.  Tuttorossa has a huge variety of pre-configured selections, the typical toppings and also some much more exotic options that include feta, artichokes, ricotta, prosciutto, broccoli, spinach, red onions, meatballs, etc.  An additional item to mention is their kids pizza is only $6 (cheese only) but is huge; if your kid eats the entire thing, please make them exercise the next day.

Their Cannelloni is also excellent; great sauce, great cheese, great filling.

They do serve a hamburger, but they will only serve it medium or higher, no medium rare or lower.  It doesn't taste bad, but it's not a standout when there are several better burger places on St Pete Beach, so I wouldn't get that as it's just mediocre.

They have dining indoors in a bar area with a number of tables and lots of TV's, a more traditional dining room sans TV's, and an outdoor area.  The outdoor tables are along a reasonably busy street (Blind Pass Rd) but they've got large planters with bushes to keep you from having to watch all the cars heading north to VIP Mexican Restaurant for margaritas.

We'd probably eat here more, but the service is not always the best from a speed perspective (attention to detail, being polite/friendly, etc. is always five stars) and the dining room is often really warm; on our most recent visit I left sweaty.  The dining room also has a really bad audio system; it sounds like your dad's old stereo that you blew out the speakers on when you were a teenager and your parents weren't home.  The only other mild complaint is the drink prices are really high.  They do have Peroni, but other than that, it's just beer and wine, and just run of the mill options like the typical Bud products, Shock Top, Dos Equis, etc.  Beers are $4.50, so we typically don't come here when we feel like having beer since that bill can get out of hand fast.

What a fantastic event. So many restaurants so many wines and even a few beers. Honestly, even if you aren't a wine fan you should just come to sample all of the amazing food.

We arrived right at 1 pm and the line was already pretty long.  We were in the gate by 1:15. Before you enter the event you are handed a small glass and card on a lanyard with 12 circles.  Every time you get a drink the staff will mark off a circle so to not over serve you.  12 was more than enough. 

Some food favorites were Anthony's Chop House which ran out of food first. (bad move on their part) I was so close to sampling one of their delicious burgers. Another favorite was Blue Sushi's ceviche. I personally enjoyed Ruth's Chris Steak House veal ravioli.

I was happy to see there were also a few businesses serving desserts. This was a nice change up because some of the fishes were rich and heavy.  Gallery Pastry shop was there with their macaroons and a hazelnut chocolate pudding mousse. 

I was super excited to see an iced coffee vendor as it was super hot the day of. 

My husband was happy to see a couple of beer vendors too. There was a delicious pumpkin ale. I would like to see a couple more next year. 

The event was a huge success and I can't wait to attend another. I would recommend finding a way for more tables to sit and stand at. Maybe even adding some fans or cooling mists. The event was super hot and a lot of food tents were in the sun. 

Pro tip.  Grab a bottle of water to drink and rinse your pallet but also to clean out your wine glass. 

For staff, the water ran out early so a reminder to add more next year. Loved the backdrop for photos.  The Kroger bags were a nice touch also.

We came here for our third straight outside breakfast during our anniversary in Clearwater Beach. This is by far the best breakfast so far. We ordered crab cake egg Benedict and Hey Lucy Omelets. Both were good and delicious! You can taste nice crabmeat from the crab cake. I am not a big fan for egg Benedict, but this crab cake thing does make an exception to me. Love it! We will come here again if you are visiting Clearwater beach.
Used to love going to Bodega but their sandwiches have been super greasy lately and it's just not the same as it used to be :/

By golly is this the best service I have ever received in a really long time! Absolutely amazing and definitely worth the bucks to hit up Fogo de Chao in Philly! (TIP: I would sign up for their newsletters for promos - They're really helpful) 

Basically if I were to give a rundown on my experience this would be how it is, You walk in (Made rerversation - And I highly recommend you do too!) They get you seated (They made an effort to get the chair, probably because I was a woman, while I sat) and then they'll ask you if you've been there before, if you say yes I'm sure they skip the "instructions" but since this was our first time they made it very easy to understand and let us go on our merry way. Basically you get this "chip" it'll be Red for Stop on one side and Green for Go on the other side. You turn it to Green if you want the "meat servers" to stop by your table and cut you a piece of what they're carrying (Each server carries a different cut, type and or different seasoning of meats) and you take your handy dandy tongs that are provided at the table and grab a hold of the piece while they happily slice the meat for you. Afterwards, you can either keep it on Green for more meats or you turn it down to Red to stop while you enjoy the succulent pieces of meats. 

So besides the "you don't have to move" meat buffet, there's also your choices of getting up and going to the Salad Bar, which they will have, obviously salads, pieces of cut fruit (Pinapples, papaya, and etc.), they even have 3 types of cheeses as well as bread and slices of cured meat laid out for you to pick and choose. But besides the salad bar they also have a small section of "carbs" which are seasoned rice, potatoes and what looked to me like marshmallows/smores?

So what else besides handy men with cuts of meat and the salad bar? They have a huge list of wines, cocktails and drinks that you can choose from in the beginning (BTW drinks are not all you can drink, nor are the desserts in the end). And besides this they bring you, in the beginning of your meal, small side dishes, which consists of small trays of "carbs" which I liked to avoided...except that they were delicious! I'm sure you can ask for more if you like them and you wanted more, but I didn't ask them personally. 

Service? Pfft! It was AMAZING! They make sure to know why you're there (Anniversary, birthdays and whatnot - TIP: They actually give you a complimentary dessert with what you're celebrating) They also make sure to 

Overall, this place has amazing service, wonderfully seasoned cuts of meat and a great salad bar! I would whole heartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone that's looking to spend a special night with a loved one or even a huge celebration!
Definitely my favorite place to go for an açaí bowl! You get what you pay for for sure. I love the options they have for both the bases and the toppings too!!! Like dragonfruit!

I wish I could give Black Rock Vapor TEN STARS!
I've been a smoker for 23 years and on average I smoke about a pack and a half to two packs a day. Last year,  I almost dies from a PE and Pnuemonia in my right lung. I cut back smoking for awhile, but being a true hardcore smoker,  I went back up. I have a few friends that Vape and they recommended I switch. I was hesitant,  but I FINALLY decided to switch over from traditional cigarettes to Vaping.
So, I KNOW NOTHING about vaping, the equipment, the juices, etc. I had a friend give me some basic info, but after looking on Yelp and seeing the great reviews for Black Rock Vapor, and it only being 2 minutes from my house, I decided to go. I walked in having no idea what I wanted to get.
Greg, the owner, greeted me when I walked in and I told him my situation and what I was looking for. I'm a total Noob to vaping, I wanted something adjustable, not too big, I didn't want a mod that was really powerful either. Great was beyond AWESOME! He really helped me pick out a Mod and Tank that suited my needs. Then the fun part, the juices!
I LOVE THE TASTING BAR! It's really nice being able to taste test the flavors before you buy them and they have a list of about 20 flavors,  30ml each, that are only $10, instead of $16.95, each month the flavors change out. I got Black Cherry, Rootbeer Candy, and Mocha. 
Also, and I was prepared to pay $500 to get my card just for this,  THEY HAVE CBD!! I've been wanting to try CBD to see if it will help with my back pain. I got the 150mg, and I think I'm gonna try the 500mg. Greg said he has a few clients with similar back problems to mine that it's really helped. I'm so excited about this!
Greg really made sure I got everything I needed that would fit my wants and needs. He didn't try to sell me anything more than I needed. He and the girl there, I forgot her name but her winged liner is on point, we're both very nice, helpful, and they really know their stuff! 
I will be going back on Sunday or Monday as I would like a bigger, top fill tank for the nicotine juice and I will keep the smaller tank for the CBD. I don't plan on ever going anywhere else for my vaping needs! 
And I'm down from 2 packs a day to only half a pack in less than a week!! I hope to only be vaping within 3 months, 6 at most! Stop in if you're an experienced Vaper or if you're looking to switch over. Very happy with my ELEAF iStick Power, 80W and 5000 maahs. See, I'm already learning!
I can't say enough about how great this shop and the people here are!! 
Support Local and HAPPY Yelping!!

We went for a Friday night dinner at Jasmine Thai. When we entered we were amazed by the decor of the restaurant as well as the dress of the servers as it was giving a feeling like we are in Thailand. For the dinner we ordered Chicken Potstickers, Chicken Red Curry, Lo Mein Chicken Noodles and Chicken Spicy Fried Rice. The service was good and we first got our potstickers. The potstickers were amazing in taste and then we got our rest of the food. Chicken Curry was the best and we loved that. It was one of the best we tried. It had perfect amount of spices and perfect taste. We loved our dinner.

Came here with family on a weekday evening and I was impressed by how grand this building is! I loved reading about its history, so much must've happened here. There is plenty of indoor and outdoor seating and everything was really clean. 

I got the flight and it's a great price for $10-I'm also from the Bay Area and I'm used to Bay Area prices.  I loved the variety and the way that they gave you a piece of paper with your drinks names. You write it yourself when you select.

The menu is big and it's typical American
fare with a twist on some items. it's a bit pricey but you pay for the experience. The service was nice. 

The pork belly and pudding was interesting! I love bread pudding, I love pork belly, and I love beans so this all went well together. The piece of pork was quite fatty. Good for washing down with the beer.

Overall a nice ambience, but I think there's so many other cool places in Reno that I'd like to come back to next time!

HH 3-6 75cent oysters, half off drinks. 

I loved Luke's when I was visiting NOLA. Came with a group of 8 and they were extremely accommodating. No wait at 4 pm! Who can beat 75 cent oysters?! Given there are places who sell em for 50cents a piece, but are they as good?? Maybe next trip. These raw oysters were definitely better than Acme. 

Anyway, the pate was one of best pates I've ever had. I prefer to eat it with the table bread rather than the crispy bread given with it. The fried oysters were sooo mouth watering. It was perfectly crispy and evenly battered. The quail was delicious as well! The bread pudding was okay imo. Maybe I was too full to indulge.

I'm happy I got to stop by 3 of John Besh's restaurants while visiting.

I got a last-minute message from my daughter that today was the one-day-sale for dance class regalia and to please rush to this store and get the items my granddaughter needed.  I thought the parking lot looked crowded when I arrived, and once inside I could see why.  Every mom and daughter in St Albert must have been inside, trying on costumes and shoes, leotards and tutus, sparkles and tulles abounding.  I was approached immediately by a roving employee (they were all dressed in black, so easy to spot) who took my list and filled it in record time with exactly what I needed, and emphasized that if any size wasn't perfect they would be happy to exchange it for my daughter when she was available.  At checkout, they asked if my granddaughter had her heart set on anything in particular for Halloween, as they were making lists for special ordering hard-to-get costumes, such as Elsa (and if you don't know who that is, you obviously do not have a young girl in your family!).

It's pretty amazing to walk into a store you don't know, finding it crowded with so many enthusiastic customers, get helped immediately with lots of smiles, and be checked out and back in your car in six minutes.  I am impressed.  I am also eager to return on a quieter day to explore all the goodies I spotted, and go upstairs to the costume area.  The employees get big kudos from me for being knowledgable, friendly, and efficient.  

p.s. I also loved the sign in their window that said, "Thank you for shopping local."

We decided to visit Charro Steak for Easter Brunch. In addition to the regular Sunday brunch menu there was an all you could eat prime rib, lamb and ham along with a flour tortilla and beans for $30. Hubby had pancakes but I went for the all natural grass fed prime rib. It was delicious. Rare, juicy and flavorful. I love the handmade mesquite peach ice tea too. The service was great. The manager stopped by to ask how everything was tasting and if we needed anything. Always a smart idea. Highly recommend Charro Steak. Hot tip: make sure you have reservations during Tucson's tourist season.

Nothings all that new here, I still love Pi! There deep dish is to die for and the crust is what makes it so special. Seriously, I could eat this crust as meal. It has sooo much flavor. 

Only, I do have to come out and say it. 

I don't think Pi makes very good drinks...at all. 

The last couple times I've tried something new. The Sangria and their most popular drink which name I can't remember. It's lemony and has a lot of basil. Vague, I know, but you'll notice it since it's one of a very short list. The sangria is "meh", which I mentioned earlier, but the basil drink is even worse. I guess when you pay $8-10 for a cocktail in St. Louis you expect something kind of a decent. That's the bane of living in a cheap city. 

Pro tip: Stick to beer w/pizza!

A must stop if your ever in the area or simply make a trip out for the stunning grounds!  The excellent staff here is friendly and helpful, especially Diana!  They truly assist you and are happy to share their love of the spectacular displays and plants with you!  

The grounds are amazing!  It actually feels much more like an arboretum or someone's estate, rather than a retail location.  I was in complete awe of the beauty and maturity of these plants.  I was able to purchase several less common succulents here that I would not be able to find at home.  Definitely the highlight of my trip driving up along the coast.

Location: Not on the madness of Bourbon but still awesome for people watching. 

Atmosphere: Woah... this was definitely someones house (at least upstairs). The first floor looks pretty traditional NOLA, like a bar/restaurant. 

Service: Okay, the food took a WHILE to come. It was our last night in town so we were taking it easy anyways. The balcony and breeze was treating us right, and the FREE appetizer(w/yelp check in) helped the time fly. Also, our waitress made me feel so at home and comfortable. I forgot her name but she had red hair and gave that traditional "yessss babbbyyyyy" vibe. So soothing and was honestly trying her hardest to keep up with the crazyness of NOLA restaurants. 


FOOD: This brings us all the way up to a 5 star general. 
1. Crawfish bread for the free appetizer. It was basically a creole twist on spinach artichoke dip.....with crawfish mixed in. It was delicious! 
2. Bloody Mary: These thinks AINT cheap. But they are tasty. $10 for one but you can tell they're made with love. Pretty spicy and plenty boozy. 
3. Shrimp Poboy: loaded with shrimp, pickles, tomatoes, and mayo. Top it off with hot sauce and you got a traditional hit! 
4. Blackened Chicken Pasta: SHOW STOPPER. the sauce was creamy, flavorful, and light. The chicken carried the punch and flavor of the dish. It was one of the best comfort foods we had in NOLA!

I REALLY wanted to LOVE this place.   I go to Finis Landing quite a bit, and I was so looking forward to visiting the spin off.  I stopped in to have a beer and grab some food and catch the vibe. It was about 430pm on Monday, and there was a big table behind me,  and a few people at the bar.   
I was hoping for a couple Mexican beers on draft, as I saw them in prior reviews.    They only had Dos Equis Amber on draft.    I had one and switched to Pacifico bottle.....( happy hour bottles were 5 dollars).
I noticed several kitchen staff sitting outside of the kitchen chatting with the bar tender.   There was a  friendly cook/manager?? who  walked around talking to the large table behind me, as well as the table on the perimeter.  I heard him introduce himself, and say he checks up on people to make sure they have a good experience.     He brought the perimeter table  several dishes....and I could not find them on the menu.   Still undeterred, I really wanted to try several things on the menu.    I love burgers, and I was intrigued by the "burger of the week".  

 I asked and the kind bartender what the burger was....she grabbed a small notepad  where the description was ...and told me..." it has green chiles on it and it sounds delicious".    I love green chiles....so I said I am in.    I asked for it to be medium rare.....and that part was excellent.  
 
It said "market price"....but I am figuring hey.... Its a hamburger.. how expensive can it be? 

It was $18.00!!....for a burger and fries. 

 When I opened the to go container....it looked...(well.. see picture).   It was salty, and the bun was super hard.     I was so sad.....I mean seriously sad. 

The avocado tacos were good...but literally they used a quarter of an avocado per taco, put some stuff on it and ...boom.   I ordered corn tortillas, the tacos came out on flour tortillas.    Two tacos and beans...$12.00.  

SO here is my take.   I understand they are new, and training staff, etc.   However clear prices and better descriptions of each item would be most excellent.    Also, if you are walking around greeting customers and asking how things are going, don't over look the single people who sit at the bar and tables.  EVERY CUSTOMER matters.   
 The prices are high based on Tucson, and if you are asking $18.00 for "the burger of the week"....a better description of what you are getting other  than a note pad is warranted, and it should be presented looking better than what I got. 

I may try this place again, but no time soon.

I enjoyed Alta. It felt like dining in an experimental kitchen. If you were going for a nice, casual evening of food and drink this wouldn't necessarily be the place. It is designed as a dining experience where the food comes fist. I found my focus was less on the date and more on experiencing all-Canadian ingredients served at room temperature. Fascinating to be sure. 

We started with appetizers of Malt hazelnuts and Olive Plums. The hazelnuts tasted like postum and we're quite addictive. The olive plums were excellent at the start but grew tiresome. By the end of the meal I had finished them but my wife had long given up eating them. 

The lamb tartar was sweet, the texture was so soft. I loved it but I noticed a nearby dinner did not finish hers. When the server asked if she wanted it packaged to go she simply said, "No." My wife had the salmon and was very happy with her choice. The dill sauce worked so well with the subtle flavours of the salmon. 

For dessert we shared the rice pudding which had an amazing taste initially but the undercooked graininess of the rice was more and more noticeable as you continued. Happy we had it though we were more impressed with the story behind it than the taste of it. (Did you know that rice is grown in only one place in Canada by a man who uses it for sake production? The pudding here uses the rice and the residue from the sake fermentation process. I guess you can grow almost anything in the Okanagan!) 

The atmosphere felt very deliberate, very calculated, much like the menu. I wouldn't call it comfortable but it was welcoming enough that I would return again. Staff are very friendly and proud of their work. When your server is your chef it certainly changes the experience. 

I you want an even more adventurous experience, check out the Alder Room next door.

I now have two favorite gelato places in the US--unfortunately, they're each 1-2 plane rides away. I went to Frost Gelato last weekend during a trip to Tucson with friends. One of my friends, the self-proclaimed  "indoorsy" Bill C., was not thrilled that our afternoon had been devoted to hiking Sabino Canyon (which was beautiful, by the way). Four of us finished the hike about 30-40 minutes ahead the remaining 3, who had lingered to swim in the falls. Frost Gelato  made for the perfect stop as we waited for our friends to finish. 

I recommend the affogato. Authentic affogatos (affogati?) are composed of an espresso shot poured over a tiny little scoop of vanilla gelato. I love real Italian affogatos, but I much prefer the more substantial American version served by Frost. For about the same price as a medium, you can get TWO flavors of gelato and chocolate sauce covered in a generous serving of espresso and topped with whipped cream. (Confession:  the affogato is so good that just writing about it gave me such an uncontrollable chocolate craving that I had to go into my cupboards to get a few dark chocolate covered almonds from Sprouts in order to complete this review). 

And thus the day was saved. Bill's annoyance with nature disappeared, and gelato triumphed again.

I made my first trip to Taste on Sunday for brunch. I have lived in the neighborhood for almost 8 months and had never stopped. I will make Taste a part of my routine from now on. I really love the concept of ordering, getting your coffee/water, and enjoying conversation, while waiting for your food to be delivered. The general coffee selections were very nice and I enjoyed the 'pour your own' concept for the water and coffee. The water options had nice infused fruit water, which was very refreshing! I ordered the breakfast sandwich on a bagel, with a side of fruit. I could not believe my eyes when it came to the table, the eggs were perfectly cooked and plentiful. If I would have to guess, I would say that there were 3-4 eggs on the bagel! The bacon was nicely cooked and crispy, with a very light aioli to pair well with the eggs and bacon flavors. I love the outdoor seating option and ambiance of the restaurant. I will definitely be back for brunch (and maybe dinner). I would highly suggest Taste to anyone looking for a great brunch experience!

I really didn't want to come here just to jump on the bandwagon, but I'm jumping on the bandwagon. 

Hattie B's chicken is cooked extremely well and I've tried both the Damn Hot and Shut the Cluck Up heat levels. If you're a heat chaser, then neither will be very hot for you. It's more of a peppery hot than a full on mouth and tongue burning. It's very tasteful and you can still enjoy the taste of the chicken. 

The dirty bird fries are amazing. The crinkle cut fries are topped with cheese, macaroni, pickles, bite sized pieces of chicken. I loved every bite, this for me really stole the show. I would order the dirty bird fries every time I returned. 

Hattie B's definitely lives up to the hype, give it a try. The 30 minute wait is very worth it.

Before I even get into the food, which was delicious, I just want to give a shout out to the hostess, who, at the height of brunch on a busy Saturday, managed to keep a sidewalk full of people organized and was kind and helpful to everyone she encountered.  

We waited 45 minutes for a table, which was in an adorable alley next to the restaurant. The wait was totally worth it. We started with a pitcher of the best orange juice I've ever had and some very strong coffee. We then dived into some stuffed challah French toast and huevos rancheros, the two most popular dishes on the menu. The portions were huge-- you could easily split one entree but try two!! We split everything and it was a great way to have the best of both worlds. 

We didn't come close to finishing, but we tried! Everything was really good. The huevos were full of tender sausage, flavorful sauces, and was mild enough for those afraid of heat to enjoy. The French toast was like a dessert-- the vanilla syrup needs to be bottled and sold. 

I'm gonna leave you with one final thought. When you come-- and you should!-- Get the orange juice. I promise you will love it.

Juanitos has all the attributes that I love in a place. Local, family owned, clean, friendly, fast, efficient, reasonable, fresh, mostly healthy, centrally located and DELICIOUS!
I've been frequenting for several years now and am always impressed with them.
We've tried their caldos (soups), carne asada (grilled flank steak), birria (spiced shredded juicy beef, my personal favorite) and of course burritos (love, love the vegeterian one with it's rice/beans/cheese/lettuce/avocado/cilantro and green salsa combination). 
There is nothing fancy about the decor nor the plating but once you try the food,  you won't really care.  I've noticed that the clientele is getting more and more varied as time goes on and the word gets out on this gem.

This place is great. I love to go there on the weekend (the earlier the better) get a table indoors at the Tap Room (during the day) and then venture out onto the patio as the night begins to cool down. It starts out empty, but after a few hours (and MORE than a few $2 beers) the place is pumping. Lots of music - either classic rock radio (which has yet to play a song I don't like) or any of the live choices. Staff pretty friendly. A cool place to hang out and watch the world go by.

I LOVE Good Friends!!! Easily one of my favorite bars in NOLA - easily!

Our very first night at the bar was kind of a mixed bag - and probably not so great a first impression. We came here looking to find a place to watch some football for the NFL season opener. Was not meant to be. Saints rule the place. So the classification "Sports Bar" is kind of a misnomer. Suggestion to Yelp - devise a new business category - "Saints Bar". Every bar in NOLA should be put under that :o)

So after night 1, we realized this was Not a Sports Bar. And ended up going to an actual Sports bar to watch the game after finishing the first beers that we ordered. But didn't want to not go here because the vibe in the main bar downstairs felt great. AND I am also the kind of person who gives things / people / situations a second chance (ooh thank you Master for the consideration!). Came back the next night and had a blast. Met some fun locals. Made new friends. And the bartenders downstairs - Really make it worth the time spent here. So here are my rankings for the ones I met - starting with the best!

Robert - He is a rock star. Makes a kick ass spicy Bloody Mary and a great dude! 
Michael - a close second - super super super nice guy (and that smile btw?!)
Khrystian (so sure I am spelling it wrong but I know it starts with a K) - next best thing after Rob n Mike. Quite fast, works hard, remembers what guests drink, has the needed sass to put people in their place - LOL. Work it K!
Joseph - yes, K&J are good trouble at the bar together and they probably know it too

Loved the 2nd night so much that we were sure we had to come to the Saints Bar to catch the actual NOLA sports. So was there on time for the Saints kick off last Sunday. And boy does this town know how to celebrate their Saints. I get it. We do the same for our Pats (after all - we are Winners!!). But I have to say NOLA does Saints so much more than any other town I have been to. And clearly this bar takes it to a different level.

* On the house Hot Dogs with Chili and all the fixings during the Saints game!
* Free Shots for everyone for every Saints TD!

I don't think I have ever rooted for any other team other than the Pats the way I was rooting for the Saints last Sunday. Too bad they lost, but for the sake of the locals and tourists alike, I hope the Saints kick some as$ in NFC this season. And anyone and everyone should go to Good Friends to enjoy Saints football.

Other side notes. They play good music videos although the DVDs are rotated and if you spend more than a couple of hours here, or come back the next day at around the same time, you may end up seeing the same loop of songs - rewind and replay! But the crowd is fun. And if the management can do something about videos on demand / requests, that would make this place super stellar. Hey, but nobody is perfect. And for what Good Friends is right now - it is pretty damn good!!

Artmart is my go to place for unique gift items, kid art supplies, and cool wrapping paper and stationery. They also have a fantastic framing dept. I've bought several ready made frames and had some custom things done also, they turned out great! The staff is friendly and very knowledgeable, always willing to help. I also love their pen and journal selection. The entire store is a feast for your eyes, so much to look at its hard not to want to buy it all! Their art supply selection is like none I've seen before, way more than Michaels or Blick. It really is the best and largest art supply store in STL. And I always enjoy supporting a locally owned business. Highly recommend you visit and see for yourself.

In the early 1970's you knew DeGrazia Gallery was on North Swan but it was always a challenge finding the entrance. Back then the only business along that stretch of road was a convenience store. Times have changed. The entrance is well marked and the gallery has expanded. One recent change, after 50 years there is now an admission charge. Personally I think this was long overdue, but people aren't happy about it. Exhibits change throughout the year and you come to appreciate the depth of work created by Ted DeGrazia. When we first moved to Tucson you would often see Ted wandering around and he would happily provide you with an autograph. The grounds are beautiful too. Sadly the chapel was severely damaged in a 2017 fire. Too many unattended candles honoring deceased loved ones. One day it will be rebuilt, but many of the beautiful murals were damaged. This is a must stop to take our out of town visitors. Family membership is only $55 a year and you receive four guest passes. Please consider supporting this Tucson Treasure.

I absolutely, positively ADORE Trader Joe's. This place seriously makes grocery shopping and healthy eating fun. Although their inventory is small compared to most grocery stories, it is mighty and packed with incredible finds. Also there customer service is exceptional. The employees actually seem happy to be there, and I love how they all provided honest feedback and recommendations of various products.. 

During a recent visit I was in search of cheeses for an appetizer cheeseboard I was creating for my upcoming birthday dinner. I wish I could remember her name, but the employee who helped me was beyond helpful and so knowledgeable about cheese. The blue cheese Stilton and bacon cheddar are a MUST try. I can not thank her enough.

This is a place you have to go and just explore. Don't be afraid to try new things.  They seriously have items your couldn't even image. Additionally, they have a nice selection of wine and beer ranging in price. You can pick up a bottle of the infamous "2 buck chuck" to higher end items. 

I couldn't seriously go on and on and on and on about this place, but you simply MUST go and experience it for yourself.

Straight up, some of the best wings in the city. 

When it comes to chicken wings, I'm no fan of the chain restaurants with tiny wings, overly salty sauces and high prices. Jaidyn's Wings truly puts together wings that are rich in flavor, nice in size and not super pricey. You get quality wings for a good price and that's just what I like!

I ordered Jaidyn's for the first time via UberEats a few weeks ago as I was craving chicken wings. I winded up ordering an order of the 10 piece wings with two flavors: lemon pepper and New Orleans Hot. The N.O. hot is similar to a typical hot wing flavor, but with an extra kick! I really liked it as it paired well with the ranch dipping sauce. I also ordered some Cajun ranch fries on the side which were too good!!! Not everyone does these kind of fries well in the city, these were fire though. And of course I had to get a beverage. Since I love tea, I went with the "Nino's Sweet Tea" and it was so so good. Not sure what the special ingredient is in that tea, but I need a whole gallon of it!

I absolutely love this restaurant and everything about it all the way down to the decor the customer service is over the top everyone who I came in contact with was very friendly and helpful if anyone decides to dine here please make sure you get there wings they really are finger licking good for more of my reviews please view my old Yelp Pg Mrs Jackson D.

The Mill is one of my favorite mid-priced restaurants in Downtown St Pete. Both the beef sliders and the Benny were well-seasoned and cooked perfectly. I would highly recommend the sliders!
The atmosphere and food selection is perfect for brunch/lunch, and the decor is fun. I love the lighting and bar setup inside. I will definitely be back for mimosas and brunch soon!
The wait staff was very friendly and checked on us multiple times throughout lunch. Our waiter even brought out a water bowl for our dog while she sat next to us at the table. So thoughtful! 

Service: 5/5
Food: 5/5
Overall: 5/5

The first time I came here, I was a guest attending a Zumba class. I fell in love with Zumba, and just kept on coming back. 

In fact, all the group classes (kickboxing, step, P90X, yoga) are pretty good, but I'm pretty much a member of the gym for Zumba. The regular weekday Zumba instructors, Loretta and Tommy are the best! And Mary Kay's class on Sunday is also a lot of fun. There's a class on Saturdays, but it's at 8AM, and that's just a bit too early on a Saturday. There are a ton regulars, but everyone is in the class is super friendly, which is nice if you're new to Zumba. I would not hesitate to bring newbies to the classes. 

The gym facilities are nice, and there's plenty of treadmills, ellipticals, and bikes, but I'm not a frequent user of the equipment. Also, there are personal trainers and massage therapists, but I have not taken advantages of these added services. 

The staff at the front desk are really friendly, as well as most members of the gym. This is a place where you go to workout and have a little fun doing it, but it's not a scene. Highly recommend this to anyone looking for a good gym in the Carillon area, or a fabulous Zumba class with great instructors and participants. I actually drive 15-20 minutes to attend classes at this facility. Now that is commitment!

On our first visit here, we braced for a wait as it was Saturday morning... but we found a clean booth right away. I really can't believe we've never been here before! Inside is a decent size with lots of tables that seat up to 4, plus a corner booth that seats more people, AND outdoor tables are plentiful. Our waitress was quick & friendly, and our breakfasts were delicious. The menu is so big that we needed extra time to decide! My daughter loved her eggs & French toast, and hubs & I both loved our omelettes. Even though we don't live near Three Coins, I'm sure we'll be back VERY soon.

I'm so glad Coat Check is back! 
I visited several weeks ago for a breakfast sandwich and coffee after volunteering at an event downtown. At that time, I was told the biscuits were being swapped for bagels; today I was told they're going back to biscuits! Having had both I can confirm it doesn't matter; both are excellent! The biscuits are large and the sandwich was filling and super satisfying with the addition of the spicy and sweet jalapeno jelly. I hope bagels return once in a while; I enjoyed the texture and my sandwich incorporated fresh veggies, giving me that smug feeling for having something healthy early in the day.
What I really love at Coat Check are their lattes. Especially the ginger. Drinks like these are a treat for a black coffee kind of gal like myself but if I'm feeling like I deserve one Coat Check is the place. Perfectly balanced, not too sweet and when they return to regular service in ceramic mugs, beautiful foam art. Truly a treat! 
Service is always great here. The staff is friendly, communicate well and are efficient. Don't be put off by a big line; it moves fairly fast.

I have been coming here for over 35 years. I am never disappointed. 

This place has three key favorites
1. Good food - love both breakfast and lunch, my family loves the shrimp & grits. I love a good ol fashion hash with sunny side up eggs.  They ha e great salads for lunch too
2. The friendly staff make you feel so welcome
3. Small quaint little restaurant with red geraniums under the windows. I love sitting on the back porch looking out on the water. 

Come early and always expect to wait a bit.  The wait goes fast

Sometimes I feel like 3 stars is a slight however this one really means a okay. Checked in and each of us for a free wine, which is generous as it is not limited to one per table. The bocci salad is delicious though small. Mussels were good. Bread pudding was more to my husbands liking than mine. The pudding itself was spicy and flavorful (heavy nutmeg and clove taste) with a caramel sauce. Service was nice as is the atmosphere.

If it wasn't for the smoking allowed at the bar and the horrible service I would probably love this bar. The bar actually has three separate bars right by each other all located right on the beach. They've got plenty of seating at the bars or right in the sand and the prices really can't be beat. I won't go into details but I'll just say that it was the worst service at a non-busy bar that I think I've had in years. Still if you're willing to put up with crappy service so you can get a cheap drink on a beautiful beach, Undertow is still a great way to go.

What an excellent and stylish hotel! Amazingly friendly staff, anticipating needs (it's raining, towels set on front desk to dry, it's late coming back from Bourbon street, waters on the front desk, etc). Saying hello and welcoming you back each time you return, excellent doormen and all around great experience. Love the naughty and nice decor, the fun lighting and plush appointments. Very comfortable beds and giant bathrooms! Great bath products and awesome shower pressure. Rooms on the alley can be noisy at night with the city sounds, but not too bad. If sensitive to that request inside room. Also, loved the great Burgundy Bar--music, burlesque dancing and great atmosphere! Wonderful location walkable all throughout Bourbon Street, the waterfront and French quarter. Definitely will return!!

This is our 5th year in a row combing to the nugget rib festival.  We are never disappointed. We arrive on Wednesday and stay through Friday, meet up with all our friends, take in the some of the best ribs, music and drinks. Each day we plan our day, day one golf in the morning, meet at the festival for dinner, relax to music and start over the next day. My husband is always looking for a good beef rib and I am always looking for that perfect sauce. This year the two beef rib Q's are right across from each other ( Desperados and Porky n Beans). Both were cooked perfect.  Then we went over to Porky chicks my ribs were so tender and meaty, the original sauce has just a bit of sweet and tang. Loved it!  I am not a spicy girl, so I can't update you on that. There are always a large amount of crafters to wander through and a kids area as well. Pace yourself, so many choices!!!

This was our first stop of the day Saturday for their newly released Christmas Cherry. My wife loves cherry wines. It was a little floral for my tastes but she loved it. 

I have to admit I underestimated this winery in the years I drove by it I always thought their wines couldn't be that good based on the fact that the grapes grow along side the interstate. However the Indiana grown wine trail forced me to try it out a few months back. They actually do have some really good wines. My two favorite dry reds are the petit Syrah & the Foch. My two favorite sweeter wines are the rhubarb & pleasant view which is a strawberry. We also both really love the cranberry crush. 

All of that being said I do have some serious negatives. This place is always packed. To the point we both have turned around at the door and left. We somehow managed to stop late on a Sunday last time and only a couple others where there. Yesterday being a Saturday was Insane. They need to have more staff and/or another bar. My biggest complaint was that (I think it may have been the owner) stood there talking about the colts instead of serving people. He asked for my first selection 3 times and never even poured it. Finally the lady working the long line at the register and serving samples took pity on me. I paid for 5 samples but gave up after 3 because I was so annoyed. I don't mind so much having to wait to get up to the bar on busy days but being completely ignored while standing at the bar, wine glass sitting empty in front of me does very much send me over the edge.  If I could rate the service separately they would get 1 star.

Delicious po-boys with wonderful portions. The outdoor seating was great with fans to ensure that bugs stay away and you stay cool! I got a half sandwich which was perfect for a normal portion lunch, but when it comes to eating po-boys, too much is never enough! I loved the rich flavor and the chips to go with it. It has such a down-home style feel and really cozy. Will be back!

Laumeier is definitely a St. Louis original - not sure of how many open air sculpture parks exist in the U.S., let alone the world! Not sure how many acres of land Laumeier sits on, but it's a LOT! And I love the fact that they are very "hands off" with letting people roam the grounds. As long as you don't harm the grounds or the pieces of art (OR do something really stupid in front of others), attendees can pretty much do whatever they want here. 

This is a perfect picnic spot in the warmer months, but also a fun place to explore when it's cold. I'm not one to really enjoy physical activity, but hiking around Laumeier is one of my favorite things to do, no matter what time of year. Standing next to the sculptures puts our existence in the world into perspective, too. 

Stopped by here last night for the opening reception to the Art Fair and it's really impressive to see that much land covered with tents, art, and people. It was windy and chilly last night and there were still 500 people there - at least! Hope that even more stop by over the weekend to support this awesome and FREE park in STL!

I ordered the shrimp platter with mild sauce and it was good. Delivery was fast and I would order from them in the future. The shrimp was good and tasty and they were huge. I enjoyed the meal and will tell my friends that love near there to order their seafood from Captain Hooks.

This place was not what I was expecting at all. Anytime there is a fusion place mixed with serving both Thai and sushi, I feel like one might be way better than the other. I was pleasantly surprised and welcomed the change of assumption. 

Service - excellent
Food - we tried sushi and Thai, we loved everything we had and really couldn't have asked for better tasting quality. 
Atmosphere - family friendly or date night
Parking - ample
Pricing - medium range and you get what you pay for

I am so returning! I have no problem making the trek for it and glad to see that they can accommade people with dietary restrictions without issue.

We love Tini!

The first thing you should know about Tini is that there's more to it than meets the eye.  Upon first glance, you see a tiny little neighborhood bar with a great outdoor seating area.  What savvy Tini goers know is that you're only seeing a part of the story.

Tini is actually a double-bar, and the other half of the space is open on weekends and during busy times.  Tini also features a nightclub on it's second level.  If booming bass and high energy are your thing, be sure to check it out.  

Tini is located on Mass Ave, and that same unique Mass Ave energy is more than present within it's walls.  Between the constant visual stimulus on the video screens, and the ever-present music pumping through the sound system, you're sure to bust out a dance move, or two.  The staff are also extra friendly, and the custom cocktails are a delight.  Pop on in and give Tini a try!

Let's just say this is my favorite place to enjoy breakfast/brunch in Bripp. I am a huge fan of "homey" breakfast spots and this does it for me. Love the outdoor seating and vibe of the whole place. Not a mom but when I am at 3 Sisters its a 'Mom" for me. I'm a huge fan of anything with avocado in the menu description and this dish doesn't disappoint. This place fills up- so be prepared to wait if you roll out of bed after a night out too late (definitely been there and done that). But I can honestly say- worth the wait!

Had a $25 gift card for this BYO spot so we decided to give it a try. Purchased the guacamole appetizer which was a small portion. It tasted nice, but i wished it was bigger in size. The appetizer nachos with chicken were the nights hit. These bad boys were piled mile high and loaded with cheese, beans, sour cream and guac. I could have just eaten the nachos, but being the true fatty I am we all ordered tacos too lol. The table had two orders of the al pastor tacos and I got the shrimp tacos. Everyone shared. Overall the tacos were a solid 3.5/5. My only complaint was that the shells were too soft so the tacos kept falling apart. 

I do love that this is a BYO spot. It adds to its charm. Most people order to-go orders. During our time here there was only one other table sitting inside.

Planned an evening out with some friends and we decided to give this place a try. I love wine and all but this place is about 20 minutes away from my home and in a different part of town so I guess maybe this is why I've never given it a shot. We got here on a Wednesday about 7:30. Parking was a joke. I know I can't blame them for it but parking is just a pain. After searching for about 15 minutes I found something up the street. There's a doorman carding you when you walk up. Once you get inside you see nothing but wines and then there's a fridge with cheese on your left and then straight ahead a counter to order. Walking in as an outsider this is a very different experience. We decided to go outside to explore. Once we got outside there's not many tables and lots of humans. It seemed as if all the tables were taken. There was a nice band playing that night . Meanwhile my friends and I were just standing around in confusion. A man that worked there who was sooo nice walked up to us and asked if we needed help. I guess he saw how confused we were. Lol. He explained how we could order wine and food at the front room where we walked in. He then also explained that if we were looking for a table we would have to be like hawks or we could go upstairs where they had indoor seating, and that they served cocktails at the bar . After searching for a table for about 10minutes we gave up and decided to go back to the front. Upon entering there another nice man approached us after he heard me complaining about not finding a table and encouraged us to just try and get a table. So we went back outside to see if anything was available again and still nothing. We threw in the towel and decided to go upstairs. We luckily found 3 chairs at the bar and sat there. They did offer some glasses/bottles of wine but no cheese plate like they do downstairs. I did order some shrimp dip tho! So yummy! The bartenders up there were really nice as well. Overall I'm sad I couldn't really experience the outside atmosphere and get that cheese plate that I had been waiting for but next time I will get there earlier. Everyone was SuPERRRR nice! Great staff from what we encountered! I will be back!

Clesi's is right down the road from us, and somehow I'd never had their food! This was a travesty that had to be righted, and fortunately our friends came over and insisted that we pick up some food to bring back to the house. Clesi's did NOT disappoint, and is now on our list of awesomeness in Mid-City. 

We ordered a ridiculous amount of food (and we had about eight days worth of leftovers). 

1. The Jambalaya Cheese fries - we laughed about this. Then we got serious. Could we really pass them up? The answer - hell no. Take a chance. You may hate yourself later, just a little, but in the moment? You'll be REALLY GLAD. 

2. Catfish Thibodeaux - this was insanely good. Perfectly cooked catfish, and the sides were great, too. 

3. Fried seafood platter - well, the name leaves little to the imagination, and you know what you're in for. Ya'll probably know, though, that some do it well, and others not so much. Clesi's does it well. Shrimps had the heads on! YAAAAAAAS. 

4. House salads - They were salads. But that dressing, though! Good stuff. 

Loved them! Food was perfect, staff was amazing, and we'll be hitting them up again before long.

This is such awesome spot to rent bicycles etc the staff here were all very friendly! What I loved the most was when one brought us a small bowel of water for our dog. How thoughtful of them. This was my first time here to rent. We were a large group and rented quite a few bikes etc and the staff was very patient and helpful with us.

We were here on Friday night for some good music. Black pearl was playing that night and we had great fun. This is my first live music experience(thanks to my friends) and I absolutely loved it! I wish we had been here a little earlier for some drinks. Nevertheless it was a fun night!

The Children's Museum is a great place for kids of all ages. It opened when I was still a kid, and my favorite attraction is still there. 

There is a ring that you can stand in, pull a rope and a bubble forms around you. I loved it when I was a kid and my kid loves it now. 

There are so many things for kids to do. Many of the attractions also help kids learn. 

The grocery store is fun. Kids can shop, work a register, etc. 

There are pulleys, gears and all kinds of mechanical things that kids can manipulate and play with. 

There is a mock street car as well. Everyone knows that kids love the street car. 

Grownups will also have a good time. 

 It is well worth the drive from the suburbs.

I was having a major craving for soup so when the chance to try Minato Noodles came up, I gladly went for it. And I'm glad I did! I really loved it when it was Minato Sushi so I wondered how I would feel about the noodle house. 

We started with karaage and takoyaki. Both were new experiences for me- having lived in Winnemucca most of my life, the most contact I had with foods like these was from watching Bizarre Foods! I was pretty excited about the takoyaki because my kids and I had just recently been talking about it and watching videos of it being made. I didn't realize Minato had them! I'm excited to take my kids in to try them sometime soon. They were pretty good, too. They're just such an interesting dish to me, like savory pancake batter with bits of octopus inside, made into balls and fried, with sauces and bonito flakes on top. I wonder if they flip them as fast as the guys in the videos my kids and I watched. Just remember- the inside of the takoyaki is a temperature comparable to the surface of the sun. Proceed with caution. Oh, the karaage was nice too- crisp outside, tender inside. Basically a Japanese chicken nugget!

I decided on the seafood udon and was very pleased with that. The noodles are wonderful- chewy and flavorful; and there was a good amount of seafood in the soup. The broth though. You guys, THIS is the reason I love Asian soups. There is just so much flavor there! So rich and delicious. I added a little chili oil to give it a bit of a kick. Yum! And the portion was huge- I couldn't finish it all (and trust me, I can put the food away). 

I am excited to go back and try some other things on the menu- like the spicy sesame ramen. That sounds so good and I'm sure we will be going soon, as the kids are eager to try

My husband and I love this place! It's a great place to try variety of beers, listen to great music and of course eat! The chicken wings are some of the best I've ever had! I seriously think unicorns prepare these, because they are magical! The Philly cheesesteak egg rolls are pretty delish also! Must try! The set up is indoor/outdoor so on a beautiful day, it's the ideal place to hang with friends and family! Not much outdoor seating which sucks because St. Pete residents loves their dogs. They are pet friendly, however, if you can get lucky and secure one of the 3 tables (yes, I said 3 tables) out doors then your set.

I had Radiesse and Dysport done by Nurse Practitioner  Carla Cole. She was amazing. I absolutely  loved her.  She was gentle,  and highly informed about the products. 

While I was not treated by Dr. Todd, I did see him on my way out. Also,  extremely  nice! 

Overall,  I loved the personal touch this office offered.  The office did not feel like a derma filler mill where they inject you,  then push you out the door.
 
Ultimate Image's office was very professional,  staff were friendly,  and knowledgeable, and they treat their patients well.  Everyone here truly cares.  They even called me the next day to see how my fillers felt and will touch up your Dysport after 2 weeks if needed.  

I highly recommend  this place.  I will be returning to Ultimate Image when I'm in Clearwater and need some TLC.

1/11/19 - VERY disappointed that they didn't have my favorite sandwich today, chicken and artichoke. 

11/20/18 - So disappointed today. Not one sandwich in the cooler at 11:15 am on 

Once again we are here. Our favorite place. Love our Baristas. Jessica, Treigh, Caleigh, Alex and Taylor. If I've forgotten anyone please forgive me. So many great people work at this location. :) And of co

A dear friend started a no repeat bar and dinner pledge for 2013, so we've been hitting the town hard and venturing outside of our comfort zone for libations with cool atmosphere's. Hotel bars usually aren't our go to unless its on the other side of Broad and we're feeling fancy. We stopped in here Friday night and enjoyed a few cocktails. The lounge itself is busy (obviously with hotel guests, tourists and the like) We created our own "table" and hung out for a bit before deciding to move on to greener pastures. I did enjoy my Philly Love cocktail with vodka, and passionfruit served up in a Champagne flute. Im always slightly annoyed with a bubble-less cocktail comes this way ( presentation is everything). One person ordered food and seemed to enjoy it I would come back its been scratched off the list, but i would recommend it to out of town guests who we're staying near the Lowes.

Love Love LOVE Marshall's! I just recently started shopping here as there are so many of them around where I live. This location is located in the Largo Mall shopping center. It's pretty well organized and everyone that I have had to deal with that works there has been really nice.

I can't say enough great things about this salon. I'm constantly raving about it to my friends. I've never once left unhappy or unsatisfied. They're great at offering beverages upon arrival and I love the "group" color station in the basement. Makes the experience that much more fun.

I've been going to Brenna since July 2014 and she is amazing. I have blonde hair now (as a natural brunette) and she has been able to keep my hair healthy, conditioned, and at the same time she kills the toning for my blonde. 

She helps me maintain a smart head when all I keep saying is "brighter blonde brighter blonde" because she knows it's not that easy.

In a great neighborhood and offers tons of "freebies" while you're in the salon (Foot soak, hand massage, mini facial, etc). All great additions. 

LOVE salon orange moon!

What not to like a slice of their pizza!!! 
I love their thin crust pizza. The toppings are just enough. Their employees are nice and very friendly. I love it when they heat up our orders in the oven. The selection of their beers are awesome. A glass of Beer and a slice of pizza are just a perfect combination of my weekend night out.

I've recently discovered Qdoba and, for fast and relatively cheap fast food Mexican, I'm a fan. You can get a salad in one of those delicious crunchy tortilla bowls (just tack on 465 calories for one of those bad boys) or nix the bowl for a healthy meal. 

There are several options for protein and two different types of veggies (grilled and fajita style). There are many types of salsa. I love options. I love Mexican. I'm loving Qdoba.

Here's hoping I can resist that delicious queso.

I totally love this event. This is the third year I've attended and it just gets better each year (from my point of view). 

Before the races, there's a free group ride, sponsored by CIBA. The courses are marked, you get cue sheets, and you can even download the route from MapMyRide. There's even a SAG stop! I love any excuse to down some Oreos that doesn't involve me bringing that cookie-crack into my house. We did the 35-mile ride this year and had a pretty good time. Essentially we rode up to Zionsville on back roads and back by way of Lafayette Rd. 

The course itself is kind of figure-8 shaped, like 2 squares that are touching corners. There are divisions for men and women, Masters (40-50+ year olds), juniors (under 18), tandems, and various categories of actual racers. Competition is fierce among the pros and it's REALLY exciting to watch them tear around those corners. Don't we need more excuses to throttle cow bells and scream? It's very therapeutic. 

There's live music, there are some vendor booths, there's free yoga, there's a BMX stunt show. 

There are a variety of food trucks plus Sun King drafts. Some exercise, music, a Cream Ale, Tandoori Tacos, Lick Ice Cream...what else do you need to make your Saturday totally awesome? 

There's even free bike parking in a supervised corral! If you hate everything I just mentioned, you're probably weird...so you might just dig watching all the people walk around in spandex. AAAAALLLL SPANDEX!

Love is patient. Love is kind. Love is beer. I love the Beer Store.

Allow me to attempt to condense the reasons why I love this place:

1) the selection: crazy good. There much be nigh 1000 beers in this place, ranging from the quotidian through the sublime. I picked up a bottle of italian beer here bottled in 2008. 

2) the taps - they have a set of 20 some taps in the back where they will pour you beer by the glass or fill growlers. The lineup is constantly changing and has something for everyone. 

3) the format - related to the taps in the back, this place is BYOF (food). You can bring food from any of the neighboring places in and eat at a high top or at the counter, while drinking something from their tap selection. What a good idea!

4) the people - everyone who works here is very nice and knowledgeable. They seem to know just about every beer they have and its location, which is pretty amazing. Also, if you call, they are super friendly and helpful. 

The prices can be a little on the high side sometimes, but I gladly pay the premium to support a local business that gets everything so right. 

It's worth noting that I don't live anywhere near here and I regularly make the trip out. Highly recommend.

Attached to gas station downtown with minimal parking. Interesting place. Most likely will not return which is sad because I love supporting local lil businesses. I ordered chicken and waffles, it was a single soggy waffle but the three chicken wings it was served with were OK. My husband ordered grits and catfish. The catfish was fresh and good however the grits were watered down and runny with a scorch like flavor. When brought to the waitresses attention, she agreed that the grits were "soupy" today.  Idk why in knowing that they would not make another batch.   I found most hole in the wall places to be a fave, however not this one.

ooh i love hummus. i usually get the chicken shawarma platter with the purple cabbage, potato salad, hummus and rice on the side. it's so much food - i always have leftovers afterwards to take home for a midnight snack.

Great place to stop for some good food, good beer, and good conversation.

I have to echo what my friend, Kristi S., wrote in her review. I completely agree that I'm open to giving this place five stars because I have the feeling this place will wow me. Maybe one day I'll look back at this review and think, I was an idiot, but my visit here was a solid four stars, which still makes me a fan!

It was a 30 minute wait for indoor seating on a Saturday night. They definitely double downed on the outside seating, since I would say the size of the indoor seating is the same as the size of the outdoor. I have a huge fear of mosquitos (hey we live in Florida!) so the day I decide I'm ok with getting Zika is the day I'll sit outside in the summer. (If I know I will have to sit outside I will bathe in bug spray and everyone dining with me has to deal with the smell.) Luckily, there is a long communal table that is first come first serve, so I didn't have to sit outside (which is also first come first serve) or wait the thirty minutes. 

My friend and I both went with the flight of four beers, deciding to share. This means we got to try a total of eight beers. We're dark beer drinkers, so this means we tried every porter/stout/brown ale they had on their menu (and then had to pull a couple non-dark beers to hit our eight). Honestly, I enjoyed them all. Some of the beers are seasonal and tbh, when I do beer flights unless the beer name is written down in front of me, I can't keep them straight. You'll have to come and try them yourself.

I got the Beer B Q Turkey Burger. Maybe this is my fault, since it is in the name, but I wasn't a fan of the beer b q sauce. I found it overwhelming. It also came with fried jalapenos which I picked out (I am not a spice person). The bun was perfectly buttered. I honestly planned to just pick at the bun, but I ate the whole thing! If you're on a diet and think you have willpower, you're wrong and should just order it without the bun. I got the cheesy mashed potatoes as my side and man they were cheesy! I loved it. 

I had serious food envy as I watched other plates pass by me. The calzones were ginormous! Seriously, that could feed a family. The pretzels looked huge as well! That's an entree size and then some. They don't skimp on portions here.

I definitely enjoyed this place. I'm a fan!

Let me start out by saying that I will definitely be coming back to The Shake Seafood! The food was BOMB! AMAZING! DELICIOUS! TASTY! 

My friend had been craving like a seafood boil and so we researched places in Philadelphia and this place seemed to best fit what we were looking for.

Much to our surprise, this place not only met..but exceed our expectations! We both got a combination with the snow crab legs and shrimp. Each combo comes with corn on the cob and/or potatoes. I love how you have the option to pick. I added 1/2 lb sausage in mines for about $5 and my friend added crawfish in her's. You get to choose from 3 different seasonings:cajun, garlic butter, & lemon pepper. Or you can combine all three for the shake house blend. I decided to go with the house blend. And since I was unsure of their spice level, I chose medium.

We came on a Saturday evening around 5:30ish and the wait was about an hour. The restaurant is not big at all so I can see how the wait was so long, but thankfully it's in a shopping plaza where you have a plethora of stores to walk around and kill time. Parking was not much of an issue considering it is in a strip mall.

We did not have any issues with service during our visit. Our server was very tentative and also other staff members. 

If you're in the north Philly area and want a good seafood boil, try The Shake Seafood.

This place is a gem! They're definitely gonna have me in for lunch every day! I love how you get a checklist and can fill out what you want versus having to go down a long menu. Makes it easier for both! Their sushi burritos are to die for, and I feel fresh and light whenever I eat here! Everyone is really nice! The black man working here has such a great energy I love his vibe! But everyone is great! It's right next to my job! 

Only down side (which isn't their fault just a heads up) is the area. There's always random homeless people wandering the parking lot, and today a woman came in right up to a table of people. Immediately and politely he came up to her and spoke to her about it. I love how he was respectful to both the table and the homeless woman versus being rude to her, as despite being homeless she's a person too. He respected her by pulling her outside to quietly speak with her. 

This place is amazing! I apologize in advance because I'm going to be here every day

Friendly service, great vibe, AMAZING local beer selection. Loved my Gouda, bacon, Dijon, and apple grilled cheese. I was worried the apple would be too sweet and that the bread was too grilled but it all paired excellently with the internal flavor punch. The Mac wasn't that good. They offer all natural non alcoholic beverages including Mexican Coca-Cola.

Stopped in to get some donuts for hubby's birthday late morning on a Friday.  This is a nice size place and a nice addition to Carrollwood.  A non-chain donut and restaurant shop that serves breakfast and lunch type foods. 

I don't frequent the chain donut places as I'm more into healthy eating, but will splurge on occasions.  

The donuts were very yummy and they offer the usual and not so usual. Cereal crusted and bacon topped is not my thing but I liked the boston cream. They have unique Sammy's of grilled cheese on a donut. And burgers on a donut. Not my idea of good eats but I'm sure there is a market for these state fair type of foods. 

The display case of donuts could use revamping as they have different prices for specialty and not clearly marked as to what is special as opposed to regular but I'm sure they will work out the kinks of that eventually. Also ordered a dozen and ended up short one so will check next time before getting home. 

Hubby loves the huge cinnamon roll and grandson loves the apple fritter. Both are humongous and can be shared easily.
