I was waiting to eat my dinner until he got his, and in the middle of his sentence, telling me to continue with mine so it doesn't get cold, his arrived.  Less than two minutes later.  I was convinced they had just stirred it and brought him the same plate, since the pasta in this one was just as overdone,

We alerted our server again, who got the manager.  Before she even spoke we knew she was pissed about having to deal with us.  She informed us this is just the way they make pasta, every restaurant does this, and this is what they do.  No apology, no admitting it was over done...and while there are a ton of places that practice this, I have had better cooked pasta at Applebee's.  Gabe showed her how he could, without moving the penne noodle at all, slice it open with his fork, and when he tried to scoop one up with his fork, it disintegrated.  After a little bit of back and forth, she offered to get him something else.  He got the lemon pepper chicken.

The chicken came out in the same amount of time as the second pasta dish.  Under two minutes.  So, this place MAY be made from scratch, but it is made from scratch and then tossed into a steam tray to sit for God knows how long until someone orders it.

Our server came up to us, said he assumed we didn't want dessert (we did, actually, but his comment made us both feel like he just wanted us gone), and he brought us our check.  No offer for a to go dessert, no discount on Gabe's meal, which had to be sent back twice and then he ended up ordering something he didn't really want to begin with, nothing.

Cheddar's may be good some day.  And maybe some day I will try it again.  But for the forseeable future, I won't be back, and I certainly won't be recommending it to anyone.

Meh... I love Stephen Starr restaurants but lunch here was just plain meh.  I will say the appetizer of the fried potato sticks with Chinese hot mustard was outstanding.  The burger was just so-so, not very flavorful served with shoe string fries.

Initially felt the price for a trim was a little high but you get what you pay for! I will definitely return. Stylists and other staff are friendly and prompt! Great service and love the additional services like scalp massage, mini facial or hand massage with a haircut. Heather is great. Love that she followed my lead if I talked she conversed but I also enjoyed a relaxing shampoo

Love this shop! April was adorable and super friendly and helpful!!! The prices were surprisingly reasonable and their selection was beautiful! I went home and told my fiancé to get me flowers from there the next time! I'll definitely be coming back.

This restaurant is definitely a hidden gem! It is located in a small strip mall so I was very hesitant to try it out. I could not be happier that I did! The first time trying them out I sat down and my waitress was very helpful with explaining what certain meals were to what wine to choose with them! I ordered the sweet and sour pork my first time and loved it. I couldn't wait to go back!

You must try the Drunken Noodles - hot. I don't know what heaven tastes like but I assume this is it. You can order it with chicken (my favorite), shrimp, or steak. They give you huge shrimp and a decent amount when you order it. We order from here weekly and they are very consistent. You get large portions for what you pay, they are always welcoming, very nice atmosphere. 
I would recommend this hidden treasure to any visiting Port Richey.

Beer. Cheese. Pretzels.

Yum.

I went here last weekend to enjoy some inexpensive adult beverages and to watch some soccer.  Great digs!  I loved the clean, welcoming atmosphere and the delicious selection of beers.  If you have Sweetwater and New Belgium on tap, you're alright in my book.  Did you say 24oz Sweetwater IPA and Fat Tire for something like $3.25 a piece?  Oh, you did.  Good.  Perfect.

Their pretzels were obnoxiously delicious, because I think I ate my weight in them.  And then I dipped them in the Yazoo ale beer cheese and nearly died of happiness.  So good!

The bartender was awesome.  He introduced himself, smiled a lot, and was friendly to everyone (even to the girl who ordered O'Douls).

East Nashville is full of fun, little surprises - this being one of them! I will definitely take the trip back here to fill up on those delicious pretzels and cheese! Oh, and of course for the tasty brew.  Afterall, it is a beer garden.

Let me begin by saying we generally love Jimmy John's. We recently moved, and we used to frequent the Jimmy John's on Southport Road, which had great service (despite being inexplicably edged out of their delivery area), great food, and a friendly staff. This Jimmy John's? Not so much. Most of the workers don't care when you walk in the door and are far from friendly. The sandwiches are sub par, as well. The tuna has made me sick, and I've had my unwich served on browning, wilted lettuce before. It was gross. I much prefer the time their produce truck hadn't shown up and I couldn't get an unwich at all. Tell me that rather than give me rotting lettuce next time, thanks. Today was the icing on the cake. I ordered delivery for the first time---I was home with the kids, we ran out of lunch fixings, and it seemed like it would be fast. It took almost an HOUR for the sandwiches to arrive from the time the order was confirmed. That is neither freaky nor fast, considering I could have walked there and back in under an hour. I need to just stop going to this Jimmy John's and try to preserve some semblance of respect for the chain.

Terrific little European deli/market just north of 116th on Allisonville.  I planned to pop into Mark Pi's next door for noodles but saw Blue Danube here...had assumed (for whatever reason) it was further south on Allisonville and thought I would give it a shot.

I was greeted warmly by Tatiana (who is one of the co-owners and is Bulgarian) and I told her I had bookmarked Yelp some time ago and was here for something to eat!  She pointed out the sandwiches along with several savory items that had just come out of the oven...she gave me a sample of a very good savory pastry and told me a bit about it's origin.

The store has a wide variety of Eastern European fare, canned or otherwise.  Really a unique selection of goods.  Various noodles, vegetables, and a lot of stuff with labels I cannot read.

For lunch I decided to go with a Dracula sandwich (she sort of snickered at the name since it was her business partner's idea...who is Romanian..get it?) and it was a very tasty combo of Romanian salami, Italian bologna, and a spicy Hungarian ketchup served on a baguette.

Sandwiches are sold by the pound (I think it was $6.89#) so my kick ass sandwich was under $5.  Take that Subway!  I also had a warm apple rose which was a flaky and sweet miniature apple pie that was fresh from the oven.  Delicious.

I loved the place so much that I walked out with a stick of European salami, a loaf of fresh bread, and a bottle of Bulgarian wine.  So $30 later is where I ended up all said and done.

But so worth it.  Great customer service and terrific ethnic food will bring me here again.

I'm a crafter.  I go to Michael's for scrapbooking supplies, frames, silk flowers, and random supplies for whatever random project I happen to be working on.

I love that there are always coupons available!  A definite plus!

BUT - the store is always a mess!  Stuff is all over the place, you can't tell how much things are because they're spread out over several tags.  AND - they are always out of stuff!  I went in today for scrapbook page sleeves.  There was not a single package!  And no employees to be found to see if there was another location where I could find some.  

They still get three stars because they attempt to have the best selection of crafting supplies in Reno (IMO) and their prices are definitely the best.  I just wish they could do a little work on the sales floor to improve their in-stock and make it a little easier to find things so I can buy them!

What can be be said that hasn't been said? This place is great for carnivores and vegans alike and it's good to have a place we can sit at the same table.

The vegan food is good, some better than others, but my husband enjoyed the meat bbq but he didn't love having to add his own bbq sauce. The sauce was delicious according to him though. 

A bit pricey but for the chance to have a place everyone can eat it's not bad, and their sweet tea was fantastic!

I can't ever put my finger on why I don't love Fork. The food is always good. The atmosphere is nice enough. I love the building. The service is fine. But it always feels like everything there is a little tired, and I can't figure it out. I just want...more from Fork. Shrug.

Before i got a car, I spent more in a year on PCS than the cost of my car.

That is sort of a complaint about the prices but also a way of saying that I like them so much that I used them A LOT.

My car is currently dead and i am seriously considering switching back to PCS.

Let me put it this way: ~$200 a month for car share sounds like a lot until you own a car, then it sounds like a dream where your rolling in all the money you've saved.

FYI: Use PCS instead of Zip Car whenever possible. PCS is an nfp and is interested ONLY in helping our community/environment/city/QOL. In contrast, Zip Car is primarily concerned with profit with those other goals second. I think Zip car has a place in Phila and other cities: in cities without an NFP service, Zip Car is better than nothing. In cities with an NFP that runs as well as PCS, Zip Car should be used an overflow option: when it is not possible for PCS to keep up with a peak in demand, then Zip Car should be there to step in and offer an alternative at a premium.

Thanks PCS.

Note: if I could change one thing (and they may have added this in the last year) I would add the ability to use a PCS account and fob in other cities. I make it home to Emeryville 3-4 times a year and would love to use my PCS account on City Car Share.

I am definitely a fan of the Schlafly Tap Room.  I love sitting at the bar and trying their lesser known beers.  I also LOVE their mussels and frites menu. The curry mussels are my absolute favorite, but the others are delicious too.  

I have always had good service, whether it be at the bar or at a table.  I have also been to concerts and it is a great space for it. 

According to the other reviews I need to try the sticky toffee pudding, which I plan to do soon and I will report back! :)

WELCOME ASSEMBLY FOOD HALL!!
I have watched the construction on this site, directly across from the Bridgestone Arena, for yearsssss..... and as mama always said, some things are worth the wait!
I attended the Grand Opening today of many of the shops and restaurants and I am beyond excited.  This offers our downtown visitors and locals so many options they have not had until this point.  Fresh and local food choices all in one place .. that don't require a reservation.. and that aren't tied to a honkey tonk! The options are so much healthier too for this part of town.  The space also has some very noteworthy out of town brands that fit in very nicely with the landscape they have created here.
They have made every effort to offer diverse offerings, while not sacrificing quality.  I love that there are two bars in the middle of the space... because.. you are in Nashville, after all. 
I opted for some Pad Thai from Thai Essane, a poke bowl for my daughter, 6 donut box from Donut Distillery and a pizza to go from DeSano's.  Nailed it.  
This will be a great stop before and after shows at the Ryman, Bridgestone, Schermerhorn.. you name it.  Never mind a spot to casually swing by and feed your needs.
Parking is paid.  But there is a lot of it.  I paid $6 for one hour and it was an easy elevator ride to the heart of it all.

Total tourist trap.... loved it. Especially since there are places upstairs where you can smoke. How awesome is that? 

Place was rockin pretty hard when we got there on a Saturday night. Saw a kid jump up on the bar and start dancing.... couple guys popped out of the shadows and whisked him out the back before you could blink. Place didn't skip a beat. 

Pulled pork in the nachos... awesome. Chx wings "had some stank on em" according to my counterpart from Kentucky. (That means spicy in a good way apparently) Spicy BBQ sauce had nice heat to it as well. So much food I was able to share with the table, still didn't finish everything. 

Pretty good place to hang out.

This place is just lovely! Very quintessential upscale New Orleans with the exposed brick, ceiling to floor curtains, lush green ivy dangling from above, chandeliers, top notch service and the perfect location in Jackson Square. 

I ordered from their fixed priced menu, which is an absolute steal! The bayoubaise was huge and delicious, perfect for a seafood lover. The flourless chocolate cake was the perfect way to end the meal. Unfortunately the gorgonzola cheese cake was a complete miss; there was something about the flavor and texture that were completely off for me; would not recommend. My husband devoured his turtle soup and duck, which I take as signs of approval. From the few bites I was able to swindle, I could tell he ate quickly to minimize sharing with me. 

Overall, it was a really fantastic dining experience. I often assume that food in the French Quarter will be awful and overpriced due the tourist traps but Muriel's was exceptional.

This place is usually one of our favorite places to dine ... But I felt disappointed dining here with my family tonight . 
Usually the cocktails on the menu seem diverse and usually I sit there contemplating which one I would choose but I felt that the menu had no cocktails that stood out . I ordered a stoli dirty martini which is my go to if I don't find anything to drink . My husband found nothing as well and just ordered a mint julep cause he really didn't know what to get either . 
The food was average , nothing stood out . I ordered the cioppino stew which was okay . The broth was super rich and thick . The broth could of been a little bit more thinned out .  My husband ordered the seared diver scallops ... One noted . He stated that they needed some kind of sauce or texture to the dish .  My daughter got a bland chicken breast with kale . The waitress  should've let me know what the seasonal veggie was otherwise I wouldn't have ordered it . My two year old couldn't eat the vegetables . The creme brûlée was ok , but the waitress didn't let us know it was a banana custard . My husband was unhappy about the waitress  not letting him know it was a flavored Brûlée . My chocolate mousse was more of a fudge . It was tasty but the waitress seemed a little on edge asking the kitchen if I can have non alcoholic whipped cream ( I was sharing my dessert with my daughter ) 
Overall 2 stars . Very disappointed cause i used to love the food here .

Of the 4 family-owned Thai restaurants in this 4-block span of the U. City Loop, Thai Country Cafe is my favorite.  The menu doesn't really vary much from Thai Cafe or Thai Gai-Yang, but the execution, I think, is above the rest.

This was the place that I discovered my love of Thai food, so I try to come back whenever I'm back in St. Louis for a visit.  The prices are so cheap, it makes me do a double-take every time.

I always go for the Thai egg rolls and the corn cakes as appetizers.  They can't be beat.  And the pad thai here is probably the best I've ever had.  And it's the standard that I compare all other pad thai to whenever I have it around the country.

The only time I've ever had to wait for a table was when a whole dorm of Wash U freshman decided they all wanted to eat Thai food.  Aside from that, there's always room at Thai Country Cafe.  I've turned a bunch of friends on to the delicious food that it brings & they drive in from West County to eat here.  And it's definitely worth it!

This place is super fun. If you love ice cream - like homemade with exotic and creative flavors - this place is not for you.  They have only soft serve but lots of fun ways to eat it and a flavor of the day.  Today they had Trix, but I opted for something a bit safer. I got the Nutella milkshake. It did not disappoint. How could Nutella go wrong? It can't.  Fun and would go in again if I am in the area. Plus I was in love with the Golden Girls decor.

Lordy Mercy I do love me some Thunderbird!

Feel like some good southern comfort food but... Well... Fancier? You need look no further than Fountain Square. This relatively new restaurant has brought the south right here to Indy. Grits, fried chicken, succotash, and greens... What more do you need?! 

But in all seriousness... Let's talk about that pickle brined chicken. Hot damn. The BEST fried chicken I've ever had. No... I'm not just saying that. It's seriously like the most crunchiest, most tastiest, most did-a-pickle-just-sneak-into-my-mouth-with-my-fried chicken, most (dare I say the most hated word) MOIST chicken I've ever had. And if you're wondering, yeah, I did use double superlatives to describe how good this chicken is in your mouth. Deal with it. 

I could continue on my rampage of fried chicken love but I wanna talk drinks. EXCELLENT bar tenders who know their way around a shaker. Pleeeenty of local beer choices as well. 

But, no trip to the Bird would be complete without beignets. Tasty little fried donuts and their crunchy outside and pillowy doughboy tummy insides. And dat apple butter... Mmmm. And for $4?! Hello bargain. As if I didn't need another reason to rationalize getting them every single time I go, they had to go and make it affordable. Now I'm definitely defenseless against them. Thanks ThundyBird. 

In conclusion, T-bird is one of my favorite foodie joints and continues to please my inner southern belle.

Nice little diner with friendly service. 

I went with a group of coworkers for lunch. Most got the quiche and loved the Mediterranean quiche (it has tomato, onion and olives) .  I couldn't resist the Benedict menu. I had florentine style, which happens to include 3 pieces of crispy bacon.  It was a little salty, probably from the bacon. I wish there was a little more hollandaise. 

Prices were very reasonable for the amount of food.

This review is long overdue for work we had done in October. We needed a contractor to turn a large bedroom into 2 smaller bedrooms for our kids. We needed framing, sheetrock, electrical, trim and closets built. Joe was way more responsive than all other contractors and was very reasonable with costs. The price was exactly what he quoted us.  (Another contractor was supposed to start before we found Joe and completely ghosted us around the start date.) 

Lou was the main guy who was here several days and he was great. We felt totally comfortable with him in our home. Our 4 year old son kept asking where Lou was after the project was completed. Lou worked around us when it came to hours that worked best for our family. Our kids love their bedrooms. And our 4 year old son finally sleeps in his own bed. We will be calling Joe when we are ready to remodel our kitchen and bathrooms.

This is where the University of Michigan and West Virginia University (along with others) alumni officially meet to watch games.  Therefore, on days that certain teams are playing, this place will be completely packed!

I love this places nachos.  They are huge and fully loaded with everything you want on nachos.  Their wings are good also.  Honestly, all the food here is fine for bar food.  The real reason you come here is for the atmosphere.  

Usually they have two college alumni groups here at the same time.  One is in half of the bar and the other is on the other side.  This makes sure that on weekends this place is packed to almost standing room only on college football (and basketball) weekends.  

Parking here can be difficult.  The Beef O' Brady's parking lot fills up really fast and you end up having to park on the street.  Sometimes the Salvation Army opens up its parking lot to patrons.  I'm always wary of parking on the street, because I don't want to be towed, but it seems pretty safe here.

This is a great place to grab a beer and relive your college days with people of all ages.

I was extremely impressed with this place! I love that they are working out the kinks by offering free entrees with a drink their first weekend open. The food quality was great! It is literally exactly like a chipotle of Indian food. There are multiple options for how you want your dish. I opted for the rice bowl but my friend got the tacos. I like how with the tacos you can get 2 different proteins sauces etc and they did let me do that as well with the bowl, it just gets a little more mixed together in the bowl. The 1 complaint she had with the tacos is the naan bread was a little too hard to fold and hold together in a taco shape, maybe steam the bread a little first? I really loved what I got, chicken tikka and paneer however I would like to see more education on what all the items taste like (proteins and sauces). Though the worker explained it would still be nice to see something written out. The restaurant was nice inside however it did get very warm with the big windows and the sun shining in, we actually left quickly because it got uncomfortably hot. Add some shades and an educational menu and it will be top notch! I'll definitely be back!

I love this place when i lived in Santa Barbara. Seeing this at the airport after my flight delayed made me very happy because i haven't had ref mango in a long time. They have delicious flavors and they topping are always delicious. The mango that I put on my yogurt last night was good that I  was a little sad I didn't put more.

I've never met the barber here, but the staff is awesome! I happened to stumble upon Art of Shaving when I was looking for Macy's right before Father's Day, and I couldn't resist stopping in. Straight razors, straps, badger brushes, shaving mugs....I LOVE this place. Nikki was nice enough to talk shop with me this particular Sunday, gave me a full walk-through of the shop, explained everything they offered, and passed along a few free samples of their pre-shave products. Will definitely be back when I need to my stash.

This is a little bar. It's a divey bar. It's a cheap bar. I like it. Maybe I love it and I don't quite know it.  I'll be honest I've walked past this place many a time, it's was always bustling with activity and busy.  On this fine night, friends and I had a lovely dinner around the corner at Couvant (delicious and fancy).  The night was clearly not over, so instead of heading to the bar at the Eliza Jane(it was quite full with conference peeps) we meandered to the Little Bar.
It's a deep little bar and the bar was full of characters on this fine night.  We found ourselves setting up at a table on the side that seem to suite our needs quite well.  We enjoyed local beer and proper bar cocktails.  I'm not sure who chose the music but I could sing along to most all the songs.  A little ruckus happened at the bar and the bartender quickly ejected said varmint and the festivities continued without skipping a beat.  From the varied patrons attire, I assume this is definitely a local for service industry folk whom are ready to slug a few back after their shifts.
I'll be back for sure and you should give it a go too.  We left a nice tip for the Bartender and I thought he might jump over the bar and give the Pirate a hug.
Yeah we'll be back for certain.

I just love this!!! A bit confusing at first if your first visit--- but basically you choose your flavor then up to 2 toppings. My daughter usually gets the Cookie Master ( which is basically cookies and cream) with an Oreo and m&m's as her toppings. I've also had the Monkey Lover (vanilla ice cream with bananas chopped up in it) --- this is by far my favorite!  Once you order them you can go watch the ice cream chefs roll the ice cream. Really cool to watch!! And once it's done, the presentation in you bowl is just beautiful!  It's $5.95 for a good size portion. You get like 7 rolls in your bowl, along with 2 toppings of your choice. 

They also have bubble tea and crepes. The bubble tea is served it cute light bulb looking cups that you can keep. Not a fan of the bubble tea however. Too sweet.
Cute, rando place. I'd love to see a show here!

Visited Jaco on a Sunday afternoon with a friend and was pleasantly surprised! The place has expanded since my last visit and now has a full dining room in addition to their bar. 

The atmosphere is open, clean, and cutely decorated. The service is quick and friendly. They have a pretty large menu of breakfast burrito options, tacos and burritos, as well as my favorite, fresh juices and smoothies! We especially loved the carnitas tacos and the chicken street tacos. The flavors are delicious and their meats are some of the highest quality I have had in tacos.

Overall, great for smoothies, juices, smoothies, and tacos. Eat in or take to go!

My family has been flying in and out of the Tucson airport for over 20 years.  A very decent, easily negotiable airport.  

We love that parking for those picking us up is close and easy to get in and out of.  The parking fee isn't too bad either.  

Wait time for luggage is typically average.

It is nice that the rental car counters are on site but it is a bit of a walk to get to them.  Once at the rental car area, access to the vehicles is quick and easy.  Pick up and drop off of the cars is easily navigated.  

I do wish that they had a Starbucks in the terminal.  The food offerings have changed many times over the years and on our most recent visit here looks like they are revising again.  

Getting through security is on the slowish side so make sure to allow enough time.

The first time that I sampled Malaysian food was at this restaurant, and now I am a fan of this cuisine for life! Rasa Sayang is a very conveniently located restaurant in Wilmington, and offers a fun and lively atmosphere to dine in. There is a happy hour offering discounts on select drinks at their in-house bar, as well as on some appetizer items. Speaking of appetizers, I highly recommend the roti canai, which is a warm and fluffy pancake-like appetizer served with a side of delicious chicken curry. After trying roti canai at other places and a failed attempt of making it at home, I have grown to really appreciate the skill required to make Rasa Sayang's amazing roti canai. It was so delicious that we promptly returned the following day to dine at this restaurant again! We also tried the roti telur, which was a bit more filling than the roti canai, however not as satisfying. Apart from the appetizers, they also had some notable main course dishes. We tried the noodle dishes (chay koay teow and mee goreng), which were very flavorful and came in extremely generous portions! This restaurant is a rare gem for asian food lovers, in a location that offers extremely limited selection of asian eats.

I thought this was an enjoyable breakfast spot. The prices are wonderful. The service was without issue. Everything tasted fresh and I liked having a mom and pop venue that isn't a greasy spoon type. I loved the option to sit outside and enjoy my neighborhood while eating. I wish they were open more hours and expanded to dinner due to their convenient location. They could also benefit from some specials and more unique options, in a big fan of breakfast places that feature things like stuffed French toast, so this isn't my first choice. I opted for an omelette here, it's a great options none the less.

I love this Dunkin' so much! I come here every Tues and Thurs morning around 7:15 and order the exact same thing- large cold brew, no ice, vanilla and cinnamon shot. I also usually get the Power Breakfast Sandwich, which is turkey sausage, a veggie egg omelet, and cheese all on a multigrain sandwich bread. It's filling and tasty!

Did you know about their flavor shots? They're an essence that they put in your coffee that has zero sugar (or artificial sweetener) and tons of flavor. It's like if you were to order the hazelnut coffee at Bread Co, same concept. There are several flavors and my go-to in the winter is the vanilla and cinnamon since it reminds me of a holiday drink! Great option for people who like additional flavor but don't want the sugar rush from the syrups.

Onto the staff. I've only ever had super positive interactions here. I typically interact with ladies when ordering and men when I get my food (this seems to be typical staffing trend at quick service places), but everyone is so friendly, warm, and kind. It's my favorite way to start my day when I go into the office since I WFH other days. I proudly call Tues and Thurs my 'Dunkin Days', they always start my day off sunny!!

What an awesome experience! You have to check this place out!!! They have only been open for a day. The parking is super easy.. lots of room, big chairs and 21 and over ONLY..WHOOP WHOOP!! Just sayin, sometimes peeps need a break from the kiddos, right ladies?!? 

This place is amazing.... plenty of vegetarian, vegan and GF options, which accommodates EVERYONE! I stinking love that. 

There is no gaming, which I love even more... and they have a nice big bar, Craft cocktails and amazing flavor combinations. That's THREE amazing's in a ROW!!! They even have a create your own charcuterie and/or desert plate PEOPLE!! It's very easy to understand and will, without a doubt, please your entire group. 

They are not dinner taking reservations as of yet, ( they are for private parties ) and don't have a happy hour ( I hope that is coming soon ) but regardless we will be back again and again. 

Overall our experience was excellent! From being sat to getting our food, it was about 20 min. Most of the staff hadn't even worked a full day yet, so BIG Koodos for knocking it out of the park folks! 

Overall, fantastic job !!! ... I'll defiantly be a regular here :)

New favorite brunch spot!  I love the elective and inventive menu!  The place fills up fast, but we were lucky to snag one of the last spots at 9:15 a.m. on a Saturday morning.  I ordered the chilaquiles.  They had an interesting take, doing theirs more casserole style.  I was disappointed when it came out because the dish looked so small.  However, it was really filling!  

Service was fine, nothing special.  To be fair, service was pretty good, but after going to their amazing downtown Indy location, I was not as impressed with service here.  I was pleased they did not try to stuff our party of five into a small table.  They gave us a roomy round table meant for six people.  

My one complaint was that I ordered my scrambled eggs well done.  They came out perfectly fluffy and yellow.  This is fine for a person who likes their eggs that way, but I like mine burnt and brown.  I'm not sure if our server didn't know what I meant by "well done" or if the kitchen didn't cook them the way she told them to, but it was disappointing.

Love this place for a quick meal during work. Even though it's vegan, the meat seriously takes like real meat. My 2 favorite are the Philly cheese steak and the crispy ranch chicken sandwich. Don't forget to add a banana whip to your order. It is amazing!

Visited twice in a week n loved everything that I had here. Drinks are strong and tasty.
Food's really yum. I like their Lemon pepper wings which I seldom find in other restaurants' menu.
Shrimp tacos had some real tasty spicy shrimp, and even coconut shrimp had a subtle coconut enjoyable flavor. Looks like I've discovered a new favorite in the area!!

I have been a couple of more times since my initial review........ since then I have had their octopus and seaweed salad which are both great... and more ramen.. a lot more ramen haha thank god for consistency because I really love their ramen.

Had a wonderful experience at The Love this past Monday evening. The Love is so homey and romantic I can't wait to go back.

I made reservations on OpenTable for 6:30 for my birthday with my parents and hubby. We were seated right away and my table request was fulfilled as well. Our waiter was prompt and everything you would expect for a Steven Starr Resteraunt. The space is fairly small. I believe I read there are only one hundred seats available including the bar area. But the space definitely works. Although small it feels very open. The Love is filled with booths, half booths, and whicker chairs.

Let's talk cocktails: 
They had roughly nine cocktails on the menu and I probably could have drank any of them. I went with the Broken Arrow. A tequila drink w/ pear purée and agave. It was really great. Almost refreshing in a way that margaritas can lack. My husband went with 'A Very Good Bourbon Drink' he enjoyed as well. Definitely would like to try the 'A Mule With No Name' next visit. 

For starters our table shared the mushroom toast and the farm salad. The mushroom toast was delish, but the real winner was the salad. Also was not expecting the salad to be as big as it was.. definitely shareable if you're not making it your entree! - I will say the only thing that jumped out to me on the "A Real Meal" list was the Provençal Scallops. Other entrees ordered were the Maple Salmon and the Lovebird. My husband LOVED the LOVEbird but it was a heaping amount of soul food leaving him in a food coma. My scallops were perfect. Can't recommend them enough. I tried really hard not to order desert, but as soon as I saw they had a Dirt Sundae I folded. When deserts were brought out they also brought out a plate saying happy birthday with some small deserts. Very sweet! 

Highly recommend for a birthday and/or date night. Go for the cocktails and when in doubt always order desert.

The people in here were so friendly and accommodating.  The food was fresh and I loved the grilled chicken on the tostones.  and they have Heineken dark lager (I didn't even know that existed!?). So many appealing menu items I can't wait to try them all!

Hear me out, it's 12am on a Wednesday night and you're starving, everything else in Philly is basically closed unless you want junk food like pizza or Philly cheesesteaks; but you've been eating junk lately and want a quality meal. This is when you go here to order a healthy, Japanese style meal! It's open till 2am and makes it so convenient! We got a chicken teriyaki bento box and were surprised with the tempura and veggies and pieces of sushi included, as well as a miso soup! I love miso! And we also got a steak hibachi meal that gave a nice serving of steak, delicious sauce, and healthy veggies and fried rice. Got a jasmine milk tea 30% sweetness and everything just hit the right spot! Exactly what I wanted after a long day at an amusement park and arriving home late without desire to eat any more junk food! Love it definitely coming back!

I stopped in here for a nice brunch before starting the day. We ordered a lime daiquiri, a small gumbo cup and a creole combination, as well as the soup of the day - corn and crawfish chowder - which was gone before I could even snap a photo.

The chowder was AMAZING. I don't know how they managed to get charred flavor into the soup, but it was so so delicious. I might be especially partial to this because I love my soups with corn, but my boyfriend loved this too!

We got the creole combination to try just a little bit of everything. The red shrimp creole was a tomato-based dish, it wasn't too epic on its own but was a nice complement to the others. The jambalaya was the highlight for me - moist and extremely tasty. We also got a cup of gumbo that was interesting - I haven't had this in a long time (had it once really long ago in a ransom seafood boil restaurant) so it was a rather new taste/texture to me. It wasn't my favorite dish of the day, but it wasn't bad!

Also, pretty good prices for the area. :)

If you're a true coffee lover, this is the place for you! Personally, I like to have a little bit of a variety when I go to coffee places. Sometimes, I'm feeling tea and other days I'm feeling coffee. If you haven't figured out already, I'm not the hugest coffee fanatic; I mainly enjoy going to hipster coffee places like these to enjoy the ambiance and the serenity of the place. 

The menu is pretty limited, but the coffee beans are on point! They get their coffee beans from a number of places in South America and they are available for purchase. They have indoor and outdoor seating and I love how the cafe is designed! The interior is different in colors from the outside, with the outside being more colorful with their colored chairs. 

The location is a little bit aways from State St, which is preferred if you are looking for a quieter location to read a book or to enjoy a first date :) 

Prices are standard for a coffee place in Downtown SB. I ordered a cold brew and the quality of the coffee was amazing. They also use some high quality organic milk! Baristas are friendly and there to help you decide if you're super indecisive like I.

INCUBUS!!!!!!

My all time favorite band!

This was my 2nd time seeing them here and this venue is just magical.

Easy enough parking- and usually free.
Nice little walk/exercise up to venue.

Beautiful outdoor seating with views of the ocean. Great acoustics.

LOVE LOVE LOVE

4 stars overall
5 stars for the music
3+ stars for the food
 
My partner and I love the unique, quirky space that is Monterey Court. They continue to host great musicians pretty much every night of the week. That hasn't changed. :)

Since my last review, Greg, Kelly, and their team have made some positive changes that are important to share. The first is more coverage from the elements - you're still outside, but there is more shade and cooling/heat depending on the season. The next is service. Our recent experiences have been great with prompt delivery of food and frequent check-ins from the server. Finally, there are more vegetarian options available, including some specials!

Throughout a trying year, Monterey Court not only looked after the safety of their customers, but also listened to them to further improve customer experience. If you haven't already, come give them a try!

This place is legit. The service is sparse, but it gets the minimum done, and I'm fine with that. I love that there is always at least one table of Asian (Vietnamese, I assume, but idk) ladies getting down on enormous bowls of delicious shit in ways that make me jealous. I'm still not super good at being ok with slurping and picking up the bowl and whatnot, but that's on me. The pho is outstanding, the spring rolls are cheap and the best I've had, there is now at ATM inside. This place is fucking cool.

TL;DR: Traveling here to stay in an Airbnb? Highly recommend finding somewhere else.

__

Do you wish you could relive the ~nostalgia~ of MTV's Spring Break 1998? Do you love hearing 22 yr olds screaming at the top of their lungs all hours of the day and night? Do you love hearing dogs barking nonstop at 2am? Then look no further! 

All jokes aside, I really wish I had looked at reviews before I stayed here. 

It looks like most of the reviews here are from long-term tenants or Airbnb hosts, so I figured I'd give a report of what it's like to actually stay here. (This is not a review of the specific apartment where I stayed, rather the complex.) 

Think of this place like a glorified hostel with less rules. Chaos reigns mua ha ha! *insert meme of Elmo standing in front of fire*

The app to open all seven doors to get to your apartment is slow and poorly marked. 

Is it 11pm and you want to open up the hallway door to the another hallway? Ha ha, sucker, try to guess from the list of 25 different hallways! Can't find it? Too bad!

+1 star for cool decor, but it all honestly seems like a facade for a poorly run operation.

We order from Tiffin at work all the time and we love it. Tonight was the first time I ate at the restaurant -- fabulous.

If you don't get the Butter Chicken you will live your life regretting it. It's the best Indian dish I've ever had, and I have had my fill of Indian food.

If you want the best pizza dough this is the place! I love Italia because every time I have a larger group I know we can get seating in there and have a fantastic meal. I don't know why it's never crowded when we go, the food is so good, but it's always empty. We see quite a few people walk in each time we are there to get to go orders so maybe that's the bulk of the business. 
I always get the stromboli with feta, pepperoni, sausage, jalapeños and broccoli and it is perfect. I'm typically not a huge fan of marinara sauce but I think I could drink theres! 
The service is kind of spotty sometimes but I don't care about the service as much as I do about that dough! It is some of the most flavorful dough I've ever had.

Arguably the best cheesesteaks in Philadelphia. This is the least greasiest cheesesteak and I love the banana peppers and mushrooms on it. You would love the experience of ordering there and the staff yelling to get your orders. The service is very quick. It's usually a long line to order and there's limited tables and chairs inside and outside. Make sure to bring cash as they would only take cash. There is an atm inside the store. Usually you are better off ordering and eating it outside in the adjacent park. Price is very affordable and the amount of food is enormous. We took some home and placed it on the oven and it was still very good! I would definitely come back here. The location is outside center city and usually accessible by bus or car.

I had given up on this location over a year ago when I went in the the staff was making sandwiches with no gloves or utensils. I had contacted cooperate and was told that the person that was doing it was the manager and he was one of the best employees they had. With that type of response I stopped going. Well my son begged to go back. I gave in. To my surprise the entire staff has changed! .  The staff is friendly and use the gloves and utensils.  I believe I have been in here once a week for the past 3 weeks. 

I am so happy for the change! My sandwiches have been great

I love this place! Very friendly people at the front door.  Great selection of craft beers.  Fantastic menu. Our server was attentive and fun. Even my ranch salad dressing was the bomb.  I had a burger and will return to experiment with other options. 
    Some items are a little pricey but you get what you pay for.  The entire vibe is warm and friendly. I would gladly take guests here. Bravo Craft Street ! You score well in my book.

LOVE this place! Great place to bring your picnic lunch, set up a barbecue or a boil, and pass out in the sun from the yummy food. I love watching the boats/ships float/chug/paddle its way up and down the river. 

Things that would make this place better: Garbage cans with lids to keep birds and other animals out, and to keep the trash in (the wind blows a lot of it around).

My wife and I took our two dogs to an upscale vet clinic in our area.  Smiley staff, Senseo coffee pods for libation and spiffy printouts of everything we had done for our dogs.  The charge for some heartworm pills and shots were around $200.00.   I'm not even going to mention the emergency visit for our whippet Simon and the second mortgage I'm still paying off for that visit.  If all of this over-the-top expenses and hoopla for your pets makes your headspin, try Dr. Prier and his warm staff at Centre Square Veterinary Clinic.

This place is a throwback, and it's so welcoming that I drive out of my way to take our dogs there.  Dr. Prier has an obvious love for animals, and his care is experienced and warm.  His prices are reasonable, and there isn't a computer printout in the place.    We'll keep taking our dogs there and I'll bring my own coffee.

First of all I love the location. You feel like you are walking into a train station. There is a big clock on the wall and a train schedule just like you would find at a real train station. The restaurant itself is not the largest, but I haven't found many places in Nashville that are. Although it is small, the room has very tall ceilings and it feels large and somewhat impersonal. The fare is typical for a steak house with a bit of a southern flare. I had the filet with seasonal veggies and sweet potatoes. It was cooked perfectly and tasted very good. Although their wine list is not particularly impressive we did manage to find a pinot from Oregon that was pretty awesome. We were there pretty late and so they ran out of the cheesecake we really wanted but we had a chocolate souffle that was also great. This place is a good alternative for chains like Morton's or Ruth Chris.

This coffee shop is a neighborhood charm. There are lots of families here and can get packed early. Lots of people are mingling, studying, etc. they are a busy shop. My experience was good. I enjoyed my gibraltar while my gf enjoyed her vanilla latte. I love how there's a communal table along with a church across the street where kids can run around. It's a joyful atmosphere with good quality coffee.
Great original location in Cherry Hill. Delicious and Filling Crabcakes! Coconut Shrimp, Lobster Mashed potatoes, and love their chicken fingers too. Its very simple food but good

This was my 5th visit to New Orleans and my first visit here. I loved the outdoor café seating with great people watching and some live street music. The coffee was delicious, and the beignets were good, but the overall experience fell flat. I completely understand things are different during Covid, but months later the experience could use some work. You feel rushed, it was challenging to communicate or ask any questions and once you order you don't really know where to go or what to do. Eventually they give you a bag and your beverage and you're off.  

On one had I understand people are going to come here, it's a landmark, but on the other hand if they took a little bit of time to improve the overall experience, it would go a long way. I'm glad I went, but wish I had gone on one of my earlier trips.

Came here on a recommendation of a buddy of mine (also a Yelper) and he definitely did not steer me wrong. There was a 30 min wait so you know this place is good as the place is packed out with a line out the door. Wished they use the Yelp waitlist system to make things easier.

We started off with the Takoyaki as appetizers. They are great to start out with. Love the Japanese flakes they put on them. I got the Tan Tan Ramen. This dish wasn't really all that spicy as I expected, but had a really nice sweet taste blended in with it which I really liked. The noodles were on the soft side which I liked. I ended up drinking the broth because it's that good. My gf got the Terakawa Ramen, which is their signature ramen dish. It is a creamy broth and the texture of the noodle is on the firm side. The egg is fantastic and the pork belly is phenomenal (I swear to god, I did not eat two bowls of ramen).

I highly recommended this spot like my Yelp buddy did. You can't go wrong with great ramen like this shop.

They have a great variety of food choices and a friendly staff. You can sit at the bar, a table, a booth or outside. Volleyball was playing on the TV. I had the gogi bowl and my husband had the rodeo burger and I got a side of chips. It was yummy. Would love to go again. Wish they were on my side of town.

I love shopping at Aldi. I always leave with more than I went in for. I tend to shop at this Aldi as it's the one closest to me right now but that will soon change. The store is bright, airy and clean. I was hoping to find the candles I got last time but alas they are no longer in stock and I have checked two stores. Aldi always has a great as election of fruit, vegetables and even things you didn't know you needed.

Such a cute stop on State Street by Macys! Tons of affordable baubles such as cute rings, hair accesories and i found cupcake and hamburger necklaces! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/AYSZCdB7oUiKMaOy0yud6g?select=XPbBmk-Mu2gx0jyVW_QvdQ

*i love yelper anne marie p's perfect description that this is a Claires on crack!http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/AYSZCdB7oUiKMaOy0yud6g?select=RFtz6rAlfQlX_erXcohcDQ

On a recent visit to Philly with my vegan cousin, we happened to accidentally stumble into V Street completely unplanned. It was centrally located just 3 blocks away from our hotel, so we ended up eating there 3 days in a row, it was that good. 

The first day, we were just planning on getting drinks, and then ended up getting some snacks after realizing it was a 100% vegan restaurant. I ordered the Pico and La Brea cocktail with the activated charcoal, making the drink look pitch black. It tastes like adults lemonade and was refreshing and delicious. My cousin ordered the Jade Rabbit, and she was not a fan, as she thought it was way too floral tasting. We also tried the Peruvian Fries, which I highly recommend. They're definitely on the spicy side, but they're a perfect snack when you're drinking cocktails. We also tried their daily soft serve, which was a tahini soft serve with cherries. It tasted kind of like peanut butter, and we both really liked it. 

The second night we sat down for a full dinner. My cousin tried the Dan Dan noodles, which were definitely on the spicy side, but since she loves spicy food, she adored them. I ordered the smoked beet langos, which were probably my favorite thing we ordered the whole time we were in Philadelphia. The combination of the soft bread and the sauerkraut remoulade was so flavorful and delicious. If you're debating ordering them, definitely do. You won't be disappointed! 

We also stopped by for Saturday brunch, where we got the Byblos Bubbles cocktail (their take on a mimosa), which was bubbly and a little sweet, and basically the perfect brunch cocktail. We split an order of the okinamiyaki fries, which felt to me like a vegan poutine. Definitely recommend those! We also tried the Korean fried tempeh tacos, which I also highly recommend! It tasted almost exactly like a fried fish taco. We both inhaled them and seriously debated ordering seconds. We split the grilled avocado, with scrambled tofu soft tacos. The grilled avocado was delicious, and the tacos were also very pleasant. 

Vegan or not, this place is amazing.

Came across this place after a night out drinking. It's a bit pricey for some tacos but I really liked their chorizo tacos ! Very flavorful and probably the best chorizo tacos I've had. My boyfriend got the al pastor tacos and we thought they were okay. A bit fatty for my taste. I love how they have different hot sauces you can try. I thought their strawberry got sauce was pretty different and unique.

First visit here.  Cool looking building from the outside.  Inside look pretty neat as well.   I tried the sausage and beef sandwich, it sounded strange but looked and tasted pretty good.   Fast service.  Friendly staff.  The staff wear a cool uniform.  Love there stush hat.  The ambiance was truly amazing.  Lots of famous people been there.  It's based from the Chicago area. Great food.  Will try it again

The name speaks for itself. Walking into the  Zen Den, expect everyone to be chilled and relaxed. This is pretty much the only place where sense of urgency is a bad thing. If you aren't in a rush as all the patrons don't seem to be, this place is an awesome place to just let time slow down a bit. They're highly supportive of local businesses as you can see posters and brochures of upcoming events on display next to where they host live music. Staff is polite and friendly when ordering. 

Ordered and hot chocolate and since it's Yelp Bucks County weekend, they were running a special for $5 grilled cheese and cup of soup. I got Gouda for the grilled cheese and a cup of stuffed cabbage soup. I love stuffed cabbage and it is a great take of a "deconstructed" version of the real thing. Careful! It comes out piping hot! Like needs to rest for a few minutes hot. Grilled cheese came out perfect and toasty. The hot chocolate was ok, unfortunately I'm not a coffee drinker cause that's what everyone seems to get.

$5 spend limit for credit card charge and they don't take Amex.

During the pandemic I've decided to do my own nails..... 1. Because everything was shutdown and 2. I'm new to Reno. 
Oh how I missed going to a nail salon. Two of my friends recommended nirvana and I am so grateful!! Coming from  the Bay Area my expectations were pretty high for the quality of dip nails.  This nail salon is excellent, if you get the talented nail tech. 
Super excited to have found a great nail tech with skills. This is extremely important with dip nails, if they don't know how to do your nails right it can crack or chip in the matter of 2 weeks which is a total waste. 

I also love their deluxe pedicure. They really pamper you.

Yeeroh was such a good takeout experience! My partner and I shared the mix grill platter (which had Greek sausage, pork souvlaki, chicken souvlaki,  beef and lamb kebab, pork belly, all piled on top of fries and pita bread with onions and tomatoes). It came with tzatziki sauce as well on the side. We also ordered a side of dolmades and a small side eggplant dish and we absolutely loved it all. The dolmades were slightly sweet, which was a little different than other dolmades that we've had, and the eggplant was also delicious- it wasn't baba ganoush like we thought it might be but still good, more on the bright and pickled kind of flavor spectrum. The mix grill platter was plenty of food for the two of us- they really piled in the fries and meats. The only thing is that I kind of wish they had given us actual pita pockets on the side and not sliced triangles of it on the bottom where it got slightly lost and soggy.  Overall though, would highly recommend if you're craving Greek food, everything was cooked to perfection and absolutely delicious and fresh tasting. The sausages were our favorite out of the mix and we'll be back for more!

Food is YUMMM! I loved their idea of how we can build the platter. Falafel and humus are very good!!
I think this location even offers sitting diner but I've never eaten in the restaurant. I have always ordered to-go.
A little pricey, but I love the feel of the place. Their food is pretty tasty! They have great beers, personable staff, and awesome garlic fries! Worth a stop or two.

I love this place. The donuts are cheap and fresh. They always seem to be open when I want one, unlike ALL of the donut places downtown that close at 1-2pm. The downside is that it is cash only! Parking can be hard, but every time I just park at the gas station.

If you have never been here before I suggest trying to go at an off time for them, like after morning rush so that you aren't hustled through and have time to look at everything. They have your basic donuts, some cupcakes, pecan rolls, cream horn, and Mary Ann's. 

Most people who tend to come here have been coming to Longs for forever so they know what they want. It always seems crazy busy in the mornings (till about 10) and then around lunch and dinner. 

Overall, try this place out! Good, cheap donuts with no frill. They have long hours so pretty much whenever you feel like a donut they will be there for you!

So I remember there used to be a wing zone on Deballivere by the delmar loop area. It was gone. So I was happy to see this location off of Jefferson.  It's really nice.. The shopping complex is pretty much new. So they have a small seating area. They prepared the food to order. So expect a wait. Or call ahead. I will say my order was worth the wait.  The menu selection is nice, & big. I love all the wing flavors.  Lots of variety on that subject.  I ordered the the 10pc boneless wings with fries n Texas toast. My Friend ordered the 10pc. Wings with fies n Texas toast. The sauces I got was nuclear habbenero, n tame. Not a fan of tame. Loved the other 1. It wasn't overpriced.  But a few dollars more than u'd wanna spend

If you are looking for cute things local, this is your spot. They have decor decked out with Dunedin, Caladesi Island. As well as coastal decor, toys for kids, and great stuff you can get for presents for yourself and loved ones.

One of the ladies greets you in the front and she's very nice and helpful. 

Definitely a cute store located next door to a couple other awesome ones such as Spoiled Rotten.

Located on the side closer to the Edgewater Park and Sea Sea Riders side of Main Street. There is parking by the park also. Enjoy!

I was excited to try this restaurant after looking at the Yelp reviews and pictures but I wasn't really pleased at all!

First, it took over 30 minutes to find parking, so we ending up finding a parking lot and paying $18 for 2 hour parking.  Although this has nothing to do with the Restaurant I wanted to point this out, as this was my first experience with New Orleans Parking.

The restaurant is very small.  When we arrived at the restaurant it was a total of 5 people with us and we were waiting on 6 more people.  I realized this was maybe not the best restaurant after seeing how small this place was but after looking for parking, finding a parking lot and then walking 3 blocks to this place and traveling with kids  we were exhausted and I was still morning time so we stayed here.

There was no wait when the 5 of us arrived, so we were seated quickly.  The tables they have seat 4 so we had to combine to tables.  We noticed the restaurant filling up as we were waiting on 4 others to arrive with us so we went ahead and ordered our food.  We waited about 45 minutes before our food came and it was cold!  I love Eggs Benedict, so I was really excited to try the Blackened Catfish eggs Benedict with spinach! I was so disappointed in this dish, not only was my food cold but the catfish was not blackened and it was under seasoned.  My mom ordered french toast and this bread was about 4 inches thick, and tasted very dense!  She ended up ordering pancakes afterwards. 

Then on top of the poor quality of the food, a waitress came to our table and informed us we had been there long enough and they had other customers waiting so I was time for us to leave!! These were literally there exact words!!  Once the other 4 of our party came they waited in line about 15 minutes and were told they couldn't sit with us, so they were seated in another area.  We ended up leaving shortly after but I was so disappointed and upset that they told us to leave in such and abrupt manner!!  I won't be returning to this restaurant on out next visit to New Orleans.

Consistently good. Everything from the apps to the sushi has been wonderful. The staff is friendly, the byob adds a fun element to a traditional sushi dinner and the menu options other than sushi are creative.
Do not miss the Ramen Burger: pork belly covered in hoisin sauce topped with lettuce and tomato sandwiched between two ramen "patties". For the ultimate Asian food lover. 
I also discovered the sushi bento box today- not only do you get 5 pieces of nigiri, you also get two pieces of cali roll, a ginger salad, edamame, shumai, dumplings and rice.... and miso soup. FOR ONLY 11 dollars.

The only reason why Makiman takes 4/5 is that their sushi could be cheaper. 6 rolls for $6 is meh.

Reminiscing about living & Santa Barbara & Sam's To Go came to mind. 

Many moons ago, when I was much younger, I worked in a prime location in SB off Hitchcock Way, as a professional match maker. One of the best things about being where I worked was the proximity of GREAT food spots near by.

Whenever I was in the mood for a great sandwich, which was about 1-2 times a week, I would order from here. 

At the time there were 2 Sam's To Go sandwich shops & I believe the owners were family members that were rivals (I thought this funny when the owner told me all the reasons why his sandwich shop was better than the others). 

Anyways, I digress. My ALL-TIME-FAVE at the time was the #27 Avo, Turkey, Bacon & Cheese (I called it the ABCT- even though it also had lettuce & tomato). This had EVERYTHING you wanted! Even though I am now a plant-based vegan, just thinking about this sandwich still makes my mouth water! 

I always ordered a large, & even that wasn't enough for me! 

Just go! Try any one of the sandwiches. All that I've had were outstanding. I'm not even sure why they were so great, it's just a sandwich, but it was also more than that. It was the perfect amount of everything. The meat, bread ration was perfect & they seemed to always have the right amount of mayo & mustard. Maybe it was just how much love & care they put into making each one. They had so much pride in what they did. Fond memories, I will always have!

I'm happy that I got a chance to try the good here! Nando's is apparently a South African food chain (or at least that is my understanding), but the food is Portuguese? So it is a South African Portuguese place! Supposedly the main seller here is the Peri-Peri flavour that they use on the foods. 

The place was really cool on the inside! The decor was funky and very green! I love the colour green and it gave the restaurant a bright and trendy vibe. 

They give you a table and number and then you order at the front counter. I'm not really sure why they do it that way? But it seemed to work OK. I got the veggie burger with LOTS of hot sauce. The sauce is flavourful but wasn't as spicy as I thought. BUT DON'T WORRY - there are 4 different hot sauces at every table to make your food better. I also had garlic mashed potatoes which were really yummy. My friend had the chicken livers and he said it was delicious. A lot of my friends actually eat here all the time! 

They cleared our plates right away and then we were out of there. All in all it only took about half an hour, the food comes out quick! So that's always a plus in my books! :)

Lovely smaller airport to fly into. Usually pretty easy to fly in and out of. 
As you walk the airport, you will pass lovely memorabilia hang including guitars and live music.

I usually visit the Gandy store and love how friendly the staff is - always greeted with a HELLO when you walk in and "can I get you a sample of something to try" before I even get to the yogurt...

We walk into this one and don't get greeted and no one asks if there's anything we want to try.  I had to ask to try something.  The guy behind the counter was busy at the register but he did say he would help just as soon as he was done, the twig behind the counter didn't many any eye contact nor respond to the request and was obviously too into herself to be helpful.

The guy did give us a taste of what we each wanted to try and then had to get back to the register.  The twig still no help.

By this time, we got our cups and started filling with yogurt and then went to the toppings bar.  The counter was dirty, the cherries were practically empty, the pineapples looked like hell and then (I wish I got a pic of this)....the caramel in the squeeze bottle was so disgusting full of caramel on the outside of the container, I couldn't even touch it to show the guy it needed to be cleaned.  He apologized and then asked the twig to help clean it up.  She took it in the back and apparently washed the top but when it came back to us it had water INSIDE the squeeze bottle!   The guy apologized and brought it back to replace the entire bottle of caramel.  Gross!

I will never go back to this particular location again.  The ambiance outside has much to be desired as well.

Very small but they have fresh veggies, tortillas, chips meat and cheese etc.. on Saturday and Sunday they have cooked meat of different varieties that are delicious! I love that they are right down the street from my house. Stop in and try a sample of food during the weekend.

Krispy Kreme Donuts sent me a coupon for a free donut and small drink for my birthday for being in their Eclub..so I took advantage of it. 
I went through their drive thru window and I ordered a lemon filled donut and small coca cola (not much of a coffee drinker) and gave her the coupon...she wished me a happy birthday and I took the food to work with me for a breakfast before I started my shift.

The donut was very fresh and it was so good. I highly recommend this for a quick pick me up or a small breakfast...I stop there once a month and get two dozen to take to my co-workers as a gift..They love this place too!!! and the drive thru is so convenient !!!

The prices you see on the yelp menu are not up to date.

Very tasty tofu.  Their tofu are in large generous chunks and  served in a tasty broth. I got mild as in little spicy, and it wasn't spicy at all so I think it's safe to go on the spicier side.  We got the beef soft tofu and the mushroom soft tofu.  It tastes the same, just different topping.  For mushroom, I think they use black mushrooms which I am not a fan.  Nonetheless, I love the flavor and tofu. This may be my new comfort food.  It's like chicken noodle soup. I could curl up in a blanket on the couch all day and have this.  Not sure if it says on the menu, but it comes with rice :-)

I didn't give it 5 because the BBQ squid was an utter disappointment.  It came in large pieces and was not sliced. It's also just topped with kimchi like something. I don't recommend the BBQ squid.

Fat Ham was delicious. Almost like a country comfort tapas. You should get 3 plates each to share and you'll definitely be full.
Hummus- decent, but didn't wow. I like the homemade bread.
Oyster sliders were outrageous good! Would come back just for sliders! Perfect crunchy fried oyster and flavor balance. Yum!
Shrimp and grits were delicious. Smooth grits. Good flavors.
Hot chicken was HOT! Not in love with the white bread that comes with, but that was probably to calm your mouth down. Juicy chicken, nice crispy skin.
Golden rice with oxtail was decent. Interesting with a sweeter flavor. Tender oxtail meat.
Mac and cheese was nice and creamy. BBQ chips on top was a nice touch.
All the food was very good. I'd come back for the fried oysters. 
Service was also good. Friendly and attentive.
Decor was chill. Small space, but they make it work. Wall of bourbon! Live the wood plates.
Definitely will return one day, but not dying to come back right away.

Lots of seats outside, and it is in a shaded area.  This Starbucks reminds me of the one at El Con except with a drive-thru so it is a bit more chaotic.  It is probably not a place you want to sit and read quietly.  There are a few couch chairs.  

The staff is excellent.  If you are thinking about getting a modification to your normal drink, they will make you a regular drink if you absolutely dislike the new drink.  I love this about the employees.

Yes, their alligator cheesecake was ALL THAT.  I had my doubts, but once I ate my first bite, I was a believer.  It's basically like a super moist, very flavorful piece of quiche with a lovely creamy gravy on top.  I don't know how they get the texture of the "cheesecake" so moist but it's really good.

They serve some freshly made corn muffins with a really crispy top and some yummy garlic butter on top, as well as some lightly dressed spinach which was a welcomed, great side since everything else is so heavy.  I ordered their "Godzilla" for my dinner entree, which was a special of the day.  It was a massive soft shell crab deep fried and served with fried green tomatoes and some coleslaw/greens on the bottom.  Everything was cooked well, I don't think I'm a fan of soft shell crab but I ate as much as I could.

My server was awesome, really helpful and attentive.  Seems like an authentic New Orleans joint, worth a visit!

Listen up, burger makers:  THIS is how to make a veggie burger!  Don't assume that all vegetarians desire minimal toppings, a dry, multigrain bun, and a low-moisture cheese (I'm looking at you Delux Burger).  We actually do like additional toppings.  And we really do enjoy flavour.  And this is why I go to Rodeo Burgers.

I love that at Rodeo Burgers, everything is customizable, the toppings and the patty.  I don't get nickled and dimed for making substitutions (veggie patty for beef or guac for pancetta, like at other burger joints), and I don't get charged for toppings I don't want (I hate paying for bacon that never touches my patty).  Some toppings cost extra at Rodeo Burger, but my favourites, the sauteed mushrooms and carmelized onions are complimentary.  Love that!

Overall, the burgers are good, not the best veggie ever, but better than many.  The patties are a bit thin and tend to fall apart when eating, and if you load up with toppings like I do, then you are dealing with a very messy burger.  But I guess that's part of the fun.  The fries are fantastic, and I thought the portion sizes were fine.

If I craving a burger, or just want a tasty, inexpensive meal in the University area, I head to Rodeo Burgers.  This is the one burger joint in town that values the vegetarian as much as the omnivore.  Thanks, Rodeo Burgers!

I love this place.

It's fast, inexpensive, BYOB, and the pizza is excellent. Pizza's are roughly $7 and definitely filling and way better than Ardmore Pizza (gross). The shop isn't huge, but it's never hard finding a seat, and it's cool that they make it BYOB. I usually go with one of the standard pizzas (they've got a list of 5-7), but you can alternatively get anything you want - think Subway, but 5000x better. They pop the pie into a conveyor oven and you've got a pizza in a couple minutes!

if you're looking for an economical satisfying lunch... AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!!!

lol i have very bipolar feelings about this place.  i want to love it but i really can't .. mostly because my wallet won't let me.  so i stopped in today to grab a salad.  never been.. but saw some glowing reviews on yelp so i thought "heeey what the duck, lemme try!"

so i got the sunflower seed caesar salad.... $13.50 after tax O_O!!!!! my insides ached a little bit T_T;; but partially my fault too b/c i just love trying new places...  surely, the salad is more unique than your ubiquitous saladworks.  the sunflower seed caesar is mostly kale based, finely chopped, and mixed with a lighter hue of romaine.  it comes with dried up shiitake mushrooms that taste like bacon and some crunchy peas that reminds me of those wasabi peas.... it's served with a miso dressing which adds to the nice fusion mix.  everything tastes mighty fine.  not gonna lie, it definitely tastes snazzy compared to your regular saladworks.  but i really dunno if the taste and its fancy organic properties can truly justify the premium price! heck i don't even like that much dressing on my salad and i doused the whole saucer of dressing into my bowl to get every ounce of what i paid for.  (btw DON"T DO THIS! b/c it ended up being too salty and ... spicy?!) 

so all in all, the cafe has a beautiful organic setting.  very down to earth and relaxing ambiance.  not a bad place to chill on a sunday afternoon.  but sadly for me, i cannot afford this luxury salad daily.  i'm sure it's aimed to a different target group since it is located at the heart of center city next to rittenhouse.  i probably wont be returning anytime soon unfortunately.. 

just trying to give people a heads up before coming here~

I'm so glad we have this place in the Loop. My initial thoughts when I first walked in, were "wow... this is absolutely beautiful! Wait a second. This used to be Brandt's?!" Soft colors, great lighting, and a bar I wouldn't mind sitting at while sipping some wine.

I need to come back during dinner because I feel like that experience would be even better than lunch... I only have a couple of gripes as far as the atmosphere goes. First, why do restaurant owners let customers eat in complete silence?! I knew going for a late lunch it'd probably be quiet in there, but I just think a little bit of music (instrumental, something, anything) makes the experience seem a little bit better. Second, our server came up and just asked us what we wanted. I feel like with a new restaurant, a short blurb or explanation of the concept is really nice, that way you know what they're going for. Our waitress was lovely, I just would've liked to get the DL on the place before I dove into the menu.

My eyes always go straight for the cheese plate, so that was up first. It was definitely one of the best ones I've had! To my surprises, all three cheeses were VERY strong instead of at least one being mild, but I loved that. I'm not sure exactly what they were, but one was a bleu cheese drizzled in honey... yes please. It was served with house-made focaccia and met all expectations. For lunch I had the spinach salad, which was extremely simple but in a good kind of way. Accompanied by a dollop (I hate that word) of house-made cheese, pine nuts, and other goodies, I definitely got my dose of phyto-nutrients and it tasted great while doing it.

I will definitely come back for dinner! So glad to have Nico in the neighborhood.

Attended a wine tasting that was a lot of fun and then had dinner later. Lots of yummy food and the menu is lighter than at their "main" restaurant. It's also near theaters so it's a good option for dinner before you go to a show. Loved the mushroom & truffle oil flatbread appetizer.

I joined this gym to prove a point! I'm a lunk. I am. I'm an undercover lunk. I've been building muscles for three years. I used to power lift until I pulled my back out, now I just lift heavy weights and have a great time. And eat. I eat a lot. 

The gym owner at my old gym upset me with his misogynistic comments and consistent inability to take constructive feedback. I went there for 17 months. I made some fantastic progress, and I'm a natural- regular gym rat if you will. I love being in the gym.

Anyhow, yes. I'm a lunk. PF gets such a bad name from my big male counterparts. Let's face it. I'll never use a 110 lb dumbbell. I'm off of the oly bars for a bit, due to injury- so we are going light weight more reps. Guess what? Still a lunk. This. Gym. Has. Everything. Except a squat rack. Dumbbells, loaded barbells, machines, lots of cables, benches, etc. 

The staff here is super friendly. They were patient during registration. They answer all of my questions, including my "do you guys really have Pizza?" Question.  They answered with a "you don't like Pizza?!?!" Omg of course I do. Who doesn't like pizza?! I just hope it's not from Papa Johns. 

Me teenager has been with me free with my black card twice now. I love that it gives us this time together, and that he's completely comfortable working out here. I don't think it would be the case at my old gym. 

Here's to many many workouts together PF. To the naysayers, I say that you can get a good workout in anywhere. I will revisit the squat rack issue at a later time.

So I have to say....this was my first time here and I truly enjoyed myself. The ambience is so chill and laid back. I don't know what the place was like before the new owner took over but I can say these guys know what they're doing. The hookah was awesome! I had peach-mint, which is what I always order. My fav!! With the pineapple his time. Never tried that. Honestly I couldn't tell the difference. I'll probably pass on it next time. 

Anyway....we had a private room. Which was cool and exclusive feeling. The seats could be cushioned up a bit, they were pretty hard on my bum. And maybe some pillows?? Just to give it a little more laid back feel. I felt a bit stiff sitting up the way I had to. But still wasn't upset about it. 

It's was a bit warm when I went in, but our awesome waitress, Emily, turned the air up. She was awesome. Did I say that already??! But yea...very attentive and informative. It was my first time there so she gave me a good run down of the joint. 

As far as food goes...a friend I was with knew more about this spot and so I let them order for me. 

Lamb chops plate and a shrimp plate

Both came with salad and hummus. With bread. It was my first time trying hummus and all I can say is I'm not really a fan. I don't eat salad, sorry don't sue me. But the shrimp were cooked to perfection! I mean they were so plump and big and juicy and totally not overcooked... Just perfect!! Also the lamp chops were tender and moist and super flavorful!! 

I really loved this place... I can definitely see myself returning alone just chill out get some work done on the laptop... Free Wi-Fi by the way... smoke a small hookah, eat some juicy shrimp...And just vibe out....

I'm from Chicago and I went to Indianapolis with a friend on a day trip. She selected this place based on the reviews, and let me tell you that if I could give The Eagle more than five stars, I would. A day later, my friend and I are still raving about how wonderful the food was, how big the drinks were, and how good the service was. 

There was a 5 minute wait when we arrived, just for a quick clearing of a table, and then the waitress was very helpful in telling us her recommendations and accommodating us with what we needed. The cocktails are $10, and they're HUGE and tasty, so for this price, I was super impressed. The food itself was amazing. We had a half chicken (what they're famous for), mac and cheese, cornbread, and mashed potatoes, and the combo of it all was just the best. If you enjoy a southern style of food, then you will LOVE the food here.

They have indoor and outdoor seating, and it's just a really large area, so I can't imagine a longer wait than 15-20 tops during anytime, anyday. I can't wait to go back to Indianapolis and to The Eagle. Give it a try, you won't be sorry!

Omg!!!!!! I'm NOT a fan of breakfast food usually but this was soooo damn good. Like how y'all? How???? And (unpopular opinion) I'm also usually not big on NOLA food. So I'm extra picky when I'm in town but (popular opinion) I do LOVE New Orleans. 

Important note: I don't eat meat and my husband is vegan. So we both had an array of meatless options and loveddddd it. The breakfast potatoes were amazing and the coffee and the tofu scramble. And the espresso was great. 

The service also was awesome and everyone was really helpful and welcoming. We loved it overall!

A great Asian fusion place in little old Warminster. It replaced what was the best Chinese place (David, you're missed) and has taken over as Asian king of the last stop on the R2.

The place is sprawling -- more open space than when it was David's, mostly because the gigantic fish tank that once lined the back wall is no more. Never overly busy (which is a bummer because I'd like it to stay in business), so I've always been seated immediately. The staff is very friendly, sticking around to chat for a few minutes each time they come to the table rather than just take you order and move on.

Have been for dinner several times with friends and family and every time has been a positive experience for all diners. I'm a big fan of their pad thai, which is what I almost always order (because there's always enough left over for lunch the next day). I wasn't a fan of the crispy duck in raspberry cognac sauce, but the Yazmin Peking Duck served with Hong Kong style buns is great. The other times I've ventured away from the pad thai, it's been very yummy, especially the honey walnut chicken and bun dac biet. Yazmin is BYOB and they'll chill your wine, if you please.

On a few occasions when my party has declined to order dessert, we were served complimentary desserts anyway.
